story:
Hi!

My name is Ames and I am a photographer living in New York City. I am really lucky to work and live in this amazing city, but I am more lucky to have my partner, Cougar, by my side as we both transition from Female to Male.

One of the biggest parts of my transition is to have top surgery which means to reconstruct my chest to have a male appearance. This will make me feel more comfortable in my own body and aligned with my gender. I am scheduled to have the procedure on December 23rd, 2015 with Dr. Garramone in Florida. Unfortunately, our health insurance doesn't cover top surgery or anything related to transgender health care, so I will be paying out of pocket for the surgery. 

Surgery Costs:

Surgery: $7300

Travel: $700

To help defray the costs, I am offering perks from GORGE! (www.gorgebyamesbexxx.com)

My recent solo exhibition, GORGE, is a photo journey about food and obsession. In photographing a diverse group of people and food, I wanted to challenge what we consider “Gorgeous. We struggle daily with acceptance of perceived physical flaws, but beauty comes in many flavors and forms.


Perks

$25: 4x6 signed print of your choice from GORGE

$50: Matted 5x7 signed print of your choice from GORGE

$100: Limited Edition 18x20 signed print of your choice from GORGE

$150: Limited Edition 18x20 framed print & a matted 5x7 signed print from GORGE

$200: Limited Edition 18x20 framed print and a 4x6 polaroid collage canvas from GORGE (Only 6 total. Polaroids were shot during the shoots)

Thank you so much for all the support and love!

-Ames

story:
A quest to document the endangered and disappearing scenic skylines of historic, rural Utah.

 

My name is Robert Stevens. I am an award-winning journalist and photographer living and working in Utah. I am also an FAA-licensed unmanned aircraft pilot.

My goal with this crowdfunding campaign is to facilitate the use of my experience as a drone pilot, photographer and journalist to document aerial-perspective photographs of historic, rural Utah for posterity.

As managing editor of award-winning Utah weekly newspaper, The Sanpete Messenger, I became aware of how rapidly Utah is developing—with factories and big housing developments popping up all over the state. Even Silicone Valley is now facing competition from the progress of Utah's "Silicone Slopes."

Right here in the very rural Sanpete County, with its farms and tiny little towns and cities, the impact of development on the landscape when viewed from above is evident.

Drones provided me access to an elevated perspective most people don’t have. It became obvious to me that the beautiful and historic landscapes in rural Utah will become spotted, then dense with development in just a few short years.

I have made it my goal as a professional in the fields of journalism, photography, and unmanned aircraft to capture  the essence of rural Utah from a soaring, elevated perspective in sharp, vibrant photographs before it’s too late.

The reason I am turning to crowdfunding for help with this project is simple—I want to do it right!

I need to rent the best aerial optics and equipment I can obtain, take the time to capture, develop and curate the collection of images to be the best they can be, and then print them to be appreciated when the beautiful patches of earth they depict have long since been developed. 

I need to do it justice.

If Utah continues to prosper and grow—like I know it will—someday these beautiful landscapes will vanish forever, so please help me accomplish my goal of preserving them through a combination of time-honored methods and cutting-edge aerial photographic technology.

The project will focus on the epic scenery that is still abundant in the Mormon Pioneer National Heritage Area. This stretch of land along the U.S. 89 corridor remains one of the most beautiful and historic places in the state. Historic monuments like the Manti Temple dot the landscape. Equally beautiful and endangered subjects like small town culture, agriculture and heritage livestock culture also make the area a hotbed of beauty...For now.

To get together a collection worthy of its purpose, I estimate my costs will be around $3,000, so I have set my goal to that amount. If I raise more than $3,000, it will mean I can document more beauty, and in higher quality.

If you contribute $20 or more to the campaign, you will be listed as a contributor in the free-for-all online gallery that I will make the collection available through. If you contribute $50 or more, you will get a hi-res digital image of your choice from the collection. If you contribute $100 or more, you will get a signed and numbered 11"x14" print of your choice from a curated list of collection highlights.

Besides the free online gallery, it is my hope that the collection can be made into a hardbound book. All contributors towards the campaign will receive a 10% discount off the final sale price of the book.

There will be challenges (inclement weather, potential equipment malfunctions, etc.), but if you help make this project happen, I give you my word that I will use every ounce of my skills and all my training and practice as a professional photojournalist and commercial unmanned aircraft pilot, along with the most professional equipment possible, to make this a beautiful aerial photojournalism collection worthy of appreciating for generations to come.

story:
Long Term Goals & What Photography Means to Me

I have a few goals that I'm working on:

  • Having proper functional equipment to provide top notch service.
  • Having printed materials to offer like calendars, cards, books etc...
  • Open a studio

Photography has always been a part of me and my life. It's an escape for me but I also love giving people photos they can be proud of and cherish for generations. There is nothing better to see a bride or high school senior who gets their photos and says, "I never knew I could look that good." I love all aspects and each has their own value to us and our history.

Immediate Need and What You Get

Here is what I really need now:

  • I need to replace some broken equipment. Specifically important lenses.
  • Building stock so that I can easily and quickly sell and ship merchandise
  • Advertising Funds
  • Perks will be my art, discounted or free photography sessions and a 101 class.

The Impact

Investing in local art and community is so important:

  • The world needs more art and supporting local businesses helps drive a healthy economy.
  • I'd like to get to a place where I can donate my time and art to other causes like homeless outreach. Everyone deserves to have a picture of themselves they can be proud of. Giving back to my community is very important to me.
  • Documenting people, places and things is important to our history. Portraits of people, landscape photos, lifestyle and street photography all serve a function to the documentation of our culture and history. 

Risks & Challenges

Nothing is ever without risk. The one thing is that people will always want pictures of themselves. Investing in photography is pretty simple but important. 

  • The biggest struggle is keeping up with a saturated market. That said, I'm a driven individual who keeps up with latest techniques, styles and trends to make sure I'm able to offer the best product I can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! 

  • If you can't afford to contribute you can still help me by sharing my campaign.
  • Word of mouth is the best advertising!
  • Sharing on social media is easy and free!

story:
Campaign and Background

I'm so glad that our paths have crossed, and to have found you here on my campaign. I'm on the verge of following my dreams, but am reluctant to break the bank. I could try my luck with my business line of credit, but I wanted to offer everyone the opportunity to be a part of this journey with me.

I created a DBA in 2018 after casually taking photos for a few years. Things have been going slow for me creatively as I focus on my day job. I have a backlog of so many great images that I would like to see printed, and which I believe other people want to view. If this campaign goes well, I will be able to develop my online print store for my website: www.f10.media.

I have a larger goal in mind to someday buy my own printer someday. I'm hoping this launch will get me into a position to buy one with the profits which I see from everyone's help here.

I have goals and a vision, but cannot get there without your help! Thank you so much for considering.

 

I need your help, and I want to say Thank You

I am partial to larger sized prints, and exploring different materials. I think the images I capture demand a large medium - to stand, to stare. I know Wrapped Canvas prints are economical for the size, so I will probably start there. I would like to get at least 10 prints made, each will be over $100 each.

I am adamant about thanking everyone who helps me reach my goal. Find my IG handle in the FAQ :)

If I don't reach my goal, I will use whatever I do receive to amplify my online store, or hopefully make at least one print.

 

The Impact

Aside from my online shop, I have an art show coming up where I will hang some prints in my friend's studio/salon. I currently have 4 "show prints" which I don't sell, and are a little banged up. They look fine hung on the wall, and I will use those for the show. However, I would like to hang more than 4 prints.

This project holds great value to me as I strive to become a full-time photographer. It is almost impossible to get ahead at the moment, trying to save up to invest in my business while also making ends meet in my everyday life.

I would not know how to begin to thank you for your contribution. It would mean so, so much. Contributors who make back this campaign with at least $25 will be offered a virtual hangout where I can express my utmost appreciation for you :)

 

Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned, my DBA has a business account at the bank where I could use my credit to invest in making large format prints. While the reward of selling prints is worth the risk, I am just not in a position to do this right now. I'm not sure how long it would take me to save up enough of what's left over from my paychecks to create an online shop.

I believe my images hold such beauty that clients/customers would love to hang them, and continue viewing them past a show, or in real life. I have great confidence in my ability to be a photographer, it is just so economically difficult for me to fully dive into at the moment.

If this campaign doesn't take off, or if I receive $0, I will continue to explore ways to develop an online store for my prints. I will not rest until my art is printed and hung all around the world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have made it this far in my message, I thank you greatly. If you are unable to contribute I would still be so grateful if you shared my campaign within your circles. Perhaps your family and friends and colleagues are able to help, and I can thank you all for your part in helping me make my dreams a reality.

I think the world needs my art, and I think the world needs you, too.

story:
Who We Are

One Communication Design student with the will to make the best out of the lockdown period and unite people into an interesting project, supported by a few more motivated creative minds. 

Short Summary

What do you see right now through your window? What is your small escape during this difficult time…?

We want to create a virtual world trip, available to everybody. How? By collecting photos of what people see through their window.  All the gathered pictures will be combined in an interactive illustration, creating a “window to the world”, where everyone would have the possibility to “teleport” themselves, even just for a moment, and suddenly we’ll be all together… everywhere.

This is a project about bringing people together and supporting each other in times like this. So why not create something beautiful out of it.

Let’s see what the world sees.

What We Need & What You Get

The funding of this project will allow us to make this happen (hopefully in a month or two). Designing, programming and developing the website with the help of creators ready to represent the concept in the best way possible.

If we don't reach our entire goal we will still try to represent the whole collection of the gathered pictures, just in a different form.

If the donation exceeds the given amount, we would love to send one or two people on an adventure to one of the “windows” (locations) from around the world!

The great part is that through this website each one of you will be able “to have an endlessly changing horizon, for each day to have a new and different sun”.

The Impact

We believe that turning this idea into reality will leave a positive impact on everyone, make us discover the world in an unusual way and be a reminder of how thankful we should be for the smallest and most normal things in life.

Risks & Challenges

This project is really exciting for us and our team is super motivated but of course, times right now are a bit difficult for everyone and things don't always go smoothly. Finding the right people to bring this to reality might be tough, especially if we don't have enough resources to give back to those who help us.

However, we all have the energy and creativity to go through this & make something meaningful and touching for society. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your help does matter to us, no matter what kind it is.

The easiest way is to go on our website and upload your window view. You can share this campaign with your friends and spread the word. 

If you want to be part of our team and help us with design, programming, creative ideas, project management, social media or whatever else you think you are good at that can be in use, please don't hesitate to contact us. 

Stay grateful & take care!

~

Find us on Instagram @wttw.club

story:
As Seen On

Awards

The "FRAGMENT 8" Retro Camera

"Tell Your Stories with Fragment"

We use the word “Fragment” to present the concept of “Slice of Life”. The concept “Slice of Life” originated in 1890 and focuses on presenting real-life by clips, including everyday chores that we often overlook, such as a cup of coffee under the sun and even a simple smile between friends.

Fragment 8 Retro Camera makes shooting simple, allowing you to empty your day within this stressful world. Even if you have no story in mind, just shoot, you may end up with a touching short film to tell your own story. 

Not only record the beautiful picture but also record the feeling of the moment.

"Nostalgia For The Past by 8mm"

The number "8" of the camera represents the “8 mm film” which was developed by Kodak in 1932 and was widely used for the movie. The unique color and incompleteness of the film taken from the 8mm film evoke a sense of nostalgia. It makes the audience focus on the story itself, but not how gorgeous it is. 

Fragment 8 Retro Camera is inspired by the 8mm home movie camera. We emphasize not only the modernization of the antique appearance, but also the inheritance of the feelings from the film camera. Due to the love of the film, we reproduce most of these film features, through optics and software, into this brand new digital camera.

Blends a retro camera design with modern features.

Retro Reinvention #8mm Film #Retro Effect #MP4

Inspired by natural aesthetics, the Fragment 8 Retro Camera embodies the bright and soft appearance of the mid-century classic analog film. With natural tones, subtle color changes and slight discoloration, it makes a video of even the most mundane subject look artistic, nostalgic and well-composed. Your story can be shared with friends at a new level with romantic and retro effects. You don’t have to fiddle around with aperture, IOS, or white balance. All you need do is experience the gorgeous vintage feel in your own videos.

  •  Nostalgia - fills your life with unpredictable retro styles beauty.  
  •  Easy-to-use - no redundant setting, guides you to tell the story.  
  •  Retro 8mm Design - gives you the most authentic photographic experience.  
  •  Digitized - captures the old-school style video in a second.  
  •  Super Light - only 250g, light enough to be your daily-life partner.  
  • Affordable - a meaningful gift for yourself and your loved ones.

MAX 120s - Count down for each shoot like the real film.

 

9 / 24 fps - Clips with 9 fps conjures up emotions you can't explain.

 

Lens Rotating Plate - Convenience for changing lens (Combo)

   

 

  •  Kaleidoscope Six Lens - takes colorful pictures like a kaleidoscope. 
  •  Star Filter Lens - changes the light in screen into a 4-line star point. 
  •  Radial Filter Lens - allows you to shoot a radial visual effect. 
  •  17mm Mount -  compatible with the lens such as Fisheye for the phone.

 

More Than a Retro Camera #GIF Mode#Looper Effect

The Fragment 8 Retro Camera is specifically made to create instant GIFs. We designed a GIF mode to boost your creativity because we know an unprecedented photographic experience is pretty delightful. When you're done capturing the funny and unexpected moments, they can be directly outputted as GIF format. You can also share the GIFs directly to your favorite social media platforms via your phone or computer immediately.

  •  Instant GIFs - create GIFs like capturing a video. 
  •  Looper Effect - a special effect that makes the GIFs much funnier. 
  •  Easy-to-share - make all your little moment share-ready.  
  • The Gift in Digital - creative and share the GIF Stickers to your friends.

An instant GIF mode for boosting your creativity.

GIFs - Looper Effect with 8mm film style [Reference]

​GIFs - Looper Effect with Radial Filter Lens [ Reference ]

GIFs - Looper Effect with Star Filter Lens [ Reference ]​ 

GIFs - Looper Effect with Kaleidoscope Six Lens [ Reference ]

Spice Up Your Journey with Some Randomness

We pursue natural aesthetics, which focuses on the stories in your journey instead of the composition of the picture; it is surrounded by ambiguity and randomness instead of perfection. The Fragment 8 Retro Camera utilizes the combination of Glass and Acrylic lens, both intentional and unintentional, to produce texture and color without the precise manipulation of the digital. The unpredictability of it all gives you a chance to suspend calculate, and let “nature” take its course.

Vintage clips carry a romantic dull haze of memories.

When you find a vintage clip, you remember the world differently.

 

The extra filter lenses can be stored inside the camera.

A Meticulously-Designed Camera

We designed the Fragment 8 Retro Camera for everyone, from the first-time film camera user to the film photography enthusiast. It is so cute and small like soap. This design allows you to carry it around to capture precious moments. You’ll be snapping beautiful images in only a matter of seconds.

To reinvent it to be modern, we apply the artfully crafted curves inside the design to render the product compact and make it delightful to the eyes. The quality of the exquisitely-processed shell surface is accentuated by the genuine leather in order to showcase the elegance in simplicity.

It is easier said than done. It took us nearly a year in creating this camera.

 

Risks & Challenges

Together with every one of you, we look forward to the birth of the Fragment 8 Retro Camera. We promise to dedicate all efforts to make the perfect Fragment 8 that’ll meet your expectations. With the aim to deliver as early as possible, all the relevant parties are ready in production. We will do the very best to ensure the smooth running of production, although we have to keep you reminded that there could be challenges force majeure that might cause a possible delay. We are well prepared now to affront any challenges. We hope you will join us in this project, and together we can witness the momentum birth of the Fragment 8 Retro Camera.
story_txt:
As Seen On

Awards

The "FRAGMENT 8" Retro Camera
"Tell Your Stories with Fragment"
We use the word “Fragment” to present the concept of “Slice of Life”. The concept “Slice of Life” originated in 1890 and focuses on presenting real-life by clips, including everyday chores that we often overlook, such as a cup of coffee under the sun and even a simple smile between friends.
Fragment 8 Retro Camera makes shooting simple, allowing you to empty your day within this stressful world. Even if you have no story in mind, just shoot, you may end up with a touching short film to tell your own story. 

Not only record the beautiful picture but also record the feeling of the moment.

"Nostalgia For The Past by 8mm"
The number "8" of the camera represents the “8 mm film” which was developed by Kodak in 1932 and was widely used for the movie. The unique color and incompleteness of the film taken from the 8mm film evoke a sense of nostalgia. It makes the audience focus on the story itself, but not how gorgeous it is. 
Fragment 8 Retro Camera is inspired by the 8mm home movie camera. We emphasize not only the modernization of the antique appearance, but also the inheritance of the feelings from the film camera. Due to the love of the film, we reproduce most of these film features, through optics and software, into this brand new digital camera.

Blends a retro camera design with modern features.
Retro Reinvention #8mm Film #Retro Effect #MP4
Inspired by natural aesthetics, the Fragment 8 Retro Camera embodies the bright and soft appearance of the mid-century classic analog film. With natural tones, subtle color changes and slight discoloration, it makes a video of even the most mundane subject look artistic, nostalgic and well-composed. Your story can be shared with friends at a new level with romantic and retro effects. You don’t have to fiddle around with aperture, IOS, or white balance. All you need do is experience the gorgeous vintage feel in your own videos.

 Nostalgia - fills your life with unpredictable retro styles beauty.  
 Easy-to-use - no redundant setting, guides you to tell the story.  
 Retro 8mm Design - gives you the most authentic photographic experience.  
 Digitized - captures the old-school style video in a second.  
 Super Light - only 250g, light enough to be your daily-life partner.  
Affordable - a meaningful gift for yourself and your loved ones.


MAX 120s - Count down for each shoot like the real film.


 

 
9 / 24 fps - Clips with 9 fps conjures up emotions you can't explain.


 

 
Lens Rotating Plate - Convenience for changing lens (Combo)

   
 

 Kaleidoscope Six Lens - takes colorful pictures like a kaleidoscope. 
 Star Filter Lens - changes the light in screen into a 4-line star point. 
 Radial Filter Lens - allows you to shoot a radial visual effect. 
 17mm Mount -  compatible with the lens such as Fisheye for the phone.

 
More Than a Retro Camera #GIF Mode#Looper Effect
The Fragment 8 Retro Camera is specifically made to create instant GIFs. We designed a GIF mode to boost your creativity because we know an unprecedented photographic experience is pretty delightful. When you're done capturing the funny and unexpected moments, they can be directly outputted as GIF format. You can also share the GIFs directly to your favorite social media platforms via your phone or computer immediately.

 Instant GIFs - create GIFs like capturing a video. 
 Looper Effect - a special effect that makes the GIFs much funnier. 
 Easy-to-share - make all your little moment share-ready.  
The Gift in Digital - creative and share the GIF Stickers to your friends.


An instant GIF mode for boosting your creativity.
GIFs - Looper Effect with 8mm film style [Reference]
​GIFs - Looper Effect with Radial Filter Lens [ Reference ]
GIFs - Looper Effect with Star Filter Lens [ Reference ]​ 
GIFs - Looper Effect with Kaleidoscope Six Lens [ Reference ]
Spice Up Your Journey with Some Randomness
We pursue natural aesthetics, which focuses on the stories in your journey instead of the composition of the picture; it is surrounded by ambiguity and randomness instead of perfection. The Fragment 8 Retro Camera utilizes the combination of Glass and Acrylic lens, both intentional and unintentional, to produce texture and color without the precise manipulation of the digital. The unpredictability of it all gives you a chance to suspend calculate, and let “nature” take its course.

Vintage clips carry a romantic dull haze of memories.

When you find a vintage clip, you remember the world differently.
 


The extra filter lenses can be stored inside the camera.
A Meticulously-Designed Camera
We designed the Fragment 8 Retro Camera for everyone, from the first-time film camera user to the film photography enthusiast. It is so cute and small like soap. This design allows you to carry it around to capture precious moments. You’ll be snapping beautiful images in only a matter of seconds.
To reinvent it to be modern, we apply the artfully crafted curves inside the design to render the product compact and make it delightful to the eyes. The quality of the exquisitely-processed shell surface is accentuated by the genuine leather in order to showcase the elegance in simplicity.

It is easier said than done. It took us nearly a year in creating this camera.
 
Risks & Challenges
Together with every one of you, we look forward to the birth of the Fragment 8 Retro Camera. We promise to dedicate all efforts to make the perfect Fragment 8 that’ll meet your expectations. With the aim to deliver as early as possible, all the relevant parties are ready in production. We will do the very best to ensure the smooth running of production, although we have to keep you reminded that there could be challenges force majeure that might cause a possible delay. We are well prepared now to affront any challenges. We hope you will join us in this project, and together we can witness the momentum birth of the Fragment 8 Retro Camera.

story:
About the Project

I'm a full-time freelance commercial, editorial, and fine art photographer and instructor. I also have a degree in wildlife biology and a former career as a wildlife biologist.

I'm going to Scotland in July/August. I'll be exploring over a 14-day period and my mode of travel and accommodation will be an RV/motorhome. I'll be able to travel to and stay right at or very near the locations and trail heads where I'll be photographing. This will give me a more engaged and immersive experience with greater time and opportunity to make photographs at each location. Here's the map of the general route and set of locations I plan to visit.

Some locations: Loch Sligachan, Elgol, the Quiraing, Old Man of Storr, Glen Brittle, Isle of Raasay, Buchaille Etive Mor, Rannoch Moor, Neist Point, Oban, Kilchurn Castle, Stalker Castle, Eilean Donan Castle, Inveraray Castle, Talisker Bay, Loch Slapin.

A goal of this project is to create a book, a photo book; Scotland : Senses & Perception. However, not simply a book of beautiful photographs, but also about how our senses and perceptions influence the way we view and interpret the world around us through our art - what and how we photograph (or paint, or write, or sculpt). A book of art with a bit of philosophy and science; delving into some of the why of photography, instead of the how. There is a fair amount of science and philosophy behind this concept which I've been pursuing rigorously for about 4 years now and for a bunch of years prior to that, inspired and influenced by my biology/ecology background, my personal interest in human perception, and my love of passing on that information to others.

Vision is a dynamic process involving more than just our eyes, and photography is more than just taking pictures. This will be described in the book and in the information about each photograph, along with some useful exercises you can do yourself to "rediscover the art of seeing".

I chose Scotland for this project, specifically the Isle of Skye and Glencoe region, because the environment lends itself to a wide range of sensory exploration in a relatively small area. Its unspoiled landscape showcases the raw power and beauty of nature. Changing weather conditions create amazing atmospheric light amongst majestic crags, rounded hills, grand valleys, rocky coast, boggy moors, rushing rivers, and serene lochs. It's not difficult to imagine giants roaming the hills, dragons soaring in the sky, and fairies flitting about in the woods and around crystal clear pools.

The Details

All the reservations and expenses of the trip are arranged and paid for. The funding I'm requesting is to create the book and prints, get them printed, and distributed to supporters.

I'll have three versions of the book, an ebook, an 8x10 signed softcover book, and an 8x10 signed and numbered limited edition (150) hardcover book. It'll be 80 - 120 pages. Other perks are signed prints, handwritten postcards sent from Scotland, and a 3-day Senses & Perception workshop with me in the Alvord Desert of southcentral Oregon in June, 2015.

The first section of the book will be a description of the sensory and perceptual apparatus of the human body, the relationships and interactions between them, and how they influence the process of making a photograph.

The main section and bulk of the book will be a gallery of photographs showcasing the landscape and character of the Isle of Skye and the Scottish Highlands. I'll be making photographs ranging from grand landscapes to intimate close-ups and long exposures using 35mm DSLR, Polaroid and smartphone cameras. Each photograph will be accompanied by a description of the sensory and perceptual impressions influencing my selection of the subject, composition, and camera settings. The technical stats for each photo will be included. Image descriptions and stats will likely be placed in an appendix to maintain a clean look. 

A final acknowledgment section will be the list of all you great and generous contributors to this project. 

Book Details

  • Photographs & text by Mike Shipman
  • Hardcover & softcover editions 8" x 10"
  • 80 pages (120+ potential if funding goal is exceeded)
  • paper 100# (148GSM) premium matte

Release date December 2015

Here are some examples of my work and in the slideshow at the top of the page and gallery to give you a sense of the style of photography you're likely to see in the book.

I will make the book, regardless of funding. If, by chance, the full funding goal is not reached, I will still fulfill the perk levels that were funded, so nobody will be left out. As I mentioned, I'm going anyway but thought this would be a great way to get people involved in the project and will be the most cost-effective way for you as a supporter of this project to receive the perks, especially the book and the 3-day workshop.

    Addendum - what else is in it for you?

    Most description, explanation, teaching, criticism, technique, and presentation of visual art is...well...heavily biased toward the 'visual' side of our sensory and perceptual being. What if you better understood how to rediscover the art of seeing by using more than just your eyes? How beneficial would that be to your photography and your own exploration of your world?

    In addition to the book, prints, and other perks, I plan to exhibit 20 printed photographs from the book during the Month of Photography-Boise (MoPBOI) in March/April, 2016. I began MoPBOI in 2013, following the pattern of the Month of Photography-LA (MOPLA), to showcase all aspects of photography from commercial to alternative and historic processes in all genres by Idaho photographers.

    Blog posts throughout the trip will keep you informed on progress, give you a sneak peak to some of the images I'm making, and insight into traveling by RV in Scotland. I might even make an ebook of the RV experience, with travel tips and recipes as a special thank you.

    If the goal is surpassed, I will increase the number of pages for the book and/or select higher quality paper, depending on how far over the line it goes.

    Risks & Challenges

    I'm an experienced traveler. I've traveled to and spent time in Africa, New Zealand, Australia, South America, Central America, and across North America. I've taught photography classes and led workshops since 1998 and love to teach and help others grow in the art of photography and art awareness in general.

    But there can be unforeseen circumstances on an expedition like this, such as airline delays, baggage loss, road and access closures, car breakdowns and accidents, theft of equipment, etc. I will be carrying critical camera equipment with me at all times when traveling by air, and covered by insurance in case of major issues. Any travel delays should be minimal. I'm in good physical condition and don't put myself in unreasonable or dangerous situations (on purpose).

    Weather is always a major player when working with nature. In Scotland, weather provides the character and mood of the land. I'm prepared to work in any weather conditions I encounter and actually look forward to a variety of weather. The more varied the weather the more sensory and perceptual experiences I will have and be able to incorporate into the photographs and descriptions.

    Shipping of rewards will begin once the funding deadline has passed, beginning with thank you notes. Other rewards will be shipped while I'm in Scotland and after my return as they are completed. The production of the book is planned to take roughly 120 days from the time I return to the first ship date, given no major events intervene. However, if any significant delay occurs, backers will be notified and kept up-to-date on progress.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you aren't able to help fund this project, I understand. I'd love to support all the projects and causes that interest me, but I have to eat, just like you do.

    But, you can be a big force in the success of this project by getting the word out to your friends and social circles. Use the share tools, copy and paste the project URL into your tweets, Facebook and G+ posts, LinkedIn messages, wherever you're connected. 

    Even if you do fund it, I encourage you to pass it on.

    I really do appreciate your support and I'm grateful you choose to help fund this project and/or promote it.

story:
Short Summary

An English message will follow.

www.davidpiovesan.com
https://society6.com/dpiovesanphoto

Pour ceux qui ne me connaissent pas, mon nom est David Piovesan. Je suis un enseignant qui joue au photographe depuis quelques années.  J’œuvre dans le merveilleux Hochelaga-Maisonneuve depuis près de trois ans comme suppléant et passe mes moments hors de classes avec une caméra à la main.  Je tente depuis quelques années d’exposer mes photos, mais le manque de temps durant mes études m’a retardé. Avec la fin de mes études, je veux reprendre ce rêve et pour ce, je veux compléter une série de photo de paysages. 

Mon but est donc d’effectuer un voyage de deux semaines en Islande en Mai ou juin 2016 afin d’aller chercher des images auxquelles je n’aurais pas accès en étant à Montréal.  Depuis environ trois ans, j’ai délaissé la photo architecturale et d’exploration urbaine au profit des paysages désertiques et montagneux. Je pourrais créer une série entière sur l'Islande.

------------------

For the readers who don’t know who I am, my Name is David. I’m a teacher who likes to play at being a photographer. I work in the vicinity of Hochelaga-Maisonneuve in Montreal and when not taking care of students, I roam the city looking for new pictures. I’ve been trying for the last few year to expose what I was able to photograph while travelling between my native Quebec and the rest of the world (or sort of). I just graduated and am between jobs, waiting to take a full class for more than a few hours per week. I finally have the time to look at fulfilling my dream to jump in pro photography and to expose in a gallery. Except it’s never that easy. To expose, you need to show something others don’t have.  

My goal is to travel to Iceland for about two weeks in March or June 2016. That way I would get to make a complete series to expose later that year. I spent the last years working on travel photography (landscape, desert and mountains). I would like to create a complete series on Iceland. 


What We Need & What You Get

I always intended to finance myself trough selling my own pictures prints. This is the first step: I am not asking for donation. My intention is to use IndieGogo as a way to invest in my next adventure and preorder prints. You can also directly order from my Society6 page. Orders taken from here will be less expensive as I will take care of them myself (but will take longer to ship).

------------

J’ai toujours voulu financer mes activités par la vente de mes clichés. Ceci est le premier pas : plutôt que de demander des dons, j’utiliserai cette plateforme afin de vous proposer d’investir dans ma prochaine aventure afin d’avoir en exclusivité une (ou plusieurs) photo imprimée qui vous soit remise.  J’offre aussi la possibilité de commander des impressions de photos déjà publiées (tel que celles sur mon profil Society6) à un prix plus bas. Ces impressions vont être plus lentes à être remises puisqu’elles vont être imprimées en masse à une date ultérieure. 

The Impact

En participant à cette campagne, vous me donnez une chance

  • De me permettre le financement de mes futurs projets par la vente d'imprimés.
  • D'exposer mes photos en ayant une cohésion plus grande que ce que j'ai en ce moment. 
  • Augmenter ma visibilité en tant que photographe.

story:
Short Summary

I've always had a blend of interests across the arts and science. I hold B.A in Economics, MA in Health Services Management, MA in Macroeconomics, Ph.D. in Economics. I also teach the module of healthcare quality at the graduate and postgraduate level.  On the other hand, I have been involved in photography, not only exhibiting my photographs but also writing about photography. 
The campaign 'Beauty reinstated' is both associated with the noun kάllos (beauty) and a more general notion of excellence in Ancient Greece, which was signified by the adjective kalόs. In other words, the publication of a photo book on beauty in the art will cover the noun kάllos (beauty) while the notion of excellence signified by the adjective kalόs will be covered by the introduction of patient-centered care in Greece.
Your contribution is highly appreciated as it will be used for printing the book entitled 'Beauty Reinstated' which will be a top-quality hardcover photo book dealing with the reinstatement of beauty in art. It will contain quotes from philosophers and artists regarding the concept from ancient Greece to the present. Specifically, it will include 60 pages of photos intermixed with quoted words of philosophers and artists in an 18 x 24 cm full-colour photography book, designed with highest quality print and materials. A photo exhibition will follow based on fine prints of the photos included in the book.
 

What We Need & What You Get

The photography, writing, and e-book are done. This project was self-funded. All that remains is printing a very high-quality book and exhibiting the photographs. High-quality print jobs cost tens of thousands of euros, as a minimum of 1000 copies must be printed. Additional costs include the fine printing of the photographs and the gallery rent.
The minimum funding goal of €5000 is needed to print a small run of 1000 book copies, the fine printing of the photographs, the gallery rent, and the costs of shipping the fine prints of photos. 
The perks include downloading of the ebook and fine prints of the photos contained in the ebook at a special price. If the campaign does not reach its financial goal the money raised will be used for the facilitation of the publication of the book.

The Impact

Recently, it seems, beauty has been recovering from the stigma of being politically incorrect and is making something of a comeback in writings on art and culture. In this context, the printed book 'Beauty Reinstated' and the exhibition of the photos included in the book will help to show how beauty, suitably understood and delimited, can cohabit with other, equally important aesthetic values. In aesthetics, there is room for beauty, as a feature of art.
 

Risks & Challenges

Delivery date for the prints is probably after May 2017, and I will do my very best to make it in time. I will post updates to everyone on this Indiegogo page. Particular care will also be taken to protect the print during transit as it will be shipped with reinforcement. Finally, prices listed here include shipping and are special prices offered only during this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your help in spreading the word is the key to success and is greatly appreciated.

•    tell your friends, family & others why this should be supported
•    share on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, etc
•    spread the word to newspapers, radio, and other media, or groups who might be interested
•    please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for helping to complete this long and historically essential project.

Sincerely,
Anastasius Moumtzoglou
story_txt: Short SummaryI've always had a blend of interests across the arts and science. I hold B.A in Economics, MA in Health Services Management, MA in Macroeconomics, Ph.D. in Economics. I also teach the module of healthcare quality at the graduate and postgraduate level.  On the other hand, I have been involved in photography, not only exhibiting my photographs but also writing about photography. The campaign 'Beauty reinstated' is both associated with the noun kάllos (beauty) and a more general notion of excellence in Ancient Greece, which was signified by the adjective kalόs. In other words, the publication of a photo book on beauty in the art will cover the noun kάllos (beauty) while the notion of excellence signified by the adjective kalόs will be covered by the introduction of patient-centered care in Greece.Your contribution is highly appreciated as it will be used for printing the book entitled 'Beauty Reinstated' which will be a top-quality hardcover photo book dealing with the reinstatement of beauty in art. It will contain quotes from philosophers and artists regarding the concept from ancient Greece to the present. Specifically, it will include 60 pages of photos intermixed with quoted words of philosophers and artists in an 18 x 24 cm full-colour photography book, designed with highest quality print and materials. A photo exhibition will follow based on fine prints of the photos included in the book. What We Need & What You GetThe photography, writing, and e-book are done. This project was self-funded. All that remains is printing a very high-quality book and exhibiting the photographs. High-quality print jobs cost tens of thousands of euros, as a minimum of 1000 copies must be printed. Additional costs include the fine printing of the photographs and the gallery rent.The minimum funding goal of €5000 is needed to print a small run of 1000 book copies, the fine printing of the photographs, the gallery rent, and the costs of shipping the fine prints of photos. The perks include downloading of the ebook and fine prints of the photos contained in the ebook at a special price. If the campaign does not reach its financial goal the money raised will be used for the facilitation of the publication of the book.The ImpactRecently, it seems, beauty has been recovering from the stigma of being politically incorrect and is making something of a comeback in writings on art and culture. In this context, the printed book 'Beauty Reinstated' and the exhibition of the photos included in the book will help to show how beauty, suitably understood and delimited, can cohabit with other, equally important aesthetic values. In aesthetics, there is room for beauty, as a feature of art. Risks & ChallengesDelivery date for the prints is probably after May 2017, and I will do my very best to make it in time. I will post updates to everyone on this Indiegogo page. Particular care will also be taken to protect the print during transit as it will be shipped with reinforcement. Finally, prices listed here include shipping and are special prices offered only during this campaign.Other Ways You Can HelpYour help in spreading the word is the key to success and is greatly appreciated.•    tell your friends, family & others why this should be supported•    share on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Pinterest, etc•    spread the word to newspapers, radio, and other media, or groups who might be interested•    please use the Indiegogo share tools!Thank you for helping to complete this long and historically essential project.Sincerely,Anastasius Moumtzoglou

story:
THE EXHIBITION EXPERIENCE

The War Zone Freelance Exhibition gives an exclusive look into the work and world of freelance journalists covering wars and conflicts in the Middle East.
Your donation to the War Zone Freelance Exhibition supports the exposure of freelance journalists dedicated to covering conflicts worldwide and contributes to educating the global public on where much of today's news comes from and the stories behind the freelancers in the field risking their lives reporting it.

The project is motivated by the desire to pay tribute and provoke debate on the important and consequential role freelance journalists play in bringing news out of conflict areas to the international public, often with little support, on their own expense and at extremely high risk.

The War Zone Freelance Exhibition 2016 is scheduled to begin in London at the Frontline Club on January 28th and from this legendary venue, the team has planned a six month tour to gallery locations in major European cities including Paris, Berlin, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, and Barcelona. 

The War Zone Freelance Exhibition was founded in July 2015 and has since been published in various media and received great feedback from the Committee to Protect Journalists, Frontline Freelance Register, and other major journalist organizations from around the world. All of them are on board to share the WZF message and give informational and network support, however none have committed financially. 

Since the beginning, the War Zone Freelance Team has been self-financing their project and cannot continue without outside support. 


CREATORS

The War Zone Freelance Exhibition is made up by a team of international freelance journalists. 

American photojournalist Osie Greenway, Danish writer/ reporter Anne Alling, German writer/ photographer Benjamin Hiller, and Dutch videographer/ photographer Jeffry Ruigendijk have all spent considerable amounts of time in the last several years covering conflicts and humanitarian issues in Iraq, Syria, Lebanon, Israel, Palestine, among others. With both published and unseen material from war zones throughout the Middle East they propose a multi-faceted exhibition that will pull its audience deep into the reporting process and educate on both people affected by war in the region and the struggles and triumphs of working independently as a freelancer in a high-stakes vocation.


INSIDE THE EXHIBITION

When one enters the WZF exhibition, the visitor will immediately be overtaken by the ambiance created by the multi platform gallery presentation. The photography and videography gallery is where the audience can take the journey alongside the journalists by viewing images from remote battlefields throughout the Middle East while looking over personal items in display-cases used by the freelancers in the field that made reporting these stories possible. Items that each journalist find significant in their reporting along with other pieces of their stories that were obtained while reporting, including battle flags, uniforms, and other conflict-related artifacts. The viewers' mood is heightened by audio of war zone radio reporting that will play throughout the photo and video gallery. 

Connecting the photography and videography gallery to the interactive memorial will be a section dedicated to local freelancers who risk all in helping international media workers produce stories for global media outlets. With the use of their own media work and filmed interviews these talented individuals will share their personal stories of reporting on frontlines in their own countries and the life threatening hassles of freelancing as a local journalist. 

The final section of the exhibition will be a place to embrace the information obtained throughout the exhibit and witness the heavy costs of freelancing in war zones, by viewing WZF's memorial wall dedicated to freelance journalists killed or missing while covering conflicts in the Middle East during the last several years.
The memorial will specifically highlight the local freelance photojournalist Molhem Barakat who was killed in Syria while covering battles in Aleppo. The memorial will be interactive with a message book for visitors that will be sent to the family of the fallen journalist, along with items for sale that raise awareness to the costs of reporting inside war zones. 


FREELANCERS IN DANGER

During the past several years, threats towards journalists, especially those working in conflict areas in the Middle East, has increased drastically. Sixty-one journalists have been killed for reasons related to their work or have died while on assignment so far in 2015.
This year is expected to be the deadliest year ever for journalists. Freelancers with limited means, little backing from media companies, and often working alone in the field are further exposed to danger and account to the high number of deaths.

Syrian freelance photographer in his late teens Molhem Barakat was killed on December 20th 2013 while covering a battle at al-Kindi Hospital in Aleppo, Syria. Since May that year, he had been freelancing for Reuters who distributed dozens of his pictures around the world, some of them appearing in prestigious publications such as The New Yorker and The New York Times. 

Selected photos from Molhem's portfolio will be displayed in the WZF interactive memorial along with the cameras he carried the day he was killed. 

“Journalism was his whole life, it was his message to present real and honest photos. I ask you that you display his cameras in the exhibition so that the whole world can see it. My son’s blood is on those cameras”, Molhem’s mother writes to WZF about her son’s story being told at the War Zone Freelance Exhibition.


EDUCATIONAL PERSPECTIVE

Many exhibitions fail to tell the story behind the story of what it is like for journalists working in dangerous places. The WZF Exhibition will serve as a tool to educate on the profession of freelance journalism. The mobile exhibit is an ideal place for journalism students and media majors to learn about the freelance profession, a field that is often left out of college and university journalism curriculum. 

In each city we exhibit in, our goal is to highlight a local freelance journalist that has covered conflicts in the Mideast by sharing his/ her work and their experiences. The WZF journalists themselves will give lectures and hold Q&As to talk about their experiences and the impact of current conflicts in the Middle East.

In addition to highlighting local international journalist the freelancers and fixers from Iraq, Syria, and the Kurdistan region, who's work is displayed in the exhibition will come to elaborate in an open discussion forum on the challenges of covering war and conflicts as a freelance journalist in their home country. 

Speakers from international journalism organizations will attend for lectures to give statistical information and share their insight on the current state of freelance journalism.


FUTURE GOALS

After touring the Middle East exhibition for a six month period to major cities in Europe the WZF team hopes to purpose a second six month tour through North America starting in New York City and ending in Toronto where the exhibition media will be sold to raise money for CJFE's Journalists in Distress Fund.

Afterwards, the vision of the WZF team is to expand beyond the Middle East in order to cover more of the many conflicts happening today around the world, including Africa, East Asia and Eastern Europe.

The idea is to support and empower deep and authentic reporting by exhibiting local and international freelancers covering those areas. Through our exhibitions and online media strategies, we create a platform for both established freelancers and lesser-known talents to display their work and experiences to the public through the exhibition, our social media, and photo & video competitions.


HOW WE USE YOUR CONTRIBUTION

To cover the expenses of setting up the War Zone Freelance Exhibition and accomplish our 2016 six-month Europe exhibition tour we need your help!

The expenses include:

Printing & Publication of exhibition images,  posters, brochures, and exhibition catalogs. 

Exhibition supplies including projectors, display-cases, PA-system, and material for the interactive memorial.

Advertisement including press packages and urban & social media advertisement.

Travel & Accommodation for the WZF Team, local journalists & fixers, and attending speakers. 

Transportation of exhibit supplies throughout the Europe tour. 


SPREAD THE WORD

Another way to support the War Zone Freelance Exhibition is by spreading the word about our crowd funding campaign and get other people on board to support our project. 

You can find War Zone Freelance on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Vimeo and LinkedIn and don't forget the hashtag  #WZF16.

THANK YOU for helping us make this project possible and we hope to see you, your friends, colleagues and family at the War Zone Freelance 2016 Europe Tour!

story:
For eight years I have been making a Documentary Photography and Filmmaking Series dear to my heart.  Now I need your help to complete it!

 

 

What is Itinerary

 

Iris, with her daughters, Savana & Sandra, Oglala Sioux Tribe, S. Dakota

 

ITINERARY is an artistic and documentary collaborative project I started in Tunisia.  Its basis is a painted canvas backdrop against which a person poses with their favorite possessions.  What results from the photographs and films is an exploration of identity and memory that joins the subject's expressive need with the photographer's ability to manifest.  In this way, both the photographer and the subject become collaborators on a journey of discovery.

For this project, I would like to return to the homes and reservations of the Sioux, whom I met, admired, and briefly photographed and filmed on a previous trip, to continue this journey of exploration.

 

 

Who I Am / The Genesis

 

My name is Faten Gaddes.  I am a French Tunisian artist who has been working as a photographer since 1998. 

In 2011 in the throes of the Jasmine Revolution, a dictatorship of 50 years was overthrown in Tunisia.  At that time, my installation Punching Ball – an artwork intended to denounce violence against women – was burnt publicly by religious extremists who also posted my name and address in newspapers – a potential death sentence. 

I withdrew from making art, isolated and depressed.

 

Punching Ball dismantled and burnt publicly by Extremists.

 

One day going through a garage at my home, I discovered an old backdrop – a large "trompe l'oeil" scene painted on canvas in misty hues of flowers and sky.  Something about this backdrop evoked not only a calmness in me but, even more strongly, an idea and a determination to seek out ways to use my art to reclaim and express identity.

Although I eventually left Tunisia, I can proudly say Tunisia gains momentum each and every day, advancing in the path of democratization.  In 2015, Tunisia was awarded the Tunisian National Dialogue Quartet for "its decisive contribution to the building of a pluralistic democracy in Tunisia in the wake of the Jasmine Revolution of 2011".

 

@Faten_Gaddes

 

 

Where My Project is Today

 

For the next eight years after finding the backdrop, I traveled through North Africa , Europe and the United States, where I met my subjects while on the road.  Due to personal history, as a woman and as a committed artist, my interest and compassion for working with minorities was born.  I, too, was seeking my place in the world, despite marginalization.  The relationships I made are unforgettable and humbling.

When I arrived in the United States, I wanted to continue Itinerary by documenting the country's first inhabitants.  While I was well aware of the horrific treatment of Native Americans before my project, this was the first time I was able to follow my intentions of documenting this repression in such a developed country.

It was in New York that I first encountered Native Americans in my life.  They had migrated to the city for work and were far from friends and family who remained on the reservations. 

I sympathized with this and began to trace stories back to sacred lands.

 

Route in S. Dakota

 

In 2018, I borrowed a friend's van for a month and a half and drove through South Dakota with my backdrop to where the Sioux tribe lives.  Despite being depressed about the living conditions that mainstream media fails to cover, I had an exceptional human experience.  There, I experienced the same level of solidarity I had during the entire making of Itinerary.  I sometimes forgot I had come with a purpose while engaging and becoming friends with the people I met.

When I asked my Sioux friends about bringing a filmmaker to capture stories, I was thrilled to be met with collaboration.  Together, we have come up with a list of contacts and an "itinerary" of reservations to visit.

Although sacred lands are preserved for future generations to live on, Natives often have covered their cultural identities to weave into other social fabrics.  As a tribute, I want the latest chapter of Itinerary to be as authentic as possible, beyond what just a camera can do. 

I will need to expand this project into one that will tell several personal stories.

 

Michele's house, Wanblee, Pine Ridge Reservation, S. Dakota

 

"Her recent work to encapsulate the character, faces, and stories of Native Americans in portraiture is of outstanding quality and comparable to Edward Curtis of the late 1880's within America. The ability to depict the sentient rendering of Native peoples' faces to the two-dimensional plane that she captures takes exceptional skill and aptitude to apprehend. While numerous artists in mediums such as painting, charcoal, pencil, and photography have attempted to denote the mystique within Native American omnipresence, Ms. Gaddes is doing so and needs to continue her work within the Americas."

- Ben Rhodd, Potawatomi & Lakota Tribes, Archaeologist

 

 

Why I Need Your Help

 

I want to return to the Sioux reservations and more extensively share the stories of the people who despite great injustice, repression, and difficult living conditions still believe profoundly in the generosity of human nature, and respect for the land. 

With your support I want to collaborate with the Sioux and other Native Americans in telling their stories. I want to reveal their resilience in the face of hardship, share their wisdom carved from experience and memory, and provide them the opportunity to express and celebrate their cultural identity.   

The resulting photographs and films, I believe, will be of great importance in gaining recognition for their lives and traditions, and hopefully will help bridge the divide that has diminished their culture so as to lead to understanding and appreciation.

 

 

Route / Budget

 

Pine Ridge, S. Dakota

 

My plan is one will last at least up to two years.  After revisiting the Sioux tribe, I will drive through Arizona to visit the Tonto reservation, then New Mexico to meet the Jicarilla-Apache and Mescalero-Apache. Lastly, New Orleans to meet the Houma tribes. 

After completing this chapter, I would like to continue to work with other minorities scattered throughout the United States, such as the Mormons, Hasidic Jews, etc.

I have meticulously researched to assemble a budget and invested as much of my funds as possible.  My budget mainly consists of a live-in van, one that is reliable, where I can sleep and station myself, in addition to a collaborative filmmaker and equipment. The purchase of a live-in van is a long-term practical solution for two reasons: One, it is more economical than renting one for an indefinite period. Two, there is no accommodation on the reservation land for people who do not belong to the indigenous community. Commuting daily would ultimately take hours that I could be spending working on the project.

I have calculated that I will need at least $50,000 to begin.  The van at the lowest price is approximately $30,000. Travel and housing will cost around $63,500, and professional assistance will cost roughly $29,000.  Photographic equipment alone is $10,087.58. 

In total, I have estimated that I will spend $102,587 in the duration of six to eight months to complete the Native American chapter.

 

 

Connect With Me / Share

 

Soon, I will be able to share images and footage from this behind the scenes with you! 

I hope that you follow me on @FatenGaddes and help share my campaign!!

 

Faten with Crys & Michele in front of their house. Oglala Sioux Tribe, S. Dakota

 

"Being the Chairman of the Lower Brule Sioux Tribe, I have a great amount of respect for individuals and artists who take time to feature and highlight the lives of Native American People within our country Ms. Gaddes's work as an international artist is gaining recognition, which proves that she brings a wealth of resources to the American fine art communities. Her work in accurately portraying Native Americans brings the benefit of world-class conceptual art to US cultural institutions, thereby informing contemporary culture, politics and society. 

I absolutely support Faten Gaddes's project and truly look forward to working with her again in the future."

- Boyd I. Gourneau, Chairman, Lower Brule Sioux Tribe 

 

 

References

 

@David_Plakke

 

Artist at Risk Resident at Westbeth

Artspace

Bedford and Bowery: How One Photographer Stuck and Home Keeps Herself from Snapping

Global Citizen: Smartphone Short Film Festival (First Prize)

Le Mucem: Faten Gaddes

PBA Auctions: Faten Gaddes

The Absence of Paths: Faten Gaddes

 

For more information about me or my work, please visit www.fatengaddes.com.

Dakota My plan is one will last at least up to two years.  After revisiting the Sioux tribe, I will drive through Arizona to visit the Tonto reservation, then New Mexico to meet the Jicarilla-Apache and Mescalero-Apache. Lastly, New Orleans to meet the Houma tribes. After completing this chapter, I would like to continue to work with other minorities scattered throughout the United States, such as the Mormons, Hasidic Jews, etc.I have meticulously researched to assemble a budget and invested as much of my funds as possible.  My budget mainly consists of a live-in van, one that is reliable, where I can sleep and station myself, in addition to a collaborative filmmaker and equipment. The purchase of a live-in van is a long-term practical solution for two reasons: One, it is more economical than renting one for an indefinite period. Two, there is no accommodation on the reservation land for people who do not belong to the indigenous community. Commuting daily would ultimately take hours that I could be spending working on the project.I have calculated that I will need at least $50,000 to begin.  The van at the lowest price is approximately $30,000. Travel and housing will cost around $63,500, and professional assistance will cost roughly $29,000.  Photographic equipment alone is $10,087.58. In total, I have estimated that I will spend $102,587 in the duration of six to eight months to complete the Native American chapter.  Connect With Me / Share Soon, I will be able to share images and footage from this behind the scenes with you! I hope that you follow me on @FatenGaddes and help share my campaign!! Faten with Crys & Michele in front of their house. Oglala Sioux Tribe, S. Dakota "Being the Chairman of the Lower Brule Sioux Tribe, I have a great amount of respect for individuals and artists who take time to feature and highlight the lives of Native American People within our country Ms. Gaddes's work as an international artist is gaining recognition, which proves that she brings a wealth of resources to the American fine art communities. Her work in accurately portraying Native Americans brings the benefit of world-class conceptual art to US cultural institutions, thereby informing contemporary culture, politics and society. I absolutely support Faten Gaddes's project and truly look forward to working with her again in the future."- Boyd I. Gourneau, Chairman, Lower Brule Sioux Tribe   References @David_Plakke Artist at Risk Resident at WestbethArtspaceBedford and Bowery: How One Photographer Stuck and Home Keeps Herself from SnappingGlobal Citizen: Smartphone Short Film Festival (First Prize)Le Mucem: Faten GaddesPBA Auctions: Faten GaddesThe Absence of Paths: Faten Gaddes For more information about me or my work, please visit www.fatengaddes.com.

story:
The Story

Hi, my name is Ignacio Palacios and I have been travelling and photographing around the world for almost 24 years. I have published with Australian Geographic, National Geographic, and I collaborate with Lonely Planet, Getty images and other international photography magazines and publications. I have exhibited in some of the best galleries in both Australia and Spain, having won important awards and international competitions in the landscape, wildlife, and travel genres.

In the last few years, I have been running photography tours and workshops around the globe although during COVID-19 with travel restrictions in place, I have had time to focus on other projects that were always on the backburner and could never start/materialise due to the amount of travelling I was previously doing. Those who know me, will tell you that I am incredibly passionate about photography, travel and teaching others and for that reason, with the help of some friends, photographers, and writers, I have created 8 different eBooks since March 2020.

10 Ingredients of Composition Mastery was my first eBook published and one of the most popular and successful. At launch and during the first month it was given as a free download. I received thousands of downloads and great feedback. I will share a testimonial from a reader with you:

“This is the best eBook I’ve read on photography by a long shot. Your personal approach in addressing all the topics ignites more the readers’ interest than any other eBooks I've read.  It is a lot more fun.  Though I was familiar with many of the topics, I kept on reading because of the way you presented them, how you teased your readers, your honesty and the Latino in you. The topics, with many tips, are concise and very easy to understand accompanied by those beautiful pictures. Above all, your love and passion for photography is contagious! Many Thanks again for sharing your fantastic vision of photography.  Your artistic images are simply superb” Odile

Many happy customers and friends have asked me if they could have this eBook as a printed version. This is a significant investment on my behalf and to make this a reality, I have decided to ‘crowd fund’ the project.

About the eBook

  • Composition is the backbone of photography and is, in my opinion, the most important photographic element in creating compelling images. At its core, composition is about visual strength. It’s the artful mastery of geometry, order and vision. Composition is control.
  • I studied the images of the world’s best photographers, I watched local and global photography competitions (hanging on every word the judges said), I sought out mentors, and I spent countless hours practising and refining my composition craftmanship. These 10 ingredients have been born from this process and are the principles I practice today. I’m sharing these with you because I want to save you from the same heartache, save you time, and hopefully help you become the best photographer you can be. Without further ado, here they are:
  1. Colour
  2. Light
  3. Leading Lines
  4. Balance & Symmetry
  5. Simplicity
  6. Pattern & Rhythm
  7. Contrast
  8. Depth & Perspective
  9. Subject Placement
  10. Breaking the Rules

Each ingredient may not sound revolutionary at this point, but trust me, if you know how to use each ingredient individually, and then combine them in the right way... magic happens!

What We Need

  • To print just a few books is an expensive option and not economically feasible. To be able to make this affordable to everyone, I would need to print 1500-2000 books. 
  • Thousands of people have downloaded this eBook for free at initial launch. Others have downloaded it at a very affordable price. If you have enjoyed reading my eBook and think it was worthwhile, I would appreciate a small contribution that I can use towards publishing it as a printed version.


What you Get

  • For donations of AU$40, you will receive the printed version of the book. Postage to your address will need to be added to this order.
  • For donations over AU$100, you will receive the printed version of the book plus an A4 signed print of your choice. Postage to your address will need to be added to this order.
  • For donations over AU$200, you will receive the printed version of the book plus an A3 signed print of your choice. Postage to your address will need to be added to this order.
  • For donations over AU$300, you will receive the printed version of the book plus an A2 signed print of your choice. Postage to your address will need to be added to this order.

  • For donations over AU$600, you will receive the printed version of the book plus an A1 signed print of your choice. Postage to your address will need to be added to this order

  • The book has 192 pages, and it will be printed A4 size, color, portrait orientation, hardcover.


The Impact

This book was written after much research and a lot of love and sweat. I am in no doubt that it will contribute to improve the photography skills of anyone who reads it. And that will make me really proud and happy!

I have published other books in the past such as Red Hot West: Karijini, Sydney Rockpools, Patagonia, High Deserts, Ranthambore and a Portfolio book. I have also self-published books with my colleagues of The Light Collective such as Kati-Thanda Lake Eyre and Black and Blue: Coal or Coral.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have enjoyed the eBook and can’t afford to make a small donation to the crowd funding campaign, please share this campaign to get the word out and help create some energy and noise to make this possible. You can use the Indiegogo share tools for this purpose. Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Fine art photographer seeks emergency funds to print and frame work for upcoming Boston gallery show.

Great News: I have been selected to be part of a 2 artist photography show: Perception / Abstraction at the Beacon Gallery, an established art gallery in the SOWA art district in Boston, MA. The show will open on March 20th thru April 26, 2020.

What would the world be like if there was no art to enjoy? How does emotion impact memory? How does the familiar slide into the unknown? How do we transform what we’re seeing into something vital and essential about the world we share and live in? 

This unique opportunity at the Beacon Gallery is a major step forward in showing a curated selection of my work to a diverse audience including educators, curators and potential collectors.

The on-going costs to print and frame work for the various accepted juried shows exceeds my budget and thats why I am asking you to help contribute. Your support is extremely helpful in order for me to share these images with a wider audience. No contribution is too small or too large. All is very much appreciated! 

I am working with 2- excellent regional printes as well as a local framer and have negotiated  pricing to get this work looking beautiful and on time for the March 17th drop off date.  The cost estimates for a mix of dye sublimation aluminum prints and archival pigment prints with framing is $7,354.00. All funds raised will go towards this show. I have also applied for an emergency funding grant which can provide up to $1000.00, if selected. In the event that I don't raise all the funds, (I will rob banks, steal kids lunch money, steal old lady's purses in the supermarket-NOT REALLY ), I will use credit cards to pay the balance to fund this show. Kidding aside, I am wary about digging a deeper financial hole using credit cards, but hopefully between donations and sales from the show will help to cover some of the printing and framing or any other additional expenses that I am unable to raise in this campaign. The gallery is generously providing all advertising, catalogs, announcements and the party for the opening reception on April 3rd.

Equally important to making new images is showing my work to new audiences while helping to change and influence the way people look at their world with a different perspective. I am an award winning, mid-career fine art photographer working for over 40 years. I have taught, lectured, mentored and work daily at creating fresh and authentic images and continue to explore the roads less travelled. My photographs have appeared in major online publications, national magazines and newspapers. I currently have photographs in 5 different juried group shows as well as in 2-corporate galleries.

Please follow me on Instagram or Facebook to stay in touch with my work and my progress as a visual story teller. If you love photography, give a shout out to friends, family and associates on your social media and the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks in advance for making it to this point of my request and looking forward to learning about you as well. Steve Edson

Come by for the opening reception on April 3rd from 6-8:30pm at the Beacon Gallery, 524B Harrison Ave, Boston, MA. 

Instagram: edsonphotoart

Facebook:edsonfineartphotography

 

"My soul is painted like the wings of butterflies
Fairy tales of yesterday, grow but never die
I can fly, my friends

The show must go on
The show must go on
I'll face it with a grin
I'm never giving in
On with the show"

Lyrics by Queen

story:
Lou Reed in Amsterdam 1972 - 1977

I'm happy to present to you my new photo-book about legendary musician and poet Lou Reed (Brooklyn NY, March 2 1942 – Southampton NY, October 27 2013). 

One of the greatest artists in rock music

In 1972, Lou Reed releases his first solo album after leaving the legendary rock band The Velvet Underground two years earlier. He also goes on tour. Reed has a contrasting image of sex, drugs & rock ‘n’ roll, and does not hesitate to fool his audience and insult journalists. In these early years, Reed’s solo career is already erratic and reckless but that does not affect his rising popularity. In the mid-seventies, he seems to find his true form on stage and the rock ‘n’ roll animal disappears from view to make way for a more ‘ordinary’ Reed. Musically and lyrically, Reed is a poet. He shows, however, that he is also one of the greatest artists in rock music.

Text and design

Sebastiaan Vos (author of my book ’David Bowie The Seventies’) provides an informative account of the early years of Lou Reed’s solo career and offers an excellently documented description of my photographs of Reed. Chiel Veffer is responsible for the beautiful design of the book.

My number five

After the publication of my book ‘Abba...Zappa Seventies Rock Photography’ I made a few more successful books about artists: David Bowie, Patti Smith, Bob Marley, and The Rolling Stones. I thought a book with Lou Reed as the subject, one of my favorite artists, shouldn’t be missing. And voila, it’s coming: Lou Reed in Amsterdam. 

 

Order now

This is not a classic help-me-out crowd funding campaign. The book will be out in the second half of May. The circulation is limited to 750 copies. You are the first to hear about the book and can pre-order it now. Order the book now and you will have an autographed copy soon.

Or,

Order two copies of the book. One for yourself and one to give away or archive.

Or,

Order the book plus a limited edition photo of Lou Reed. I will sign it for you.

(photo 1)(

(photo 2)

(photo 3)

story:
Summary

Your contribution to Faces of Reading + 10 will ensure that every Face is represented by a high quality durably mounted print on the Freedman Gallery Wall, helping visitors to see, at a glance, the distinctive diversity of the Reading community. Careful mounting will also give Faces a life beyond the current exhibition.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming for $9000, the amount we need for high quality mounted prints of every Face. If we raise in excess of $9000, that additional amount will help to fund our ongoing efforts at community photography in Reading, and possibly towards a print publication based on Faces of Reading + 10. We are offering several perks in addition to our thanks: prints, posters, and photo sessions, depending on your contribution.

 

The Impact

The Faces of Reading exhibition in 2005 gave thousands of visitors the chance to envision the Reading community in all its diversity. Participants were excited to see themselves as part of a larger whole. And everyone was prompted to reflect on their own relationship to society. If we can achieve the same high production values, we hope that this new exhibition will have an even greater impact.

 

Risks & Challenges

If we fall short in our campaign, there will still be an exhibition. Many participants have made contributions, as has Albright College, of course. But it might turn out that the prints would not be of high quality or that many of the Faces would appear as projections. We have plans B & C, but we have high hopes that you will support a truly beautiful exhibition.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that many residents of Reading, including many of the people we photographed, lack the means to make a monetary contributions. We hope that everyone will participate by visiting the Faces of Reading  + 10 exhibition at the Freedman Gallery at Albright College. We hope that they will encourage their friends to visit. We hope that you will take a few moments to share this Indiegogo link with your own social media community.

 

Follow Our Story

Facebook

Instagram

YouTube

Website
