story:
Introducing PBC by CDA-TEK

The PBC is a pocket sized device that enables you to control and monitor the settings of your Blackmagic Pocket Cinema camera wirelessly over Bluetooth.

The two switches on the PBC have three operational modes ; Single click, double click and long click, each of which can have a different function assigned to them.

This flexibility means you can configure the PBC to switch between controlling up to six different settings on the camera including aperture, ISO, White Balance, Auto Focus, Auto Exposure and of course start stop of recording.

The current settings of the camera are displayed on the PBC's bright daylight readable screen which you can configure in any one of four different colour schemes. In addition the screen switches to red to provide a clear visual reference when the camera is recording.

From power on, the PBC connects to your camera in under 5 seconds and its large capacity internal rechargeable battery provides over five hours of continuous run time as well as being able to powered directly by USB.

Whilst the PBC is a small handheld device it can of course be mounted to a rig or gimbal or even the camera itself using a tripod adapter rail.

As well as offering direct control of the camera functionality itself, the PBC can also be used as a wireless interface hub to incorporate both the Tilta Nucleus Nano focus wheel and our own upcoming PXP expander module (*PXP expander module will be available before Q2 2020).

With the Nucleus Nano wheel in Bluteooth mode, the PBC enables you to have focus control of native and adapted EF lenses on your camera with compatible adapters without requiring gears, motors or additional power as well as being able to start and stop recording. 

As the PBC operates in tandem with the Nucleus Nano wheel, this combination offers you complete hands off control of the camera, something which is very beneficial when it is mounted on a gimbal.

Using our PXP module you can also expand the possibilities of the PBC with an additional five assignable physical switches to directly control camera functions as well as an inbuilt focus control wheel. 

Whether you are using the Nucleus Nano wheel or own PXP to control focus, you are able to use the PBC to store two focus points and then use the focus limiter function to prevent overshooting when transitioning between them.

All of the PBC's settings and focus control functions are fully compatible with both the Blackmagic Pocket 4K and Pocket6K cameras.

What We Need & What You Get

The PBC is feature complete from a software and hardware perspective and we are now seeking funding purely for production rather than development.

We have 3 levels of pre-order perks, each with a different discount level from the retail price of the PBC as well as a discount on our next project, the accompanying PXP expander unit.

The first two tiers of pre-order (First Wave and Second Wave) are limited to the first 50 orders for each.

About CDA-TEK

We are a small company based in Dublin, Ireland and specialise in developing custom camera control solutions.

Our 3C Android app was made available for sale in early 2019 and is a comprehensive remote control system for the Blackmagic Pocket4K Cinema Camera and has received several feature upgrades including the integration of the Tilta Nucleus Nano focus wheel.

3C will be shortly receive an update to enable it to be compatible with the Blackmagic Pocket6K Cinema Camera.

We have also shown a development version of an innovative LIDAR based continuous autofocus system that is highly anticipated by users of the Blackmagic Cinema Cameras.

The PBC will act as an interface hub between the camera and the LIDAR auto focus system.

Risks & Challenges

The PBC is feature complete from a software and hardware perspective so is a low risk project to support as the funding is purely for production of the units.

As with every project as it enters production, there may be unexpected challenges in terms of component supply and shipping delays from suppliers but as we do not have a reliance on a single supplier for any component, we are confident that this risk has been mitigated as much as possible,

story:
Summary:

James Bourret is a fine art landscape photographer based in Ketchum Idaho. He was raised in northern California with a love and reverence for the natural landscape. He is motivated by concern for the future of our environment, and desire to make strong, compelling images.

Donating to this project will help fund the publication of the book of photographs Forces of Nature, 

The book Forces of Nature seeks to document the power of natural forces in the landscape. Sun, wind, water, fire, and ice (and man's influence) are all powerful forces which shape the landscape in differing ways, sometimes obvious and sometimes subtle. These photographs illustrate the raw and visceral experience of those forces.

The book will be on-demand printed, which guarantees every backer a copy of the book.

What you get by backing:

+  A copy of the book, a high quality and elegant book of black and white photographs.

+  Immense satisfaction in knowing you've supported a creative, environmental cause.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this project with your friends, using social media and the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Globe Kard is a postcard subscription service. Delivering high-quality, limited-edition, postcards, on a monthly basis.

!! PROMO: Subscribe for ANY period and I'll send two (2) FREE cards out to who ever you desire!!

Short Summary

Hi Everyone!  I love traveling, photography, and mail. I looked for a way to combine all three of these loves into one single product, and thought of Globe Kard! A postcard showcasing a photo I took from around the world, and some info on that country. 

I want to share my photos from around the world with you! And in doing so, I hope to do several things:

  • Introduce you to new places
  • Let you learn a little bit about that country
  • Ignite a fuse to get you out there and travelling

These postcards are not only good for adults but great for kids as well. Each card contains a map and flag of the country, and you can look forward to receiving a new card each month, taking you on a virtual journey around the world!

Nowadays, receiving mail is a rare and joyous occasion. And when I say "mail," I don't mean credit card statements and junk flyers - I'm talking about real mail: letters, photos, and postcards from far-away friends.

I want to bring back the postcard in style, so I've decided to design some postcards, one for each month, and ship them worldwide. Each card is an exploration of of the world, and is lovingly designed.



What We Need & What You Get

The funding goes into getting your cards up and running:

  • I'm setting the goal at around 100-300 people signing up to get the ball rolling on the project. Thankfully, there aren't too many large one time costs, and most of the cost is in the postcards themselves, so the risk is lowered.
  • I need people (that's where you come in) to receive the cards and help spread the word about this project and in return you'll get some sweet perks

The Impact

  • This project will expand your thinking to include the world, taking you on a journey. My intent is to show you some awesome places and people along the way.
  • I've already traveled to 40+ countries and I need a place to share my photos with you.

Risks & Challenges

I've managed multiple projects in my day job, and this will be nothing new. The largest risk is not finding a substantial amount of people to send postcards to, since the printing costs go way down as the quantity goes up. I'm shooting for at least 100 people, and more is always better too, since the numbers scale up very easily. This 100 number will keep costs steady and manageable. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out! Pass this page's link on to your friends!
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools found on this page.

story:
The Story

Four short years ago, I bought a camera and began teaching myself how such a thing works. I roamed the streets taking pictures of random buildings and subjected my friends to hours upon hours of photo shoots in the studio I set up in our apartment. After gaining a sense of confidence in my photography skills, I upgraded from a Canon Rebel to a professional grade camera, the Canon 5D Mark ii. This brought me into a whole new game and I proceeded building my portfolio anticipating the day I would launch as a professional photographer. Unfortunately, a couple weeks ago after photographing a party at a nightclub near Times Square, I had my camera taken out of my bag along with 3 lenses. I have filed a police report but at this point recovery is a long shot. I'm here in an attempt to replace the stolen equipment so I can continue my pursuit.

Where's It Going?

  • The funds will go directly into funding the replacement of the $4,400 in stolen equipment. Prioritizing the camera itself and additional funds going to lenses that will allow me to continue shooting in various environments such as performance spaces, nightclubs, special events.
  • Any funds above replacement costs will go toward further expanding my photography toward launching as a  business; a website, business cards, upgraded lenses and studio rental.
  • A small cushion will be set aside to pay for taxes charged on amount raised, and also sales taxes.
  • If the goal is not obtained in full, all funds will still go toward equipment. While the primary goal is to replace a Canon 5D, I will purchase a different model.

What's In It For You?

  • As a token of my appreciation I'm offering a variety of incentives ranging from prints of images previous projects, to personalized photo shoots and event photography. Incentives are also able to be gifted, so if you are unable to receive them, I will happily honor fulfilling the item to a friend of your choosing!

How Else You Can Help

I totally understand many of you are poor like me. But there ARE other ways you can by spreading the word!

  • Know of a friend who needs new photos?
  • Know a party that will need event photos?
  • Know a band who needs marketing material?

Let them know! Package incentives will help them get the images they need.


Click the Gallery Tab above to see more work!
story_txt:
The Story
Four short years ago, I bought a camera and began teaching myself how such a thing works. I roamed the streets taking pictures of random buildings and subjected my friends to hours upon hours of photo shoots in the studio I set up in our apartment. After gaining a sense of confidence in my photography skills, I upgraded from a Canon Rebel to a professional grade camera, the Canon 5D Mark ii. This brought me into a whole new game and I proceeded building my portfolio anticipating the day I would launch as a professional photographer. Unfortunately, a couple weeks ago after photographing a party at a nightclub near Times Square, I had my camera taken out of my bag along with 3 lenses. I have filed a police report but at this point recovery is a long shot. I'm here in an attempt to replace the stolen equipment so I can continue my pursuit. 
  Where's It Going?  The funds will go directly into funding the replacement of the $4,400 in stolen equipment. Prioritizing the camera itself and additional funds going to lenses that will allow me to continue shooting in various environments such as performance spaces, nightclubs, special events.
Any funds above replacement costs will go toward further expanding my photography toward launching as a  business; a website, business cards, upgraded lenses and studio rental. 

A small cushion will be set aside to pay for taxes charged on amount raised, and also sales taxes.
 If the goal is not obtained in full, all funds will still go toward equipment. While the primary goal is to replace a Canon 5D, I will purchase a different model.


What's In It For You?
 As a token of my appreciation I'm offering a variety of incentives ranging from prints of images previous projects, to personalized photo shoots and event photography. Incentives are also able to be gifted, so if you are unable to receive them, I will happily honor fulfilling the item to a friend of your choosing!
   How Else You Can Help I totally understand many of you are poor like me. But there ARE other ways you can by spreading the word!  Know of a friend who needs new photos? 

Know a party that will need event photos?
Know a band who needs marketing material?

Let them know! Package incentives will help them get the images they need.














Click the Gallery Tab above to see more work!

story:
Short Summary

This project aims to raise the finances needed for Craig to purchase the photographic equipment he needs and to open a photography studio in order to develop his photography business.  But more importantly, it is about giving Craig the chance to put his life back on track. It is about helping him to reach a position where he can support himself and his children without having to rely on others on an ongoing basis.

Background

In 2001 Craig was running an Internet and IT consulting business in London when his wife, who was pregnant with their fourth child, became sick. With the Dot Com bubble burst of the time, things were slow and he took the decision to close the business down for a few months to help look after the kids until the birth. Unfortunately, a week after the baby was born, his wife was diagnosed with stomach cancer at the age of 36. Although she initially went into remission after treatment, the cancer returned and she passed away in early 2004 leaving him with four young children, then aged 9, 6, 3 and 1.

It was a blessing to have had the ability to be with his family full-time during that period, but it wasn't long after she passed away that finances meant he would have to shortly return to work. But with 3 years out of the IT world everything had changed, making it difficult to return to the same profession. So, in the summer of 2004, he decided to risk everything, sell the house and return to college to obtain a masters degree as a route back to job market. He choose to do so here in Utah in the hope of providing his children with a fresh start, and ended up studying for a Master of Business Administration with a supply chain and strategy emphasis.

However, things didn't quite go according to plan. The sale on his house in London, which had not been finalized when he moved out here, ran into difficulties. When the sale finally completed, he was left with approximately $50,000 less than anticipated. This meant that his funds ran out long before he had finished the MBA. Gladly, with the help of the college and others, a solution was found he and managed to graduate at the end of 2007, no easy feat for a single parent with young kids. 

But that wasn't the end of his problems, upon graduating his visa situation became messed up and he was unable to legally work for almost a year. Also with no funds left he was unable to afford to return to the UK and found himself in a very difficult situation trying to survive with his growing family.

Again thanks to others, a solution to the visa problem was found and he eventually began working for a startup company. Once more though, things didn't go according to plan and less than two years later the company ran out of funds and laid everyone off. Craig found himself, with little experience in a new career path, approaching age 50 and in an economy still struggling to recover. Despite a few promising early interviews, a new position failed to materialize. As time progressed, interviews became less frequent, until now, after almost 5 years out of the job market, he has become basically unemployable. He has barely survived during that time through doing occasional handyman jobs and by the good graces of others. As you can imagine this has taken a hard toil on Craig and his children.

It was during this difficult time that Craig rediscovered an old passion for photography. Finding a creative outlet through photography provided a much needed way to reduce the stress that he was going through. But more than that Craig realized that not only did he enjoy photography but that he had the ability to be good at it. After much encouragement from others, Craig started a photography business about a year and a half ago in the hope of it eventually providing a way back to supporting his family while being able to follow his passion. 

However, being a photographer isn't cheap, and without the proper equipment, difficult to succeed in the commercial and art worlds where his photography interests lie. As you might imagine, given the difficulty of the past few year, Craig is not in a position on his own to raise the finances he needs to move forward. It is because of this that he has turned to crowd funding in a hope to raised the needed funds. And that is where you come in. He hopes, that through your generous support and contributions, he might obtain the assistance he needs to once more become self-reliant and be able to provide a future for his children.

What We Need & What You Get

Craig's plan is to not only upgrade his equipment, needed to provide the quality of images required for his area of work, but to open a photography studio. The studio will not only be utilized for his own photography but will be open for the use of other photographers in the area that lack their own studio space. It is anticipated that the income received from studio memberships and rentals will not only cover the ongoing overheads, but provide a means to continue investing in the studio.

The funds needed cover a number of categories, the breakdown of which is illustrated in the following chart.


The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

Insufficient Funds Raised

The biggest risk to the project is not reaching the targeted amount. If this is to occur there are various approaches that could be taken. The first is to substantially reduce the scope of the project. The first priority needs to be the upgraded camera equipment, followed by some lighting equipment. Once these items have been met, then we will evaluate the balance of funds and what is still possible. If the shortfall isn't too substantial then it may be possible to raise bank financing to bridge the deficit. 

Failure To Find Suitable Location

The aim is to ideally find premises in the Provo/Orem area that offers natural light. However, locations with natural light can be much more difficult to find and tends to be a little more expensive. If natural light is not possible then a location without natural light will be sought. We are confident that there are sufficient vacant premises in the area that finding something quickly should not be difficult.

Insufficient Interest From Other Photographers

The business model for the studio is based on being able to find sufficient photographers in the area willing to buy into studio membership, or who wish to rent on an hourly basis. Currently there is only one other studio in the area appearing to offer space to other photographers, and they tend to have a waiting list. There certainly have been numerous photographers expressing interest in studio space but that doesn't always translate to those willing to pay for such.

In the event that sufficient numbers are not found, then the ongoing shortfall will need to be made up by an increase in photography clients. The project takes into account sufficient funds to operate on a three month basis while building up the membership and clients.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to financially contribute or not, your help in spreading the word about this campaign would be much appreciated. The more people hear about it, the better the chances of reaching the target. Remember to utilize the share tools Indiegogo provides.

Thank you for all your support.

story:
Our Mission 

The CLICK! Triangle Photography Festival celebrates the medium of photography and its cultural influence by engaging the North Carolina Triangle community with exceptional photo-based works and artists. The month-long festival in October produces exhibitions, programming and dialog between photographers and community members that inspire artistic excellence, support professional development and promote community engagement.

Photography & Community 

CLICK! has been building in momentum and forging meaningful connections throughout the Triangle for the past 4 years. Our partners host a multitude of events, drawing on their own resources to create this dynamic, lively festival. We have an incredible community of artists, curators, collectors, business owners, and individuals in the Triangle who come together each year. We celebrate the wealth of creative energy and talent in our community!  

Our Partners include: North Carolina Museum of Art, CAM, The Carrack, Light Art+Design, Center for Documentary Studies at Duke University, The Gregg Museum of Art & Design, Craven Allen Gallery, 21c Museum Hotel, Durham Art Guild, FRANK, Through This Lens Gallery, Ackland Art Museum,  & Framer's Corner.

UPDATE! Portfolio Reviews

There are three different review sessions. Please scroll down the list of perks to find the session you want! The schedule of reviewers for the portfolio reviews has shifted slightly. (Indiegogo doesn't allow for edits after a donation has been made, the most accurate list is below.)

New lineup of reviewers:

Oct 4th at CAM-Raleigh:
Kelly McChesney
David Simonton
Tom Rankin

Oct 11th at UNC's Wilson Library-Chapel Hill:
John Rosenthal
Stephen Fletcher
Caitlin Margaret Kelly

Oct 18th at 21C Museum Hotel-Durham:
Alexa Dilworth
Roger Manley
Linda Dougherty

There are nine total slots for reviewees for each of these dates. Sign up today!

Update! CLICK! T-shirts are here! 

Show your support of CLICK! By sporting this 100% cotton, pre-shrunk, jersey knit, comfy T-shirt you will help raise awareness of this unique community celebration of photographic artists & organizations in the Triangle! 

Our Volunteers 
This year we have assembled a team of passionate, unpaid volunteers to coordinate and work together with our community partners. We believe strongly in the value of this annual event and we are excited for the month of October! The CLICK! team of unpaid volunteers includes: Bryce Lankard, Barbara Tyroler, Chris Vitiello, Malina Chavez, Ray Pfeiffer, Stephen Fletcher, Roylee Duvall, Jessica Berkowitz, Jim Lee, Alicia Lange, and Rachel McClain. 

CLICK! Events

We have a fantastic schedule of over 70 events this year including:


John Rosenthal - Artist Lecture “Learning How to Photograph the Lower 9th Ward” 

Lecture and book signing of his work AFTER: The Silence of the Lower 9th Ward  at FRANK Gallery


Private Portals Exhibition - Celebrating Women Artists from the Cassilhaus Collection

A sampling of artists include: Eve Arnold, Meredith Brickell, Sheila Pree Bright, Moyra Davey, Carolyn Drake, Mona Kuhn, Annie Leibovitz, Sally Mann, Lisa McCarty, Louise Nevelson, Deborah Oropallo, Alison Rossiter, Helen Sear, Lauren Semivan, MJ Sharp, and Rachel Perry Welty.

Sheila Pree Bright, "Untitled 20" from her series, Suburbia.


Workshop: Intro to Wet Plate Collodion 

Mary Ann Mitchell @ Durham Arts Council School 

Artwork by Mary Ann Mitchell, from her series Meet Me In My Dreams



Festival Kickoff Event!

                           Projections in Two Acts

 
Join CLICK! to celebrate the opening night of the festival at an under the stars projection event! Act One will feature Fotoflic, a themed series of artist images curated by Chris Vitiello. Act Two will be an open/invitational free form series. You, the public, are invited to produce a 3-5 minute slide show from stills or a short video. Stay tuned for more details about tech specs and how to submit and where we will be having this event.

CLICK! has coordinated over 70 Events in October!


We Need Your Help To Cover Our Most Basic Costs... 

By making a contribution to this campaign you will be playing a valuable role in supporting the arts and enriching your community. Your donation will be used to fund the CLICK! Triangle Photo Festival in the most fundamental ways. We have no administrative costs. For this DIY, volunteer-led effort we need funding to cover the hard costs of the following items: 

  • Design and Print Festival Program, Distribution & Marketing
  • Web Domain Costs
  • Kickoff Projection Event
  • Maintaing Membership for our Non-Profit Fiscal Sponsorship


Total Amount Needed: $6,000*


Your donation is vital to the basic needs of CLICK! This important annual festival is continually growing and evolving. We are looking to the future and expanding our reach with new programming. Each year, our Volunteers, Partners, and Sponsors  generously donate their time, skills, ideas, and resources. Now we ask you for your support. Donate any amount, small or large. Every donation counts! Let's make this year's festival a great success!

*If we exceed our goal, the funds will be directed toward the costs of next year's festival. Planning for next year will begin in November 2015. Our Volunteers and Partners are already communicating about new, innovative ways to expand our programming for CLICK! 2016. 

What Will You Get In Return?
We are grateful to community members, businesses, and organizations for donating their Perk items! We have a wonderful list of Perks to choose from, as a thank you for your contribution, including:

PROFESSIONAL PORTFOLIO REVIEWS 

This is an exciting and rare opportunity to meet one-on-one with leading industry professionals, artists, curators, collectors, and gallery owners. Portfolio reviews provide critical feedback, networking opportunities, and are invaluable to artists at all stages of their careers. Bring your portfolio and receive three 20-minute, professional reviews. Choose from one of 3 locations: 21c in Durham, Wilson Library in Chapel Hill, and CAM in Raleigh. 
Reviewers: Alexa Dillworth, John Rosenthal, Caitlin Margaret Kelly, David Simonton, Kelly McChesney, Tom Rankin, Linda Dougherty, Stephen Fletcher, & Roger Manley.  Space is limited! Donate & reserve your spot today! 
   



CASSILHAUS ARCHITECTURE & PRIVATE COLLECTION TOUR 
A private (Cassilhaus has no public hours) dual architectural/art tour for you and up to five of your friends. Tour the house with Architect and owner Ellen Cassilly, who designed this beautiful house. Then tour the contemporary photography collection with Frank Konhaus, Cassilhaus Director, Collection manager, and co-owner. See our Perks for details.

Cassilhaus is a unique community arts hub housed in a private residence owned by Ellen Cassilly and Frank Konhaus between Durham and Chapel Hill. We aspire to integrate and instigate -- to stir up the cultural landscape through interactive programming associated with our multi-disciplinary artist residency, ambitious exhibition program, and contemporary photography collection. 

Edith, Chincoteague, Virginia 1967  Gelatin Silver Print. In the collection of Cassilhaus.

Cassilhaus 

A Great Selection of Photography Books from Daylight books are available as perks,

Great Titles such as: Johnathan Saruk: Forbidden Reel, Henry Jacobson: Postcards Home, Brady Robinson: Art Desks, Nancy Davidson: Cowgirls,  and Elaine Mayes: Recently.
http://daylightbooks.org/

FULL and MAJOR SPONSORSHIP STATUS 

Would your business or organization like connect with your community and show your support for art in the Triangle? For any donation of $250 you will gain Full Sponsorship Status. For $1000 you will become a Platinum Sponsor. Your logo will be displayed on our website and printed on our official CLICK! Triangle Photography Festival Program, which will be distributed widely throughout the entire Triangle area. Platinum Sponsor name or Logo receives extra emphasis in printed materials and a special shout out at CLICK! events where we have a presenting representative. See our Perks for details. 

                          


LIMITED EDITION SILK SCREEN PRINTS, by Bryce Lankard 
Receive a custom silk screen print produced by Ink Floyd in Charlotte NC of artwork by Bryce Lankard, "Postal Worker, Washington Square, New York City, 1984." This is a limited edition of 30, signed and numbered. 12.5x19" See our Perks for details.


New Perks will be released throughout the campaign! Sign up for our newsletter on our website for new offers & special CLICK! announcements!


What Is The Plan?

We strongly believe that our goal of $6,000 is attainable through our CLICK! Campaign. However, with all crowd funding campaigns there is always a chance of not reaching the projected goal. We have taken this into careful consideration. Our approach would be as follows:

  • Through our contacts and connections we would reach out directly to individuals and businesses for additional support.
  • If necessary, we would scale back costs to the best of our ability, not sacrificing quality of our print material. 
  • Please note that our campaign does not require us to reach our goal in order to receive funding. Under no circumstances would those who donated be denied their Perks. All Perks will be fulfilled. 
  • All businesses that received Full and Major Sponsorship Status will have their logo printed on the official CLICK! Triangle Photography Festival Program, regardless of whether our campaign reaches its goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

Donate your swag items! 

Businesses and artists are invited to donate goods, gift certificates, artwork, or promotional material to our Indiegogo campaign. We greatly value donations made by community members and will use them as fundraising Perks!

Help us spread the word!

Post and share about our campaign via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, via email, and word-of-mouth. Use our customized URL to direct people to this campaign! http://igg.me/at/click-triangle-photo-festival

Sign up for our Newsletter! 

Keep up on events for the month of October! Find out updated information about exhibitions, artist talks, and unique happenings, including the secret location of our Closing Halloween Party/Popup Show!  That's right! Only those who subscribe to our newsletter will be given the exact location!

Come to the festival, and bring your friends! 

Enjoy the events! Connect with the arts community at the CLICK! Triangle Photo Festival throughout the month of October in the Triangle! We'll see you there!

We aspire to integrate and instigate -- to stir up the cultural landscape through interactive programming associated with our multi-disciplinary artist residency, ambitious exhibition program, and contemporary photography collection. 


Edith, Chincoteague, Virginia 1967  Gelatin Silver Print. In the collection of Cassilhaus. Cassilhaus 


A Great Selection of Photography Books from Daylight books are available as perks, Great Titles such as: Johnathan Saruk: Forbidden Reel, Henry Jacobson: Postcards Home, Brady Robinson: Art Desks, Nancy Davidson: Cowgirls,  and Elaine Mayes: Recently.http://daylightbooks.org/


FULL and MAJOR SPONSORSHIP STATUS 


Would your business or organization like connect with your community and show your support for art in the Triangle? For any donation of $250 you will gain Full Sponsorship Status. For $1000 you will become a Platinum Sponsor. Your logo will be displayed on our website and printed on our official CLICK! Triangle Photography Festival Program, which will be distributed widely throughout the entire Triangle area. Platinum Sponsor name or Logo receives extra emphasis in printed materials and a special shout out at CLICK! events where we have a presenting representative. See our Perks for details. 



                          


LIMITED EDITION SILK SCREEN PRINTS, by Bryce Lankard 

Receive a custom silk screen print produced by Ink Floyd in Charlotte NC of artwork by Bryce Lankard, "Postal Worker, Washington Square, New York City, 1984." This is a limited edition of 30, signed and numbered. 12.5x19" See our Perks for details.






New Perks will be released throughout the campaign! Sign up for our newsletter on our website for new offers & special CLICK! announcements!


What Is The Plan?


We strongly believe that our goal of $6,000 is attainable through our CLICK! Campaign. However, with all crowd funding campaigns there is always a chance of not reaching the projected goal. We have taken this into careful consideration. Our approach would be as follows:



Through our contacts and connections we would reach out directly to individuals and businesses for additional support.

If necessary, we would scale back costs to the best of our ability, not sacrificing quality of our print material. 
Please note that our campaign does not require us to reach our goal in order to receive funding. Under no circumstances would those who donated be denied their Perks. All Perks will be fulfilled. 
All businesses that received Full and Major Sponsorship Status will have their logo printed on the official CLICK! Triangle Photography Festival Program, regardless of whether our campaign reaches its goal.



Other Ways You Can Help




Donate your swag items! 
Businesses and artists are invited to donate goods, gift certificates, artwork, or promotional material to our Indiegogo campaign. We greatly value donations made by community members and will use them as fundraising Perks!

Help us spread the word!
Post and share about our campaign via Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, via email, and word-of-mouth. Use our customized URL to direct people to this campaign! http://igg.me/at/click-triangle-photo-festival



Sign up for our Newsletter! 
Keep up on events for the month of October! Find out updated information about exhibitions, artist talks, and unique happenings, including the secret location of our Closing Halloween Party/Popup Show!  That's right! Only those who subscribe to our newsletter will be given the exact location!

Come to the festival, and bring your friends! 
Enjoy the events! Connect with the arts community at the CLICK! Triangle Photo Festival throughout the month of October in the Triangle! We'll see you there!

story:
Story

My name is Lisa Missenda; I am a Fine Art Photographer. Throughout my life, I have always been fascinated with how things are connected, especially when, on the surface, they seem to be so different. It is interesting to untangle how one moment in time has expanded beyond its origin. By tracing these moments, we can identify how that single moment influenced another moment and created a series of events in history. This coming April, I have a rare opportunity to visit the cradle of monotheism on a trip to Turkey, Greece, and Italy. In a world divided by our ideologies, this will be an incredible opportunity to explore the origins of faith and ideas. 

 

 

I will capture moments that speak to this theme in Istanbul, Ephesus, Patmos, Crete, Athens, Corinth, Pompeii and Rome. By combining my detailed daily journal and a carefully curated selection of photographs, I will create a unique Fine Art photo book that charts the journey of Monotheism in the ancient world, all through the eye and heart of a modern mystic.  

 

 

To make this project possible, I need to ask for help. Contributions will go toward the expenses of the trip and the printing of the first 200 books. 

How your contribution helps:

The project budget breakdown. 

  • Cost of trip = $3498 
  • Insurance and expenses= $775 
  • Publishing of book = $1558 
  • Freight and shipping =$300 
  • Stripe and Indiegogo fees = $485 

Total = $6600 

 

 

Perks

By supporting my project, your contribution will be rewarded with one of these amazing perks.

  • Access to Daily Blog Site: Every supporter will get access to my Indiegogo updates. If internet access is available, I will provide live updates throughout the 11-day trip. If no internet access is available during the trip, I will post my journal notes on the first days back in the States. Also included is access to the exclusive website that will include the photos and travel journal.
  • 12 x 12 Hardcover Copy of the Book: The book will be a 12x12 hardcover book with a full-color dust jacket. It will capture the full beauty of these ancient countries, inspired by the wonder of history and faith. 
  • 7 x7 Softcover Copy of the Book: I will also be offering a soft-bound 7x7 printing of the book. This will contain all the same photographs from the book in a beautiful small edition, printed in full photographic color. 
  • 16 x 20 Fine Art Framed Print: For those who are extra generous with your support, I will also offer a 16x20 Fine Art print from the book. Each print will be archival printed, signed and framed. 
  • MORE...There are more perks on the right to check out. 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Every trip has risks and challenges for the traveler. But as a modern mystic, I am aware that things don’t always go as planned. It is in those moments of disarray that the miracles can happen. I will have my camera with me to capture, in full color, the adventure that will present itself on my journey.  

 

 

With book publishing, there always seems to be an element of adventure and surprise. Whether it is color, design errors, or production flaws, the challenges are always present. I have experience with on-demand book publishing and 20-years of professional experience working with color and photographs. My knowledge of how digital printshops work will help me navigate these challenges to bring you a beautiful product that truly captures the history and mystery of monotheism in these ancient cities.

story:
I know that there are a growing number of content posted by the athletes on Instagram and other platforms, but I still think beside the phone selfies there is a need for high quality photos and videos with the proper lighting, posing, and gear. 

Models also like to show off their hard work after years of training and months of diet during the contest preparation. I hope this way, with the help of the fans - with your support - it will be possible to make amazing photos and videos which you all enjoy! 

The funding would cover the cost of the shooting, including the travelling and accommodation costs. The first competitions will start in April, and lasts till June. In these 3 months are the models in the best shape. 100% guaranteed that the video footage will be delivered for all contributors, even if the campaign goal is not met. 

The model who I will shoot with will be in bodyfitness/figure category, between bikini and bodybuilding categories. I have a short list, but the shooting will be fixed only in March. 

You can find my work on facebook, instagram, youtube, vimeo: Zoltan Vegh Photography

Thank you for reading, and I hope you will be one of the supporters!

story:
Who am I? 

My name is Jennifer Yu. I'm a documentary photographer based in Chicago. 

What is the project? 

In February 2016, I'll be relocating to São Paulo, Brazil to dedicate a year of my life to documenting the visual stories of individuals and communities going through points of transition. Through visual storytelling, I want to amplify a diversity of perspectives when it comes to bringing about social equality. Documentary photography gives us in-depth access to exposing unseen or ignored realities that can deepen our understanding and emotional connections to everything in this world. 

During my time there, I want to create strong bonds within underprivileged communities in Brazil as well as connect with other individuals who are already working on missions towards positive social reform. My role as a photographer won't be to seek the answers but to chronicle the process of these local and global shift changes. I'd like to focus my efforts towards topics that have a personal impact for me. I want to be able to open up a platform where we can develop transparency through dialogue about issues such as the lack of access to a fundamental education for impoverish communities or the augmentation of sex tourism. The layers of life that we live as we progress through these transitions. The moments where we choose to pull back or push forward. The points where opposition can create growth. Everything in between. 

What is the funding for? 

A majority of the funding will go towards travel expenses, transportation costs, visa expenses, housing, upgrades to camera equipment and shipping/processing fees for standard international mailing of all archival prints.

Why is this project important?

Photography has provided me a creative outlet to express who I am. Everyday, I am so grateful to have connected to something that continually inspires me. It gives me access to create connections, collaborations, and a constantly expanding openness to experience life all around me. From my upbringing to my everyday experiences, they have shaped me into the person I am today. Despite all the circumstances,  I believe that all life is invaluable. Photography has the ability to vividly educate that truth and it can change everything. It can transform the way we see people and understand the world. Your contributions will go directly into enabling me to further exploring where these some of these deep-rooted truths lie for the people of Brazil.

story:
Animosity is a new book by Aaron Gekoski

The world's wildlife is in 'catastrophic decline' due to the activities of mankind. Wildlife populations have fallen by more than two-thirds in less than 50 years, according to a major report by the conversation group WWF.

Help us create a vital new book, Animosity, which through the images of environmental photojournalist, Aaron Gekoski, shows us how wild animals are being exploited, tragically used as tourist attractions or for domestic pets, and consumed and traded to the point of extinction. It is a book that needs to be seen to be believed!

A Unique Photographic Journey

Aaron, aka 'Bertie' to his friends, has spent the past decade documenting human-animal conflict. He has won numerous awards for his photography including the coveted Wildlife Photographer of the Year and Nature Photographer of the Year competitions.

Royalties from the book will go directly towards photographic investigations that expose animal welfare issues.

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • To produce a book of this quality is expensive. The design and print costs of the standard and limited edition versions will exceed £10,000.
  • Royalties from the book will go directly to Aaron to enable him to continue his pioneering work around the world bringing the plight of abused animals to the attention of people who care.
  • Not only can pledgers receive early copies of the standard book, they can also buy a signed and numbered exclusive limited edition as well as signed limited edition prints.
  • The ultimate reward is to interview Aaron on a one-to-one basis via an audio visual call about his career, working practices and ambitions.

The Impact

The publication of this book will help raise awareness around the world of a number of key conservation issues.

  • Issues covered include Wildlife Tourism, marine conservation, otters and the exotic pet trade,  shark finning, seal culling, Cambodia's dog meat trade, the township dogs of Cape Town, West Africa's Voodoo markets, training as a wildlife ranger, Madagascar's tortoise mafia, and more.
  • Our previous track record in book production (we are seasoned producers of books like this with our last books being on Orangutan Rescue and the Last Dance (Dancing Bears of India)) will ensure the project is produced on time and to budget.
  • Your support will ensure this book is published and more people become aware of the issues raised, which will be even more important in a post Covid 19 world. 

Sea gypsy catches mantis shrimp in Borneo

Shrimp in hands with bycatch

Animal heads used for Voodoo

Risks & Challenges

We are well versed in book production, the designer for the book has been commissioned and we don't anticipate any problems during the production process with the printer that we know well who has a reputation for printing books of this type to very high standards. The books will go on press immediately after the campaign has finished with production taking around six weeks to complete before the books are mailed out to supporters.

Monkey with bike, Phuket Zoo

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the campaign far and wide using the Indie GoGo share tools to spread the word on this exciting project to help get the book published!

story:
Help fund "PHOTOGRAPHY IS POETRY": 2020 Traveling Show by purchasing an art zine, a print or booking one-on-one Q&A chat session with artist Angelika Ejtel alias RapidHeartMovement. Every dollar helps bring this project to life, no contribution is too small.

 

 

Hello everyone!

It's I, Angelika Ejtel, self-portrait artist, photography and poetry lover, lost soul. I created this campaign  because I need your help to fund this year's traveling show of mine including 5 juried arts festivals; three of them being ranked #1, #3 and #9 in the 10 TOP ARTS FESTIVALS in the U.S.! This is the best selection I've ever achieved within last 3 years since I started applying to arts festivals in 2017. I decided to make an effort (physical and financial), and travel to expand the exposure of my work. 

The main goal of this campaign is to raise funds to help me upgrade my unprofessional (read crappy) setup of the booth to a professional level as well as cover the cost of traveling and lodging:

  • 70% of the funding will be used for purchasing pro-panels booth setup and a tent
  • 30% of the funding will be used to cover the travel and lodging expenses

 

The Perks

Please, after backing, refer to my online store to choose a print you'd like to have either from my Limited Editions or Collector's Editions, and e-mail me your selection at angelika.ejtel@gmail.com so I can book it for you.

 

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign will enable me to continue sharing my work at art fairs in the U.S. and perhaps inspire a larger audience to find beauty in poetry through the visual language my images speak.

 

Risks & Challenges

It's always challenging to showcase your work at art fairs because of inclement weather. In a blink of an eye your art can get damage due to the rain, strong winds or tornado. Having a professional setup, waterproof tent and proper weights could save you a lot of trouble.  If my campaign is not at least 70% funded, I might be at the risk of using my old unprofessional setup, which I wouldn't like anymore.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, any sharing is greatly appreciated!

Thank you!

story:
How it all started...

It all began on a random spring day in 2009 in Edmonton. My husband, my best friend and I decided to check out the new Humane Society building and love up some dogs. We weren't expecting to adopt but then we looked in a room and saw Walter. He was 8 wks old, sitting there all by himself, staring at the floor and looking rather sad. I went in and he crawled in my lap and kissed my chin. That was that. He was coming home with us. The following year we adopted scruffy little Rupert (actually Rupert adopted my husband by running over and sitting on his foot) and my journey with the camera began. I have always loved photography, but it wasn't until I started capturing the shananigans of my two furry mischief makers that I knew what I was meant to do, I am at my happiest when I'm laying in the dirt with my camera and a bunch of dogs are running towards me at full speed! All animals have such distinct personalities and I love capturing that through my camera. Throughout the years I've been teaching myself everything I can about photography and have grown so much. In 2013 I won the I shot it Dog photography contest. I've also been published a variety of international photography magazines such as Popular Photography, Photography Monthly (Walter made the cover of this one!) and Digital Camera World. A photo I took of Rupert has been licensed to a British greeting card company as part of their Christmas lineup.

What I need to get started

In order for me to start my pet photography business I need a few upgrades. I currently own a Canon T3i. It's been a wonderful little camera but it's getting sluggish. It's low light capability isn't very good and the frames per second are slow. This means I'm limited with what I can do and there are situations where it doesn't allow me to achieve my vision. I would like to get a 5d mkiii full frame camera bundled with the 24-105 lens. This new tool would allow me to take my photography to the next level. I would also like to upgrade my computer. I currently edit on my lap top so I need a much faster desk top with a color calibrated monitor. I'm asking for $5750 cad which will cover the costs of both. If I surpass my goal, I will put the additional funds toward a 70-200 2.8 zoom lens. If I don't achieve my goal, anything raised will be put toward the cost of the camera.

If you decide to help me out on my happy, fur filled photographic adventure I'll be offering a variety of perks. They'll start at $10 for a Wally & Roops postcard up to $350 for a pet photo shoot package.

Taking a business to the next level has it's challenges but luckily I have a great support circle and I know talented photographers I can talk to and ask for advice. I can't wait to see what transpires over the next few months as I get everything going. It's all very exciting!

Other Ways You Can Help

I would really appreciate all the help you could give, even if it's giving this a share on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter. Every little thing helps and means so much to me!

Thank you so much!

Taking a business to the next level has it's challenges but luckily I have a great support circle and I know talented photographers I can talk to and ask for advice. I can't wait to see what transpires over the next few months as I get everything going. It's all very exciting!

Other Ways You Can Help
I would really appreciate all the help you could give, even if it's giving this a share on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter. Every little thing helps and means so much to me!

Thank you so much!

story:
Statement of Intent

Lilith: From Myth To Flesh was born from our desire to explore alternative narratives of femininity that pose a threat to the patriarchal status quo.  We feel the time has come to experience, through photography and performance, the intentionally-concealed story of Lilith, first wife of Adam, the feminine shadow.  Lilith was created of the same earth as Adam, and by right should have been considered his equal.  It was decided for both Lilith and Adam that she should be diminished, and Adam's dominion over nature and Lilith was established. Adam attempted to assert his dominance. Indignant, Lilith chose to flee the Garden of Eden rather than be stripped of her own determination.  Alone in the wilderness, she raged and suffered.  It is through this suffering that she is transformed into her true self.  Lilith's story tells us that it is the dark times, represented by the dark phase of the Moon, which are times of incubation, creativity, and transformation.  

We are exploring Lilith's journey from human to goddess through a 5-part photographic series which, once completed, will be shown at an opening event on the weekend of October 23rd at Trans Pecos, Queens, NYC.  In this series, we will approximate Lilith's suffering by undergoing hook suspension and temporary subdermal implantation.  These trials of the flesh allow us to open a timeless space, where we can access truths about our nature and our history.  These trials were not chosen frivolously; they allow us to present Lilith's story in a way which visually recalls her ordeals. Beyond this, body suspension and personal sacrifice appear in many of the mythologies around the world, which speaks to a greater universal significance.  We feel that photographic documentation of these trials will communicate Lilith's story in a way no written or spoken language possibly could.

We are opening our bodies, literally and metaphorically, to share the teachings of Lilith.  

What We Need

In order to complete this photo series, we are enlisting the help of several specialists.  We will be working with a suspension crew, a body modification artist, a wardrobe stylist, makeup artists, and a graphic designer.  Beyond that, we are also printing these photos using analog techniques, which necessitates experimentation with different darkroom papers, as well as different chemicals.  Already, this series is underway.  We have completed the first of four photo shoots, which depicted the birth of Lilith, as well as her conflict with Adam, and utilized rope suspension.  We are well in the planning stages for the rest of our shoots.  The second will be our hook suspension shoot, where Lilith flies to her cave.  The third is our subdermal implant shoot, depicting Lilith suffering in her solitude.  The last will show Lilith emerging from her cave as transformed into goddess.  Our amazing stylist, Numi Empire, has put together a mood board for the final shoot in the series, and is making a completely custom headpiece and costume for Luna to wear during the final shoot.

Your contribution goes directly towards:

  • Hooks
  • Medical supplies
  • Sculptural implants
  • Shoot location rental
  • Custom wardrobe
  • Transportation for collaborators
  • 5x7 and 11x14 darkroom papers
  • Darkroom chemicals
  • Picture framing
  • Performance venue

What You Get

Our rewards are largely dependent on how the rest of the shoots turn out, as we've currently only photographed a portion of this series.  Therefore, many will be unavailable until the series has been completed.  
One reward which will be available immediately upon the completion of this fundraiser is the $10 reward tier, which is a small vial containing earth and herbs.  It can be wire-wrapped and turned into a pendant, should you desire it.

Some other perks which will be available before the series is completed are the hooks and the "polaroid" (Fuji instant film, technically).  These will be sent out by end-of-august. 

An example of an instant film picture, as well as a sterilized flesh-hook (not for re-use)

Additionally, our tote bags and tshirts will be made available once this fundraiser has finished.

A test-print of a tote bag, in order to see how colors and contrast would reproduce.

The final tote bag design, by Dorothy Schmidt.

Black and white version of Dorothy Schmidt's design, for tshirts

Otherwise, the perks will have to fulfilled once the whole series is photographed and printed.  However, from our first shoot, we have several examples of what 5x7 test prints might look like:

A print using lith developer on Ilford Warmtone Multigrade paper.


An experiment with layering negatives.  Printed onto Ilford Warmtone Multigrade paper, using Ethol LPD liquid developer.


A test of hand-painting over a print.  Lith developer on Ilford Warmtone Multigrade paper, with photo oil paints.


Another experiment in layering negatives.  Ethol LPD developer on Ilford Multigrade Art 300 paper (a highly-textured, cotton-based paper).

The Impact

Lilith's journey follows the classic arc of a resurrection myth.  What makes her narrative particularly compelling is that her journey is an act of insubordination against a patriarchal god who would have her diminish herself for the sake of Adam.  This same patriarchal god is the one whose decrees have shaped western thought, and whose "morals" permeate our contemporary culture.  Trying to confine Lilith in simplistic categories or morals is a foolish effort; she easily defies the conventions into which we've been indoctrinated.

Lilith's story is one of defiance and sacred pain.  She can be found in those who don't live their lives in gilded shackles, who experience all of the suffering associated with living authentically in a society constantly exerting pressure, constantly trying to mold and bend the individual to fit neatly into a predetermined category. 

We hope that this project will encourage dialogue about our most shrouded nature.  We strive to learn collectively of a new approach to understanding ourselves, as well as to coexisting without dominance.

Risks & Challenges

There are real risks involved with these physical practices. Examples of this are abundant. There is a risk of infection, temporary or permanent physical impairment, death; the realities of pushing the boundaries of the flesh. Neither of us, photographer and conduit,  are new to these practices. We both have several years of experience, research, and practice. We have enlisted collaborators who are highly regarded in their field of specialization. These collaborators were chosen on the basis of their knowledge, and practice, of sanitation and sterilization alongside their tenure dedicated to their particular craft. You will get to know more about them and their practice as the campaign progresses.

Undoubtably this project requires a lot of sacrifice from everyone involved, from the time involved in making this a reality to the physical demands of each part of the series. Please bear in mind that signs of this series will be etched into someone's skin for a long time. 

Our Collaborators

Brian Decker:

Widely considered a pioneer in Body Art, Brian Decker has maintained a reputation for being meticulous in his practice of advanced body modification procedures. World renowned for his work in the realm of scarification and modification, his career began as a body piercer 20 years ago. We are extremely fortunate to count on Brian as a collaborator for this photographic series. The years he has dedicated to working with skin and his extensive guidelines for sterilization, make him the ideal person to turn to for this particular project. Luna could not be in better hands 

For this series, Brian will use his knowledge to place temporary implants in Luna’s torso, creating the effect that Luna is giving birth to small snakes which are breaking through her skin.  

White Flag Suspension:

White Flag exists as a set of standards, rather than as a “crew”.  Practitioners include Cere Coichetti, Snow Darling, and Gretchen Heinel, who will be facilitating this suspension.  Our main focus is to act as guide to the suspendee through the ritual of suspension.  We follow the Code of Ethics put forth by the CSP (Council of Spiritual Practices) and work to the highest standards of the suspension community.  We feel suspension should be respected and practiced to effect positive impact on the life of the suspendee.

Numi Empire

Numi is a multimedia artist, producer, writer, maker and breaker of things (not necessarily in that order) and has worn many hats in the Fashion, Art and Photography industries.  Her work has been featured in print publications internationally.  She is obsessed with finding narratives to track the way cultures move.

May Moore

May is a makeup artist based in Philadelphia.  She has been refining her craft for over ten years, and displays a real passion and talent for it.  This project is the second of what will surely be many collaborations between May and Gretchen.

Dorothy Schmidt

Dorothy’s design aesthetic is fueled by her love of typography and meticulous attention to detail.  Her work has been featured in publications such as Time Out New York, Hollywood Reporter, Variety Magazine, Boston Common, Philadelphia Style and many more.  Recent awards include 2013 WEBBY AWARD HONOREE: Best Visual Design - Aesthetic category for the Bryant Park Hotel website in conjection with the website team Orphmedia.

MacK

MacK has run rope for over 25 years, enhancing his own and others' conditions, and supporting creative heterodoxy - be it figurative, musical, photographic, cinematic or live performance. Work featuring his work has auctioned at Phillips de Pury, hangs in the Kinsey Institute Permanent Collection and circulates freely but discretely in thought, homes, galleries and online.

David Coccagna

David is playing the role of Adam for this photo series.  He is a Philadelphia-based musician who works under the moniker Chaperone.  This is the second project which David and Gretchen have collaborated on.

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope that our community not only contributes to our campaign monetarily, but also by joining us in discussion. Some people just can't contribute, we understand. Please help us by sharing our campaign with friends, adding to the dialogue, asking questions, sending us articles, debate; we hope to reach as many people as possible. Indiegogo has conveniently made it easy to share our campaign and progress with their share tools. So please, share!

story:
This project is meant to increase population health by reminding people how important it is to consume more fruits and vegetables every day.

 

 

   Who am I?

 

              My name is Gabriela Beszkai and I am a final year medical student. I spend all of my little free time photographing and reading.

 

                                   

 

 

 

   Why am I doing this?  

    

      Being a passionate medical student but also a passionate photographer, I’ve been searching for a project that would allow me to link these two, to create something beautiful but inspiring and life changing, too. So I thought about the great opportunity of health promotion through my photography. I want to enable people to increase control over their health and to improve it, by making them aware of all the benefits an increased consumption of fruit and vegetable can bring.

       Insufficient fruit&vegetables consumption and obesity are among the major causes of cardiovascular diseases, respiratory diseases, diabetes and cancers.

 

 

   What am I doing...

 

             I made a research on the beneficial effects that some foods have on different organs, that might help prevent diseases and thus improve overall health. I studied the eyes, the brain, lungs, heart, liver, pancreas, digestive tract, kidneys and bones and found that specific foods have important effects on these organs, helping us to prevent diseases and keeping them healthy. I gathered all this information and used those specific vegetables, fruits, spices, nutseeds or herbs to recreate human organs and their functional elements.

 

 

 

 

              Let's take for example, this picture of the lungs recreated out of vegetables. Studies say that including onions, chilli/ CH-19 peppers, cruciferous (especially broccoli, cabbage and cauliflower), ginger, olives, red bell pepper, garlic, duck leaves, spinach and mushrooms in our diet could improve our lung function and prevent infections, asthma and most important, cancer. Lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer-related death worldwide in men and the second-commonest cause in women.

 

 
 

        Moreover, the reconstruction respects the anatomical features, describing structural and functional elements of the organs, just like you can see in these pictures:

 

 

                                                                 The Kidneys

 

                 The Nephron: the urine-producing functional structures of the kidney

 

 

 At least 2.8 million people die each year as a result of overweight or obesity.

             Globally, 42 million children under the age of 5 were overweight or obese in 2013. They are likely to become obese adults and to develop diabetes and cardiovascular diseases at a younger age, which in turn are associated with a higher chance of premature death and disability. More than 1.9 billion adults are overweight and more than half a billion are obese, and the numbers are rapidly increasing. This is why preventing obesity from an early age has become a major public health priority in the developed world. 

   Low fat intake and an increased consumption of fruit and vegetables is strongly associated with wight loss and weight maintenance. 

                A well balanced diet, together with regular physical activity, is one of the most significant factors that determine your health. Fruit and vegetables are important components of a healthy diet, and their sufficient daily consumption could help prevent major diseases such as: obesity, diabetes, heart disease, stroke, cancer. 

             
          As part of a healthy diet low in fat, sugars and sodium, WHO suggests consuming more than 400 grams of fruits and vegetables per day to improve overall health and reduce the risk of certain diseases. 

 

 

How can you help?

 
           After months of reasearch, I spent a whole week just to make a plan for recreating the human lungs. Then I started to set up studio lights, buy the materials I needed, the fruits and vegetables, washed, sliced and arranged, piece by piece, everything I've used in those photographs.
 

 
 
          But all this turned out to be pretty expensive and I rapidly ran out of budget. This is the reason why I'm here on Indiegogo. I need your financial support in order to recreate the other 7 systems,  with all their specific healthy foods and provide further information. Help me to raise awareness about all the benefits of an increased fruit and vegetable consumption through my photography! 
 

          Familiarity strongly influences young children’s food preferences, so early childhood is a crucial time for interventions. Their habits will set the foundation for their lifestyle and risk of disease as adults. Encourage your children and grandchildren to learn anatomy in an interactive way, looking at photographs that catch their eye and make them link our organism with fresh, healthy foods. 

 

          Be a promoter of a healthier lifestyle and make your friends and loved ones aware of all the benefits an increased fruit and vegetable intake can bring!

 

Up to 1.7 million lives could potentially be saved each year if fruit and vegetable consumption were sufficiently increased. (www.who.int)

 

Bibliography:

 

1.  Holly L. Nicastro et al. Garlic and Onions: Their Cancer Prevention Properties- Review. Cancer Prev Res; 8(3); 181–9. American Association for Cancer Research, 2015.

2.  Zi-Yi Jin et al. Raw Garlic Consumption as a Protective Factor for Lung Cancer, a Population-Based Case–Control Study in a Chinese Population. Cancer Prev Res; 6(7); 711–8. 2013, American Association for  CancerReasearch.

3.  Hirsch K, et al. Effect of purified allicin, the major ingredient in freshly crushed garlic, on cancer cell proliferation. Nutr Cancer 2000;38:245-54.

4.  Powolny AA, Singh SV. Multitargeted prevention and therapy of cancer by diallyltrisulfide and related Allium vegetable-derived organosulfur compounds. Cancer Lett. Oct 8 2008;269(2):305-314.

5.  Song K, Milner JA. The influence of heating on the anticancer properties of garlic. J Nutrition2001;131:1054S-7S

6.  Le Marchand L, Murphy S, Hankin J, Wilkens L, Kolonel L. Intake of flavonoids and lung cancer. J Natl Cancer Inst 2000; 92:154–60

7.  Knekt P, Kumpulainen J, Jarvinen R, Rissanen H, Heliovaara M, Reunanen A, et al. Flavonoid intake and risk of chronic diseases. Am J Clin Nutr 2002;76:560– 8.

8.   "Phytotherapy Research"; Onions--a Global Benefit to Health; G. Griffiths, etal.; November 2002

9.  "Journal of the Science of Food and Agriculture"; Chemical Composition and Antioxidant and Antimicrobial Activities of Essential Oil of Allium Sphaerocephalon L. Subsp. Sphaerocephalon (Liliaceae) Inflorescences; J.Lazarevic, etal.; January 2011

10.  Galeone C, Pelucchi C, Levi F, et al. Onion and garlic use and human cancer. Am J Clin Nutr2006;84: 1027-32

11.  Rose P et al. Bioactive S-alk(en)yl cysteine sulfoxide metabolites in the genus Allium: the chemistry of potential therapeutic agents.Nat Prod Rep. 2005 Jun;22(3):351-68

12.  Sif Hansdottir et al. Vitamin D effects on lung immunity and respiratory diseases. Vitam Horm. 2011; 86: 217–237.

13.  Jaime García de Tena. The Role of Vitamin D in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease,Asthma and Other Respiratory Disease. Arch Bronconeumol. 2014;50(5):179–184

14.  María Elena Valverde et al. Edible Mushrooms: Improving Human Health and Promoting Quality Life. International Journal of Microbiology Volume 2015, Article ID 376387.

15.  Luo XJ, Peng J, Li YJ. Recent advances in the study on capsaicinoids and capsinoids. Eur J Pharmacol. 2011 Jan 10;650(1):1-7.

16.  Sharma SK, Vij AS, Sharma M. Mechanisms and clinical uses of capsaicin. Eur J Pharmacol. 2013 Nov 15;720(1-3):55-62

17.  Whiting S, Derbyshire E, Tiwari BK. Capsaicinoids and capsinoids. A potential role for weight management? A systematic review of the evidence. Appetite. 2012 Oct;59(2):341-8.

18.  Patrizia Riso, Cristian Del Bo’,Stefano Vendrame. Cancer - Oxidative Stress and Dietary Antioxidants. Chapter 11 – Preventive Effects of Broccoli Bioactives: Role on Oxidative Stress and Cancer Risk. 2014, Pages 115–126

19.  Q. J. Wu et al. Cruciferous vegetables consumption and the risk of female lung cancer: a prospective study and a meta-analysis. Annals of Oncology 24: 1918–1924, 2013

20.  Li Tang et al. Cruciferous vegetable intake is inversely associated with lung cancer risk among smokers: a case-control study. BMC Cancer 2010, 10:162

21.  Riedl MA, Saxon A, Diaz-Sanchez D. Oral sulforaphane increases Phase II antioxidant enzymes in the human upper airway. ClinImmunol. 2009;130(3):244-251.

22.  Xiao-Lan Cheng. Steamed ginger (Zingiber officinale): Changed chemical profile and increasedanticancer potential. Food Chemistry. Volume 129, Issue 4, 15 December 2011, Pages 1785–1792

23.  Shukla Y, Singh M. Cancer preventive properties of ginger: a brief review. Food Chem Toxicol. 2007 May;45(5):683-90

24.  Mangprayool T, Kupittayanant S, Chudapongse N. Participation of citral in the bronchodilatory effect of ginger oil and possible mechanism of action. Fitoterapia. 2013 Sep;89:68-73.

25.  Ahui ML et al. Ginger prevents Th2-mediated immune responses in a mouse model of airway inflammation. Int Immunopharmacol. 2008 Dec 10;8(12):1626-32.

26.  Chang JS et al. Fresh ginger (Zingiber officinale) has anti-viral activity against human respiratory syncytial virus in human respiratory tract cell lines. J Ethnopharmacol. 2013 Jan 9;145(1):146-51.

27.  McKeever TM, Scrivener S, Broadfield E, Jones Z, Britton J, Lewis SA. Prospective study of diet and decline in lung function in a general population. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 165:1299-1303, 2002.

28.  Francesco Forastiere et al. Consumption of fresh fruit rich in vitamin C andwheezing symptoms in children. Thorax. 2000 Apr; 55(4): 283–288.

29.  European Lung White Book. Part B, Chapter 5: Diet and Nutrition. European Respiratory Society.

30.  Theodora Psaltopoulou et al. Olive oil intake is inversely related to cancer prevalence: a systematic review and a meta-analysis of 13800 patients and 23340 controls in 19 observational studies. Lipids Health Dis. 2011; 10: 127.

31.  Wang Y et al. Fruit and vegetable consumption and risk of lung cancer: a dose-response meta-analysis of prospective cohort studies. Lung Cancer. 2015 May;88(2):124-30.

Further reading:

o  Ori Scott et al. The Safety of Cruciferous Plants in Humans: A Systematic Review. Journal of Biomedicine and Biotechnology, Volume 2012: 50324.

o  "Journal of the Science of Food and Agriculture"; Chemical Composition and Antioxidant and Antimicrobial Activities of Essential Oil of Allium Sphaerocephalon L. Subsp. Sphaerocephalon (Liliaceae) Inflorescences; J.Lazarevic, etal.; January 2011

o  Cancer prevention&early detection – Facts and Figures 2015-2016

o  Cathy Whiteley et al. Preschool Program Improves Young Children’s Food Literacy and Attitudes to Vegetables. Journal of Nutrition Education and Behavior 2015, May 16.

o  P. Horne, J. Greenhalgh, M. Erjavec, F. Lowe, S. Viktor, C. Whitaker Increasing pre-school children’s consumption of fruit and vegetables: a modelling and rewards intervention. Appetite, 56 (2011), pp. 375–385
story_txt:
This project is meant to increase population health by reminding people how important it is to consume more fruits and vegetables every day.     Who am I?               My name is Gabriela Beszkai and I am a final year medical student. I spend all of my little free time photographing and reading.                                          Why am I doing this?            Being a passionate medical student but also a passionate photographer, I’ve been searching for a project that would allow me to link these two, to create something beautiful but inspiring and life changing, too. So I thought about the great opportunity of health promotion through my photography. I want to enable people to increase control over their health and to improve it, by making them aware of all the benefits an increased consumption of fruit and vegetable can bring.       Insufficient fruit&vegetables consumption and obesity are among the major causes of cardiovascular diseases, respiratory diseases, diabetes and cancers.     What am I doing...              I made a research on the beneficial effects that some foods have on different organs, that might help prevent diseases and thus improve overall health. I studied the eyes, the brain, lungs, heart, liver, pancreas, digestive tract, kidneys and bones and found that specific foods have important effects on these organs, helping us to prevent diseases and keeping them healthy. I gathered all this information and used those specific vegetables, fruits, spices, nutseeds or herbs to recreate human organs and their functional elements.                  Let's take for example, this picture of the lungs recreated out of vegetables. Studies say that including onions, chilli/ CH-19 peppers, cruciferous (especially broccoli, cabbage and cauliflower), ginger, olives, red bell pepper, garlic, duck leaves, spinach and mushrooms in our diet could improve our lung function and prevent infections, asthma and most important, cancer. Lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer-related death worldwide in men and the second-commonest cause in women.           Moreover, the reconstruction respects the anatomical features, describing structural and functional elements of the organs, just like you can see in these pictures:
 
 

                                                                 The Kidneys
 

                 The Nephron: the urine-producing functional structures of the kidney
 
 
 At least 2.8 million people die each year as a result of overweight or obesity.
             Globally, 42 million children under the age of 5 were overweight or obese in 2013. They are likely to become obese adults and to develop diabetes and cardiovascular diseases at a younger age, which in turn are associated with a higher chance of premature death and disability. More than 1.9 billion adults are overweight and more than half a billion are obese, and the numbers are rapidly increasing. This is why preventing obesity from an early age has become a major public health priority in the developed world. 
   Low fat intake and an increased consumption of fruit and vegetables is strongly associated with wight loss and weight maintenance. 
                A well balanced diet, together with regular physical activity, is one of the most significant factors that determine your health. Fruit and vegetables are important components of a healthy diet, and their sufficient daily consumption could help prevent major diseases such as: obesity, diabetes, heart disease, stroke, cancer.                        As part of a healthy diet low in fat, sugars and sodium, WHO suggests consuming more than 400 grams of fruits and vegetables per day to improve overall health and reduce the risk of certain diseases. 

 
 
How can you help?
 
           After months of reasearch, I spent a whole week just to make a plan for recreating the human lungs. Then I started to set up studio lights, buy the materials I needed, the fruits and vegetables, washed, sliced and arranged, piece by piece, everything I've used in those photographs.
 

 
 
          But all this turned out to be pretty expensive and I rapidly ran out of budget. This is the reason why I'm here on Indiegogo. I need your financial support in order to recreate the other 7 systems,  with all their specific healthy foods and provide further information. Help me to raise awareness about all the benefits of an increased fruit and vegetable consumption through my photography! 
 

          Familiarity strongly influences young children’s food preferences, so early childhood is a crucial time for interventions. Their habits will set the foundation for their lifestyle and risk of disease as adults. Encourage your children and grandchildren to learn anatomy in an interactive way, looking at photographs that catch their eye and make them link our organism with fresh, healthy foods. 
 
          Be a promoter of a healthier lifestyle and make your friends and loved ones aware of all the benefits an increased fruit and vegetable intake can bring!
 

Up to 1.7 million lives could potentially be saved each year if fruit and vegetable consumption were sufficiently increased. (www.who.int)


 
Bibliography:
