story:
Para la version ESPAÑOLA haz click aqui

THE GREY CITY

My name is Oliver Stahmann. I am a German writer and artist. I have been living in Lima, the capital of Peru, for the last 10 years of my life. It was never a plan of mine to stay so long. It just happened. Just one of the strange turns that life takes. Lima has never featured on the list of cities that I wanted to visit. But for now, it has become my new home. 

Over the years I have explored and discovered the town with my camera. I went to many of the neighborhoods that even the locals recommend that you avoid. Everywhere I tried to find beauty. Lima is mainly a contrast between modernity and decay. Old and new. Rich and poor. Black-and-white and colors. But no matter what life situation you find the Limanians in, they do everything with pride and hope.  

For someone living far away from Peru, this must sound odd: Lima, a grey town? Why this strange title for your book? The average person living in Europe or the United States probably believes that Lima is perpetually full of sunshine and blue skies. But the reality is not even close to this. Most of the time, even during the summer, Lima is foggy and cloudy because of the nearby Humboldt ocean current. 

Day after day I wake up, look out of the window and hope for a blue sky, but it isn't there. Only in summer does it clear up on some days. During my first years in Lima, I was frustrated. I missed the deep Mediterranean colors so much, and almost decided to ‘shelve’ photography. Until I once again fell in love with black and white photography, which I figured out was the ideal medium to capture the atmosphere of this town. It gives the images a timeless look, regardless of the weather.  

In photography, I always admired the great masters like Henri Cartier-Bresson, Elliott Erwitt, and Robert Frank. But it was American photographer Jeff Dunas who first sparked my interest in photography, with his black and white landscapes and portraits. He inspired me to buy my first camera back in 2003. What started as a hobby became a passion. 

I have already had several exhibitions of my images, in Peru as well as abroad. But I have always thought that the best way to present my work was in the form of a book. So I am happy to announce this project here, and hope you will be able to support me in whatever way possible for you.

I have always loved photography books. I spent a fortune on them myself. It was always my dream to one day be able to produce my own. I am very proud to be on my way to completing this mission.

The book will be a classic photo book. If you compare photography with music, let’s just say that I am looking for an old traditional pop-rock-style, while many other photo artists prefer a more modern trap, hip-hop or electronic-music approach. Pop and rock have survived and always sound fresh, even almost 50 years after the Beatles broke up. Other styles come and go. I pursue the classic form.   

One of the reasons why I am choosing this method to raise funds for the production of the book is because I want to stay independent and allow the book to be offered at a reasonable price of 35.00€ or USD 40.00. The money raised will cover the printing, design and many other costs. The more people make donations, the more beautiful we will be able to make the book. The book will include text in English, Spanish and German. 

The book will comprise more than a hundred images of urban Lima. Photos that show faces and fates, mothers and children, cats and dogs and many beautiful moments kept as a photo for eternity. 

I couldn't complete this project on my own - that's why I need your support and I think it's amazing that you are even considering it! 

Apart from the pre-sale of the book, I can also offer you some fantastic and exclusive perks, all of which I have designed myself. There is a foldable bag, that you can carry with you everywhere you go, for example traveling or shopping. And a really beautiful scarf. You can also buy several prints of my images for bargain prices.  

 

SHARE IT WITH YOUR FRIENDS & FAMILY

Perhaps you are not really ‘into’ photography. But surely you have a good friend who is. Tell him or her about it. Get the word out! And think about buying a bag or a scarf for your friends. They will love it. 

 

--------------------------------------

VERSION ESPAÑOLA

Me llamo Oliver Stahmann. Soy un escritor y  artista alemán, vivo en Lima la capital del Perú desde hace 10 años. Nunca estuvo en mis planes quedarme por tanto tiempo pero solo sucedió, por esos extraños giros que da la vida.
 Lima nunca estuvo en la lista de ciudades que quería visitar. Pero se ha convertido en mi nuevo hogar.


Con los años he explorado y descubierto la ciudad con mi cámara. Fui a muchos de los barrios que incluso los lugareños recomiendan que evites. En todas partes intenté resaltar la belleza. Lima es principalmente un contraste entre modernidad y decadencia. Viejo y nuevo. Rico y pobre. Blanco y negro y colores. Pero no importa en qué situación de la vida se encuentren los limeños, lo hacen todo con orgullo y esperanza.

Para alguien que vive lejos de Perú, esto debe sonar extraño: ¿Lima, un pueblo gris? ¿Por qué este extraño título para tu libro? La persona promedio que vive en Europa o Estados Unidos probablemente cree que Lima está perpetuamente llena de sol y cielos azules. Pero la realidad ni siquiera está cerca de esto. La mayoría de las veces, incluso durante el verano,el cielo de Lima está nublado y muchas veces obscuro, debido a la corriente oceánica cercana de Humboldt.
Día tras día me levanto, miro por la ventana y espero un cielo azul, pero no está allí. Solo en verano se aclara algunos días. Durante mis primeros años en Lima, me sentí frustrado.

Extrañaba mucho los profundos colores mediterráneos, y casi decidí "dejar de lado" la fotografía. Hasta que una vez más me enamoré de la fotografía en blanco y negro, que pensé que era el medio ideal para capturar la atmósfera de esta ciudad. Da a las imágenes un aspecto atemporal, independientemente del clima.

En fotografía, siempre admiré a los grandes maestros como Henri Cartier-Bresson, Elliott Erwitt y Robert Frank. Pero fue el fotógrafo estadounidense Jeff Dunas quien despertó mi interés por la fotografía, con sus paisajes y retratos en blanco y negro. Me inspiró a comprar mi primera cámara en 2003. Lo que comenzó como un hobby se convirtió en una pasión.

Ya he realizado varias exposiciones de mis imágenes, tanto en Perú como en el extranjero. Pero siempre he pensado que la mejor manera de presentar mi trabajo era en forma de libro. Así que me complace anunciar este lanzamiento aquí, les invito a formar parte de este ambicioso proyecto y puedan apoyar con una pequeña contribución, que será realmente un gran apoyo al arte de la fotografía callejera. 

Siempre me han encantado los libros de fotografía. Gasté una fortuna en ellos yo mismo. Siempre fue mi sueño poder algún día producir el mío. Estoy muy orgulloso de estar en camino de completar esta misión.
El libro será un clásico libro de fotos. Si comparan la fotografía con la música, digamos que estoy buscando un viejo estilo tradicional de pop-rock, mientras que muchos otros fotógrafos prefieren un enfoque más moderno de trampa, hip-hop o música electrónica. El pop y el rock han sobrevivido y siempre suenan frescos, incluso casi 50 años después de que los Beatles se separaron. Otros estilos van y vienen. Persigo la forma clásica.

Una de las razones por las que elijo este método para recaudar fondos para la producción del libro es porque quiero mantenerme independiente y permitir que el libro se ofrezca a un precio razonable de 35.00 € o USD 40.00. El dinero recaudado cubrirá la impresión, el diseño y muchos otros costos. Mientras más personas hagan donaciones, más hermoso podremos hacer el libro. El libro incluirá texto en inglés, español y alemán.

El libro comprenderá más de cien imágenes de Lima urbana. Fotos que muestran rostros y destinos, madres e hijos, gatos y perros y muchos hermosos momentos guardados como una foto para la eternidad.

No pude completar este proyecto por mi cuenta, es por eso que necesito tu apoyo y creo que es increíble que incluso lo estés considerando.
Además de la preventa del libro, también puedo ofrecerte algunos artículos fantásticos y exclusivos, de moda y diseño los cuales yo mismo he creado. Hay una bolsa plegable que puedes llevar a todas partes, por ejemplo, de viaje o de compras. Y una bufanda, pañuelo o pareo realmente hermoso. También puedes comprar varias impresiones de mis imágenes a precios de super oferta o ganga. 

COMPARTE CON TUS AMIGOS Y FAMILIA

Quizás no estás realmente "interesado" en la fotografía. Pero seguramente tienes un buen amigo que si. Cuéntale al respecto. ¡Corre la voz! Tal vez  pienses en comprar una bolsa o una bufanda también, de seguro te encantará. 


Mil gracias por tu contribución a este proyecto, saludos a todos…
story_txt: Para la version ESPAÑOLA haz click aquiTHE GREY CITYMy name is Oliver Stahmann. I am a German writer and artist. I have been living in Lima, the capital of Peru, for the last 10 years of my life. It was never a plan of mine to stay so long. It just happened. Just one of the strange turns that life takes. Lima has never featured on the list of cities that I wanted to visit. But for now, it has become my new home. Over the years I have explored and discovered the town with my camera. I went to many of the neighborhoods that even the locals recommend that you avoid. Everywhere I tried to find beauty. Lima is mainly a contrast between modernity and decay. Old and new. Rich and poor. Black-and-white and colors. But no matter what life situation you find the Limanians in, they do everything with pride and hope.  For someone living far away from Peru, this must sound odd: Lima, a grey town? Why this strange title for your book? The average person living in Europe or the United States probably believes that Lima is perpetually full of sunshine and blue skies. But the reality is not even close to this. Most of the time, even during the summer, Lima is foggy and cloudy because of the nearby Humboldt ocean current. Day after day I wake up, look out of the window and hope for a blue sky, but it isn't there. Only in summer does it clear up on some days. During my first years in Lima, I was frustrated. I missed the deep Mediterranean colors so much, and almost decided to ‘shelve’ photography. Until I once again fell in love with black and white photography, which I figured out was the ideal medium to capture the atmosphere of this town. It gives the images a timeless look, regardless of the weather.  In photography, I always admired the great masters like Henri Cartier-Bresson, Elliott Erwitt, and Robert Frank. But it was American photographer Jeff Dunas who first sparked my interest in photography, with his black and white landscapes and portraits. He inspired me to buy my first camera back in 2003. What started as a hobby became a passion. I have already had several exhibitions of my images, in Peru as well as abroad. But I have always thought that the best way to present my work was in the form of a book. So I am happy to announce this project here, and hope you will be able to support me in whatever way possible for you.I have always loved photography books. I spent a fortune on them myself. The book will include text in English, Spanish and German. The book will comprise more than a hundred images of urban Lima. Photos that show faces and fates, mothers and children, cats and dogs and many beautiful moments kept as a photo for eternity. I couldn't complete this project on my own - that's why I need your support and I think it's amazing that you are even considering it! Apart from the pre-sale of the book, I can also offer you some fantastic and exclusive perks, all of which I have designed myself. There is a foldable bag, that you can carry with you everywhere you go, for example traveling or shopping. And a really beautiful scarf. You can also buy several prints of my images for bargain prices.   SHARE IT WITH YOUR FRIENDS & FAMILYPerhaps you are not really ‘into’ photography. But surely you have a good friend who is. Tell him or her about it. Get the word out! And think about buying a bag or a scarf for your friends. They will love it.  --------------------------------------VERSION ESPAÑOLAMe llamo Oliver Stahmann. Soy un escritor y  artista alemán, vivo en Lima la capital del Perú desde hace 10 años. story:
A quick backstory and the idea

Last July I have travelled to a small town called Avdiivka located on the frontline of the frozen conflict in eastern Ukraine. I have captured multiple angles and stories which I have put together into an article and gallery called 'The forgotten war' available to see on my website.

This time I want to concentrate on one particular story over the course of a couple of weeks rather than jump from a place to place. The story is about a volunteer group of people running a frontline ambulance and hi-tech medical support for their local fighters.

I have already managed to establish good relations with the said group and therefore the only constraints I have at the moment are strictly budgetary. All I need to photograph this story is enough funds to travel to eastern Ukraine and back plus some budget to stay afloat once I'm on location. No equipment will be bought from the goal as I already have all my protective gear, camera equipment and survival necessities (maybe with the exception of a warmer jacket as Ukraine in January can be a little less forgiving than London).

Publishing

The final story will be published on my website to accompany my previous story. Depending on the campaign perks the backers can receive a printed version of the photographs either in a form of a classic photographic zine or a carefully designed book. There is also an option of high-quality museum grade print signed by me and shipped worldwide plus an option to accompany that print with an equal print of one of my street photographs of your choosing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help by backing the project you can at least help by sharing it among your friends and acquaintances.

Thank you for making it all the way down here.

Ondrej

story:
The limited edition photography series are available as single prints and as entire limited serie's: 

The earth gallery is available as single prints in medium, medium-large and large print sizes (see the gallery above and the perks with images below)

A little about me

My name is Kia (28) a Dutch/Portugese artist & photographer.

I have always been observing, looking for beauty, in search of connection everywhere around me. And photography has been a tool for me to express myself: these dreams, the observations, the found and often missing beauty of the world and the most wonderful stories told by the seemingly insignificant moments, creatures, objects and forms of life.

A little about my work

I have been 8 years on this adventure of capturing life through photography. Recently I have been accepted at the prestigious Academy of Photography in Amsterdam, a beautiful opportunity to expand and grow within my photography. However, I will be needing funds to pay for the expenses of this incredible study. So I am making some of my exclusive photography work available as prints and series and invite you to support this journey and become part of it! 

Why is this important for me? 

I want to continue growing on my photography journey and develop myself further aesthetically and more professionally. I want to study at The Academy of Photography which is right now -in my opinion- the best place to develop my true potential as a photographer and artist. Their extremely supportive environment, personal mentorship and coaching and the post-study support are the essentials I need for this development.

And why would you be part of this?

Because you will receive wonderful and unique photography prints, exclusive limited series and other special photography work of mine!! :)

And join in this adventure to share, inspire, encourage and empower the world with the known and unknown beauty of photography! 

Secretively I existed beyond I listened behind I saw in between I was somewhere secretively within.
 

What do I need?

My first goal in this campaign is to cover my study fees to start my first year, which is $ 9264. 

I will work alongside my study to cover all other campaign and study expenses.

If I reach this initial goal, my next goal will be my entire study! The total fees costs of this 3 year study are $ 23,977.

All the expenses that are involved:

  • $ 23,977 to cover the fees for the entire 3 years
  • $ 4,000 to cover some obliged materials & equipment
  • $ 2,397 to cover the Indiegogo and payment fees for this campaign
  • $ 1,982 to pay for the rewards and gifts for this campaign

What do you get?

First of all, you will receive my immense gratitude for your support!

And I will be extremely happy and excited to share my work with you through unique and limited photography prints! 

You will find the wonderful perks below, choose yours! :)

  • $ 5 - a digital postcard of one of my photography works
  • $ 10 -  a signed postcard of one of my photography works
  • $ 25 -  2 x A6 postcard prints + a downloadable print from the earth gallery.
  • $ 40 - one exclusive and limited serie of choice in small (A6) prints (3 signed prints in total) choose between: elephant, creatures of sea, luminous trees, life or a child's view.

  • $ 65 - a medium (A4) print from the structures & textures section of the earth gallery.

  

 
earth gallery - structures & textures

  • $ 72 - a portrait shoot (in the Netherlands) including 2 edited digital photo's + 1 A4 portrait print of choice.
  • $ 80 - one exclusive and limited serie of choice in small (A5) prints (3 signed prints in total); Or one A4 print of choice! choose between: elephant, creatures of sea, luminous trees, life or a child's view

' a child's view' serie

  • $ 100 - a medium-large (A3) print of choice from the entire earth gallery.

 

 
earth gallery - wings & feet

  • $ 150 - a medium-large (A3) limited print of choice from one of the series.

 
'elephant' serie

  • $ 168 - a photo shoot of choice (in the Netherlands) including 30 edited digital photo's of choice.
  • $ 195 - a large (A2) print from the entire earth gallery.

  • $ 225 - one exclusive and limited serie of choice in medium (A4) prints + 3 postcards. Choose: elephant (3 prints + 3 postcards), creatures of sea (3 prints + 3 postcards), luminous trees (4 prints), life (3 prints + 3 postcards) or a child's view (3 prints + 3 postcards) + updates during 3 years! 

  

'creatures of sea' serie

  

   '
luminous trees' serie

  
'life' serie

  • $ 500 - one large (A2) signed print or one medium-large (A3) aluminium print of choice from the entire gallery/series + future updates + one 'special' work of photography during the coming year!.
  

  
earth gallery - clouds & skies

  • $ 1000 - a special thank you + one large (A2) or 2 medium-large (A3) aluminium print(s) of choice from the entire gallery/series + future updates + postcard prints of major works + one 'special' work of photography during the coming year!
  • $ 5000 - a face to face thank you + a true and unique experience: a 3 day accommodation stay in the mountains of Portugal with a photography workshop + photography session + a personal portrait print (or a gallery print) of choice. Or you may choose 4 photography works + little gifts and updates for the coming 3 years + a special personal message! 

 

  

earth gallery - villages & wilderness 

Risks and challenges:

I am extremely commited to this campaign so, even if I don't reach my entire goal I will make it happen and fullfill your rewards! :) If I don't reach this initial goal I will continue to walk this journey to grow as a photographer and share my work. 

With an amount of $ 9264 I can pay for the fees to start my first year of study! Thank you! :)

With a total of $ 34,400 it will be possible to do the entire study!! (as mentioned above in the 'what do I need' section). If I do not reach this second goal during this campaign I will start a follow-up campaign next year or fundings by other means.

earth gallery - wilderness II

My work has a tingle of out-of-the-ordinary, of mystery, and at the same time it is real, its the raw and real life. 
The strangers that walk this earth, humanity, our human experience fascinate me. Nature is my inspiration, my art, it carries me. Truth, justice, beauty, captured through me. 

I want to thank everybody who joins, shares the project and supports this journey of beauty!
earth gallery - wilderness III

  'creatures of sea' serie
  



   '


luminous trees' serie




  'life' serie




$ 500 - one large (A2) signed print or one medium-large (A3) aluminium print of choice from the entire gallery/series + future updates + one 'special' work of photography during the coming year!.


  


  earth gallery - clouds & skies






$ 1000 - a special thank you + one large (A2) or 2 medium-large (A3) aluminium print(s) of choice from the entire gallery/series + future updates + postcard prints of major works + one 'special' work of photography during the coming year!

$ 5000 - a face to face thank you + a true and unique experience: a 3 day accommodation stay in the mountains of Portugal with a photography workshop + photography session + a personal portrait print (or a gallery print) of choice. Or you may choose 4 photography works + little gifts and updates for the coming 3 years + a special personal message! 




 
  
earth gallery - villages & wilderness 




Risks and challenges:


I am extremely commited to this campaign so, even if I don't reach my entire goal I will make it happen and fullfill your rewards! :) If I don't reach this initial goal I will continue to walk this journey to grow as a photographer and share my work. 
With an amount of $ 9264 I can pay for the fees to start my first year of study! Thank you! :)
With a total of $ 34,400 it will be possible to do the entire study!! (as mentioned above in the 'what do I need' section). If I do not reach this second goal during this campaign I will start a follow-up campaign next year or fundings by other means.





earth gallery - wilderness II




My work has a tingle of out-of-the-ordinary, of mystery, and at the same time it is real, its the raw and real life. 


The strangers that walk this earth, humanity, our human experience fascinate me. Nature is my inspiration, my art, it carries me. Truth, justice, beauty, captured through me. 


I want to thank everybody who joins, shares the project and supports this journey of beauty!



earth gallery - wilderness III

story:
My name is Stephane Domingues. I am a 31 years old photographer based in Paris, France."Being 30 years old in the world" is a project that aims at decoding what it means to be a 30-year-old in different countries around the world, trying to understand similarities and differences of one single generation across the globe. Over the last 15 months, I have met, photographed and interviewed more than 60 people on the 5 continents to share a slice of their lives.

The goal of this Kickstarter campaign is to fund the creation of a beautiful hardcover book to share these amazing stories with you. The book will feature 30 portraits from 30 countries and YOU, kickstarter backers will choose the portraits that will be featured on the book.

These stories have been documented on my blog: www.being30yo.com

Portrait of 10 people among the 65 I interviewed throughout the world.


This project was born while I started to plan my 15-month trip around the world. I really wanted to give a purpose to my trip, on a cultural and social ground.

Getting to the 30’s is quite an important event in our life…So I decided to go out there and find out what are the differences and similarities in the 30 year old generation throughout the world.

Is it the same to be a 30YO in France, Tanzania, Vietnam, Argentina or New Zealand? How donationality, culture, living environment... define our own identity?


How does our everyday life look like? What are our values? What is important for us? How do we analyze our past? Our present? And our future? How do we see our country? And theworld we are living in?

So far, this amazing journey took me to 25 countries, located on the 5 continents, and enabled me to meet and share the life of more than 60 people aged between 29 and 35. They live in big cities or in small remote villages. All from different background and culture… with their own stories and their own vision.

Over the next few months, I plan to go meet and interview more people from 5 other countries in Europe and North Africa.

Over these last 15 months, I have documented these amazing stories on my blog.


The book will feature portraits from 30 countries in 5 continents.


To be able to compare lifestyles and visions, every single person was asked the same interview which included questions about past, present and future. But the main point was to share authentic moments of their daily life and catch these with my camera.

This experience enabled me to see very contrasted lifestyles such as this one:

Example of Portraits: Diana (Australia) on the left and Bori (Ethiopia) on the right. Portraits include same type of pictures : Portraits, Home, Eating, Working, Life, Transport, Important Objects, Favorite Spot.


They talk about "Being 30 years old in the world"

During my trip many websites from all over the world wrote articles about my projects in many different languages : English, French, Indian, Chinese, Finish, Bulgarian, Spanish, Slovak, Portuguese...



The book will be a beautiful coffee table art book featuring 30 inspiring illustrated stories of real men and women from 30 countries across the globe.

Book Specs :

  • Type: Hardcover book
  • Size: Approx 9 x 12 inches (22,9 x 30,5cm)
  • Number of pages: Approx 220 (30 portraits x 6 pages + Extras)
  • Publication Date: May 2016


Indiegogo Backers : this Book is YOUR BOOK

Every Indiegogo backer will have one vote to choose who will be featured in the book.

By the end of the project there will be about 80 people from 30 countries on my blog and you will be asked to vote for the person you want to see in the book. For each country, the person with more votes will be selected to be featured in the book!


All backers can vote for their favorite portrait in each country. The most voted for each country will be featured in the book.

Book Sketch :

The book will feauture 30 portraits from 30 different countries.

Each portrait will presented on 6 pages and include Portrait photographs, ID (Tastes, Schedule, Infographics about their country, etc), the Interview and Photographs from their daily life.

http://www.being30yo.com/thebook/

Page 1 & 2 : Portraits & ID

Pages 3 to 6: Interview and Photographs


The LIMITED EDITION of the BOOK will include a unique Polaroid (Only 80 available, one for each person I interviewed):

 

Where will be the money going?

This amount is based on the printing of 700 books.

In case the target is not reached, less books will be printed.


All the prints will be beautiful square Art Prints 11.8 x 11.8 inches (30 x 30cm).

You can choose any photograph from my Instagram account (@being30yo) or my blog(www.being30yo.com).

Photographs of more than 20 countries covering different topics will be available:


Street Life:

Nature:

Left : Great Barrier Reef (Australia) Right : Wildbeests in the Savanna (Tanzania)

Portrait:

City:

Left : Sunrise over Los Angeles (USA) Right : Sunset over Sao Paulo (Brazil)

Landscape:

 Left : Volcano in the Tongariro NP (New Zealand) Right : Desert of the Valle de la luna (Chile)



Country Polaroids

3 Pictures from One Country to choose from my Instagram account (@being30yo) or my blog (www.being30yo.com).

Japan:


Ethiopia:


Tryptic of Ethiopia (Stand not included)


Photographs include the following countries:

North America: USA

Africa: Ethiopia, Tanzania, Malawi, Mozambique, South Africa, Morroco

South America: Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Bolivia, Peru

Oceania: Australia, New Zealand

Asia: Japan, Korea, Thailand, Myanmar, Vietnam, China, Kyrgyzstan, Kazakhstan

Europe: France, UK, Spain, Portugal, Russia, Germany, Sweden

story:
Hello!..

My name is Irina Popova. I have Russian background. I've been doing documentary photography for more than 10 years. 

I discovered that there are more than 8000 people with the same name as mine registered on social networks. 
I decided to create a project about them, collecting and using the photos they upload into the public domain.

I downloaded more than 36000 photos, working with 3 assistants for 3 months. 

I made an exhibition as a part of group show "Russian Atelier on Amstel" in Hermitage museum, Amsterdam, where I showed more than 1000 images on the walls. 

It took me two years to edit down this material and give a shape of a book. 

More about the project:

I went digging into the photo albums of Irinas Popovas published online and the repulsion changed into curiosity, the curiosity into a genuine interest, more artistic than scientific.

I was looking at how society functions by imposing the same stereotypical norms of behavior, good life, self-representation and even dreams upon us.

Private and family albums go public without their authors realizing that anyone is allowed to use them, for any purpose.

There is a button that allows anyone to share and download an image. In doing so the image loses any credits or source information, becoming an anonymous piece of collective memory, just one more drop in the sea of Internet content.

And because I had moved from Russia I browsed these profiles, and it seemed to me the perfect way to research the Russian lifestyle and to make a project about Russian people, and eventually about myself.

I was interested in the typical and the unique and used this as a selection principle. I was searching for something typically Russian in the background, or in the small elements; in the colours and the patterns; and a rather peculiar idea of beauty and proper life. At the same time I was focusing on finding unique representations of one’s personality, or in some places weird pictures for which I fail to find explanation.

While looking at these images I noticed that every Irina Popova is striving to become a princess, with a different degrees of success.

They are born into a simple environment, and from an early childhood they get dressed as a princess or as a doll. They all experience the same pressure of expectation to become a successful girl, to find a prince, to get married, and to have beautiful kids. It seems very difficult to escape this pattern, but it also seems that the girls are more than willing to follow these imposed beauty standards.

I organized these materials in the imaginary story-line of one fake princess, from birth to old age. The big question is: “what happens to a princess after marriage?” Do they disappear, while those shapeless, self-content, ageless ladies in  leopard print dresses appear by themselves, like aliens or asteroids?


Details of the Book:

- Edition 1000, numbered and signed for the participants of the preorder campaign.
- Introduction word by Erik Kessels (http://www.kesselskramerpublishing.com/)
- Full colour 256 pages
- More than 200 images

- Size 17.5 x 22 cm, vertical

- Fine non-coated paper

- Hardcover with textile. 

- additional 50 copies of special edition, - each book is dressed like a princess, with unique handmade elements.

What We Need 

The book is ready for print. 
We plan to publish 1 000 copies, out of which 100 will be special edition with hand-made elements.

For the production of this edition we need 12 000 euro, out of which:

- 2 000 graphic design and image postproduction

- 8 000 printing and shipping costs

- 2 000 promotion costs

We invested 4000 of own funds, and 8 000 are needed from the public. 

What You Get

- By investing into the book you'll get your copy much cheaper than in the shop afterwards. 

- You'll get a signed and numbered copy of the book, where your number will be one of the first and therefore more valued. 

- You have a chance to get a special edition copy, skype talk or portfolio review with the author.

- Your order includes free shipping worldwide.

- All Irina Popovas get a discount on the preorder of the book.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

If Not...

If there is not enough money to print the whole edition of the book, the crowdfunding will be cancelled and the money returned to you... 

So please, consider sharing with the friends and pushing this goal.

If You Want to Help in Other Way...

  • ...share this link!

THANKS!!!!

www.incompleteprincessbook.com
www.irinapopova.net

story:
What we are all about!

High Flyers Aerial Photography aims to be the #1 source for aerial photography in the Charlotte, NC and surround areas. With plans to expand as the business grows. 

Our Goals:

  • Provide Stable and beautiful videography and photography of your event, festival, party, or anything in between
  • Our experienced quad flyers will provide beautifully framed 4K footage of your event.  
  • The ability to provide at over 2 hours of footage per shoot

What Equipment do we use?

Our Equipment is a State of the Art DJI Inspire 1:

  • The base structure is a carbon fiber quadcopter with full gyro stabilization meaning you get the most incredible stable shots available
  • Our Quad offers up a full gimbaled 4K camera with a Sony image sensor  This means your shots will be a stunning 4K@25fps or 30fps completely stabilized 
  • Our quads' retractable landing gear provides you with full unobstructed views of the entire environment around the event.  No props or rotors in these shots
  • Our multiple batteries will allow us to film 2 full hours of footage

What we need from you

As you may know starting a business is a challenging and exciting process.  What you may also know is that starting a business can be very expensive.  This is where you come in.  With your help we can purchase our quad equipment and get to the skies providing our clients with incredible video and photos from the sky.

Breakdown of exactly where your money goes:

  • DJI Inspire 1 Quad Copter with two controllers - $3400
  • 4 x Inspire 1 Batteries for Extended Flight - $800

Risks & Regulations

Many of you may have questions regarding flying these drones in public space or what all is involved with using equipment like this.  Below are some resources that elaborate more deeply on these concerns and how we will be moving forward with extreme oversight and awareness for these rules.
  • The FAA has recently been discussing new regulations for quadcopters and drones.  Details can be found here however we will be following these closely in the coming months. https://www.faa.gov/uas/
  • Our quad pilots have been logging their hours away training and preparing for upcoming regulations and rules.  Our company intends to completely comply with all rules surround unmanned aerial vehicles in the future

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Think this project is cool? Share it with you friends and family.
  • Indigogo has simple easy to use tools for sharing take a moment to share with someone you think might like our ideas!

story:
This is a NON PROFIT project!


I am going to do my first year of photography course! I am picking this course as not many courses suit me so picking this one lets my imagination spark, Ive always loved taking pictures of beautiful Sky lines or beautiful calm seas, but having a phone that has the worst camera ever means the pictures are not good!

I need help to buy a camera as colleges do not buy them for you and I don't have enough money to buy one as my parents don't earn enough money and I've only started college! I also need to pay money towards my essentials such as note books and picture books to keep my work together! So for anyone who is willing to help me I can honestly say a huge massive thank you from me and my parents!


I also want to say that I will be having my own website with my own posted photos which people can go and buy and hav it in their house!

story:
Why is it that BORDERS and NATIONALITY, and not FREEDOM, shape the IDENTITY of most of the people on this planet? Today’s national borders have been in constant flux through history and come from a desire to take other people's land and through blood and tears. Everyone is born somewhere. It's not something you deserved, made or gained. How is it then that the pure coincidence of being born in one country leads all too often to a situation where you're ready to kill someone just because that person doesn't belong to your tribe, nation, country or religion.



I was born in BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA and as a 9 year old girl I was forced to leave it as a REFUGEE. My childhood somehow protected me from fully understanding what the horrors of war are. War was for me then the game of adults, a game no one could explain to me in a way I could understand. I was taught to live in the present, to look forward to the future, and to let the past stay in the past. I generally feel free from some borders that people, wars, and history have shaped. Rootless would be the closest picture of my concept of national identity and if any place defines me as a person it would be planet Earth, not any particular country. In the meantime, I moved to Berlin and it happens so often that in mixed international groups people ask you: Where are you from? Sometimes you need to move away to see the whole picture, to see that we are never free from our past and countries we come from. I found out that part of me is still that 9 year old Bosnian refugee girl, a girl that now wants to tell her story.

The WAR in Bosnia and Herzegovina, that heart-shaped country in the middle of Europe, finished 20 years ago. And it’s not just marks of the war that you can see everywhere, like holes in the walls, it’s about the war that is still happening in the heads of the people. Towns are still divided and people are divided with their national identities. The hate and the un-forgiveness are still very much alive and are disabling the country to develop and people to live a normal life again. 


I want that to CHANGE. My only weapon is my CAMERA. I came back to Bosnia and Herzegovina as a photographer, traveled through it from my hometown Bugojno to capital Sarajevo, from divided town Mostar to a place of the biggest massacre in that war - Srebrenica. I was shooting THE LIVING and THE DEAD Bosnia and Herzegovina, making portraits of PEOPLE in streets and on markets, and visiting CEMETERIES. And exactly there, on Muslim, Catholic, Orthodox, Jewish, and Partisan cemeteries I felt that I finally came home and found pieces of my country. Those places don’t call for new hate, revenge or more killing. Death makes everything even. If we can be the same in front of death, why can’t we be brothers and sisters while we’re still alive?

Now, the time has come to show it to the world. I’ve decided to travel with this photo project from my newly adopted town of BERLIN, all the way through the BALKAN region and end up in ISTANBUL. The history of Berlin and Istanbul are marked by conflicts and divisions, but also by the demolition of walls and fostering of acceptance. Countries of the former Yugoslavia are still on their way to unfolding those nodes in themselves. This project will last from the end of April to the beginning of August 2015. The exhibition will try to start a dialog about identities, traces of both personal and global HISTORY, MEMORY and OBLIVION, FORGIVENESS and the lack of it. On my way I will also try to document other people's stories on these themes and show them afterwards.



I have already found spaces to show my work in Berlin (Café & gallery Pappelreiche), Frankfurt Oder (as a part of the festival Art and der Grenze), Prague (Café & gallery Lajka), Rijeka (Erste club Gallery), Split (No name Gallery), Koprivnica (AK Gallery), Tuzla (Peace Flame House Tuzla), Novi Sad (Café & gallery Frida), Skopje (Kooperacija, Mobile / Montage Gallery), Sofia (The Fridge)  and Istanbul (looking for the space). 

This is where you, my lovely audience, come in. I have prepared some nice GIFTS for you – postcards, original prints and shoots. If you donate just 5 euro, this enables me to buy a new roll of film for my analog cameras and every new film brings 24 or 36 new possibilities. So this money makes a real DIFFERENCE and I am utterly GRATEFUL for every piece of SUPPORT. The money collected in this campaign will be used to cover travel costs, accommodation, printing of photos and new films.

I believe that ART can have the POWER to make a CHANGE in the world and I’m ready to do it. Become a part of my project, help me break some borders in people's heads and spread a little more COMPASSION and TOLERANCE. 


The BUDGET of the campaign is as follows:

Travel costs for bus/train/carpooling – 1300 Euro

Costs of accommodation (where it is not possible to use someone’s hospitality)– 600 Euro

Costs of food and refreshments (not to be a starving artist :)) - 400 Euro

Costs of residency in Istanbul – 500 Euro

Prints and promotional materials for the project – 300 Euro

Film rolls and other equipment – 200 Euro

Costs of perks (printing and postal costs) – it's up to you, but let's say 200 Euro

Total costs would therefore sum up to around 3.500 Euro, and I would be more than happy to collect 2.000 of it from this campaign. The rest will hopefully come from some other ways of Universe speaking.


THANKS to:

Tanja Minarik - video

Topola – music used in video

Foto studio Centar, Zagreb - prints

STEP Beyond Travel grant - European Cultural Foundation

Queer Zagreb


WEB: 

www.wherethelightwillfall.com


E-MAIL:

wherethelightwillfall@gmail.com
story_txt:
Why is it
that BORDERS and NATIONALITY, and not FREEDOM, shape the IDENTITY of most of
the people on this planet? Today’s national borders have been in constant flux through
history and come from a desire to take other people's land and through blood
and tears. Everyone is born somewhere. It's not something you deserved, made or
gained. How is it then that the pure coincidence of being born in one country
leads all too often to a situation where you're ready to kill someone just
because that person doesn't belong to your tribe, nation, country or religion.
I was born
in BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA and as a 9 year old girl I was forced to leave it as
a REFUGEE. My childhood somehow protected me from fully understanding
what the horrors of war are. War
was for me then the game of adults, a game no one could explain to me in a way
I could understand. I was taught to live in the present, to look forward
to the future, and to let the past stay in the past. I generally feel free from
some borders that people, wars, and history have shaped. Rootless would be the
closest picture of my concept of national identity and if any place defines me
as a person it would be planet Earth, not any particular country. In the
meantime, I moved to Berlin and it happens so often that in mixed international
groups people ask you: Where are you from? Sometimes you need to move away to
see the whole picture, to see that we are never free from our past and
countries we come from. I found out that part of me is still that 9 year old
Bosnian refugee girl, a girl that now wants to tell her story.
The WAR in Bosnia and Herzegovina, that heart-shaped country
in the middle of Europe, finished 20 years ago. And it’s not just marks of the
war that you can see everywhere, like holes in the walls, it’s about the war
that is still happening in the heads of the people. Towns are still divided and
people are divided with their national identities. The hate and the un-forgiveness
are still very much alive and are disabling the country to develop and people
to live a normal life again. 
I want that
to CHANGE. My only weapon is my CAMERA. I came back to Bosnia and Herzegovina
as a photographer, traveled through it from my hometown Bugojno to capital
Sarajevo, from divided town Mostar to a place of the biggest massacre in that
war - Srebrenica. I was shooting THE LIVING and THE DEAD Bosnia and
Herzegovina, making portraits of PEOPLE in streets and on markets, and visiting
CEMETERIES. And exactly there, on Muslim, Catholic, Orthodox, Jewish, and
Partisan cemeteries I felt that I finally came home and found pieces of my
country. Those places don’t call for new hate, revenge or more killing. Death
makes everything even. If we can be the same in front of death, why can’t we be
brothers and sisters while we’re still alive?Now, the time has come to show it to the world. I’ve decided to travel with this photo project from my newly adopted town of BERLIN, all the way through the BALKAN region and end up in ISTANBUL. The history of Berlin and Istanbul are marked by conflicts and divisions, but also by the demolition of walls and fostering of acceptance. Countries of the former Yugoslavia are still on their way to unfolding those nodes in themselves. This project will last from the end of April to the beginning of August 2015. The exhibition will try to start a dialog about identities, traces of both personal and global HISTORY, MEMORY and OBLIVION, FORGIVENESS and the lack of it. On my way I will also try to document other people's stories on these themes and show them afterwards.
I have
already found spaces to show my work in Berlin (Café & gallery Pappelreiche),
Frankfurt Oder (as a part of the festival Art and der Grenze), Prague
(Café & gallery Lajka), Rijeka
(Erste club Gallery), Split (No name
Gallery), Koprivnica (AK
Gallery), Tuzla (Peace Flame House Tuzla), Novi Sad (Café & gallery Frida),
Skopje (Kooperacija, Mobile /
Montage Gallery), Sofia (The Fridge)  and Istanbul (looking for the space). 
This is
where you, my lovely audience, come in. I have prepared some nice GIFTS for you
– postcards, original prints and shoots. If you donate just 5 euro, this
enables me to buy a new roll of film for my analog cameras and every new film
brings 24 or 36 new possibilities. So this money
makes a real DIFFERENCE and I am utterly GRATEFUL for every piece of SUPPORT.
The money collected in this campaign will be used to cover travel costs,
accommodation, printing of photos and new films.
I believe
that ART can have the POWER to make a CHANGE in the world and I’m ready to do
it. Become a part of my project, help me break some borders in people's heads
and spread a little more COMPASSION and TOLERANCE. The BUDGET of the campaign is as follows:
Travel
costs for bus/train/carpooling – 1300 Euro
Costs of
accommodation (where it is not possible to use someone’s hospitality)– 600 Euro
Costs of
food and refreshments (not to be a starving artist :)) - 400 Euro
Costs of
residency in Istanbul – 500 Euro

promotional materials for the project – 300 Euro

and other equipment – 200 Euro
Costs of
perks (printing and postal costs) – it's up to you, but let's say 200 Euro
Total costs
would therefore sum up to around 3.500 Euro, and I would be more than happy to
collect 2.000 of it from this campaign. The rest will hopefully come from some
other ways of Universe speaking.

story:
(An English message follows below.)

En ESPACIOGAF.COM necesitamos de tu apoyo para seguir adelante con nuestro trabajo. Es por ello que  te ofrecemos posibilidades para que puedas contribuir con este proyecto.

Una campaña de Crowdfunding se realiza para generar un financiamiento colectivo, o recaudar fondos para una causa. Aquí les presento esta campaña para el proyecto: EspacioGAF.com. plataforma web de fotografía latinoamericana. Un proyecto de la asociación civil sin fines de lucro GAF-Galería de arte fotográfico

No quisimos recaudar fondos, sin antes trabajar casi un año con nuestros propios recursos, tiempo y talento, para que el proyecto tuviera forma y solidez. Ya hoy es una realidad. Contamos con más de 25 mil visitas mensuales y tenemos cerca de 32 mil seguidores en nuestras redes con tan sólo 6 meses on line. Pero queremos seguir creciendo, incorporar talentos y nuevas tecnologías. Para ello se necesitan recursos. De ahí que hemos creado esta campaña, como ejercicio inicial para conseguir el financiamiento de un proyecto por y para la fotografía venezolana y latinoamericana.

Dejo en sus manos apoyar y/o compartir esta campaña, que tiene vigencia de 40 días. Se puede apoyar desde 10USD. Y algunos aporten incluyen recompensas. 

Un abrazo para todos !!!


¿Qué somos?

ESPACIOGAF.COM Es una plataforma virtual, dedicada al análisis, difusión, y conocimiento del arte fotográfico en Latinoamérica; sus autores, su presencia en el mundo, actualidad, entrevistas a fotógrafos consagrados y emergentes, convocatorias, concursos, reseñas históricas de maestros de la fotografía, portafolios de fotógrafos emergentes, festivales, encuentros teóricos y conferencias

Dentro de la dinámica de la fotografía en nuestros países, queremos ser un punto de conexión entre el público y los autores, entre los fotógrafos emergentes y con larga trayectoria. El objetivo es que nuestro contenido sea informativo y formativo, más allá de la técnica y el formato, para adentrarnos en los discursos, estilos, temas e  ideas de los fotógrafos latinoamericanos.

¿Quiénes somos?

ESPACIOGAF.COM es producido por Espacio GAF- Galería de arte fotográfico Asociación civil sin fines de lucro ubicada en Mérida-Venezuela.  En la actualidad, dirigida por su fundador Marcel del Castillo, experimentado fotógrafo y gerente cultural, que viene del periodismo y la producción audiovisual. En la GAF, trabajamos y colaboramos profesionales de la fotografía, cineastas, historiadores del arte y estudiantes ligados al mundo de las artes visuales para darle cuerpo y vida a todas nuestras actividades.

Con el aporte de nuestros patrocinantes iremos conformando un equipo más amplio, para extender las capacidades y coberturas del portal espacioGAF.com

¿Porqué necesitamos tu apoyo?
Queremos seguir mejorando y ampliando el proyecto, incorporar talentos, desarrollar contenidos exclusivos, y trabajar con nuevas tecnologías. Todo eso requiere inversión. 

Hasta ahora el proyecto ha sido financiado con los recursos de nuestra asociación civil sin fines de lucro, y hemos logrado, en tan solo 6 meses de funcionamiento tener una audiencia de más 110 mil vistas y con un promedio mensual de 25.000 visitas y  con más de 32 mil seguidores en nuestras redes sociales.

Pero para continuar, requerimos tu apoyo !

¿A qué destinaremos sus aportaciones?

Cada apoyo que recibimos lo distribuimos de la siguiente forma:

  • 20%. Coberturas de eventos fotográficos, entrevistas a fotógrafos e investigadores
  • 20%. Desarrollo y mantenimiento Web y redes sociales
  • 20%. Salarios.
  • 20%. Gestión
  • 10%  Materiales.
  • 10%. Promoción.


Recompensas

Como recompensa por tu apoyo, hemos preparado unas recompensas exclusivas y maravillosas con obras y libros de fotografía de autor de www.marceldelcastillo.com

Tu aporte, dará fuerzas para que espaciogaf.com se convierta en la plataforma virtual de proyección internacional de la fotografía latinoamericana. De sus maestros y su talento emergente.

Ayúdanos a divulgar esta campaña.  y muchas gracias por tu apoyo !



On ESPACIOGAF.COM we need your support to continue with our work. That is why we offer opportunities for you to contribute to this project.


Crowdfunding campaign is performed to generate a collective financing, or raise money for a cause. Here I present this campaign to the project: EspacioGAF.com. Latin American photography web platform. A project of the civil non-profit association GAF-Galería de arte fotográfico

We did not want to raise funds without first working for almost a year with our own resources, time and talent so that the project would form and solidity. And today it is a reality. We have over 25 000 visits per month and we have about 32 000 followers on our networks with only six months online. But we continue to grow, incorporating new technologies and talents. Resources are needed for it. Hence we have created this campaign as an initial exercise to get funding for a project by and for the Venezuelan and Latin American photography.

Leave it to you to support and / or share this campaign, which is valid for 40 days. It can support from 10USD. And some provide include rewards.

A hug for everyone !!!


What are we?

ESPACIOGAF.COM is a virtual platform dedicated to the analysis, dissemination, and knowledge of photographic art in Latin America; its authors, its presence in the world today, interviews with established and emerging photographers, announcements, contests, historical reviews of masters of photography, portfolios of emerging photographers, festivals, theoretical meetings and conferences

Within the dynamics of photography in our country, we want to be a connection point between the public and authors, among emerging photographers  and photographers with a long history. The goal is that our content is informative and formative, beyond the technique and format, to get into the speeches, styles, themes and ideas of Latin American photographers.

Who we are?

ESPACIOGAF.COM is produced by ESPACIO GAF- Galería de arte fotográfico, civil non-profit association, located in Merida, Venezuela. Today, led by founder Marcel del Castillo, experienced photographer and cultural manager, who comes from journalism and audiovisual productions. On the GAF, we work and collaborate professional photographers, filmmakers, art historians and students linked to the world of the visual arts to give body and life to all our activities.

Why we need your support?

We want to continue improving and expanding the project to incorporate talents, develop exclusive content, and work with new technologies. All this requires investment.

So far, the project has been funded with the resources of our civil non-profit association, and we have achieved in just six months of operation we have an audience of over 110 000 views and a monthly average of 25,000 visits and more than 32 thousand followers in our social networks.

But to continue, we need your support!

What will allocate their contributions?

Each support we receive distribute it as follows:

20%. Photographic coverage of events, interviews with photographers and researchers.

20%. Web development and maintenance and social networks.

20%. Wages.

20%. Management

10%.  Materials 

10%. Promotion.

Rewards 

In return for your support, we have prepared an exclusive and wonderful rewards works and photography books author of  www.marceldelcastillo.com . Your contribution will give espaciogaf.com forces to become the virtual platform for international projection of Latin American photography. Their Masters and their emerging talent. Help us to spread this campaign. and thank you very much for your support!


Muestra de algunas recompensas / Sample some rewards

Photos of Marcel del Castillo

story:
"Gianluca La Bruna's photographs capture this peculiar contrast between dream and desperation. His pictures make me feel an anarchistic desire to look ahead, get dressed to kill, intoxicated and to let life be lived. The pictures summarize an era that believes in creative solutions and different lifestyles, still on the fringe of society but without the destructive will to remain there on the margins. In short, Malmö.​"

Extract from the foreword.

John Peter Nilsson (former director at Moderna Museet Malmö and now museum strategist at Moderna Museet in Stockholm)

 

Hi everyone,

my name is Gianluca La Bruna, an Italian photographer based in Malmö. I have been lucky enough to witness the rise of a magic place in town. I do believe that its unique story, that shaped the life of so many people, needs to be told. With this photo book everyone will get a glimpse of this wonderful community.

After all, everybody needs a PLAN B.

* * *

My forthcoming photo book is a reflection on a community, on music, DIY-culture and friends co-creating an alternative society, but it is also, on a very personal level, a representation of my personal growth.

Even when I was living in Italy, photography was my true passion, but it was a side job while I worked as a social worker and studied landscape architecture.

When I moved to Sweden a few years ago, a baby on the way and not quite 30 years old, I decided that photography, my passion, must also be my central focus.

I owe much to my experience with social work. I began developing an attention to the individual in relation to society while involved with an ethnographic research project at the University of Florence. For that project, which resulted in this book, I photographed the working class district in my hometown. But it wasn’t until Plan B that I really began exploring these relations using photographic language.

I’ve always felt a connection between music and photography. When I was a student, I had an apprenticeship at a music festival in my hometown. Shooting the festival between exams, I can’t say that I was doing deep social investigation, but I began to learn how to shoot fast and edit even faster.
 
Soon after moving to Malmö, I met Carlo, Moraea and Viktor. They were getting ready to open a membership club in a basement on the so-called 'most dangerous streets in Malmö'. Within a few weeks they had booked bands and were staging concerts. There were like 180 bands within the first year and a half who played on that stage made from pallets. By the end of 2019 the number just blew up to 600. It was crazy, there was no time for anything else, I definitely wasn’t shooting between exams anymore.
 
 
This venue created out of nothing started to attract people that, like its creators, were driven out of a love of being together, a new feeling of freedom, of having a voice and an identity. All sorts of subcultures, movements, activists, communities gravitated towards Plan B, drawn, it seems, to the attractiveness of this belonging that was full of freedom to be unique.
 
I was lucky to be at Plan B (Swedish for “basement level”) at the beginning, but even luckier to be someplace where I wanted to stay until the end. Plan B in its basement era was the best family, safe, free and full of love. Night after night, I documented almost every single concert and event.
 
Plan B has been the place where to go when there was no plan A.
 
This is my plan B.
 

 

Book specs:

  • 200 pages photobook 276x340 mm: hardcover with engraved title edition + softcover with flaps edition. MUNKEN Pure paper
  • Artists and bands contributions
  • Foreword from Johan Peter Nilsson (former director at Moderna Museet Malmö and now museum strategist at Moderna Museet in Stockholm)
  • Bio/interview by Ralph Bretzer​ (journalist and curator of Nöjesbloggen at Skånska Dagbladet)
  • List of the band that played at Plan B (2015-2019)
  • Contact sheets pages of all the 'killed' photos 

 

The book will be published by Kira förlag, a small independent publishing house based in Malmö that is focused on giving voice to authors of this part of Sweden. We share the same values and the connection between Jeanette, my publisher, and I has grown also on a personal level: we work side by side every day, cook together, share a laugh or a fun story. I feel blessed that this family feeling did not leave me when I decided to transform my project into an editorial product. I know that Kira förlag aims to make a difference for this region - it surely made a difference for me.

Why do I need your support?

First, and probably more important, I want to keep the price of the book as low as possible, and that's the reason why I need you as my supporters. The more copies I can print, the less each one of them will cost, so I need to raise enough money to print 1000 books.

I also want to keep the perks as low as possible, because the lower the fees, the more people will have the opportunity to participate. This project represents the power of communities and togetherness, and I want as many people as possible to be part of its making.

I know these are hard times economically speaking, but please, don't think you can't help in any way if you don't find yourself in the position to spend money. Talk about the project, about the book, spread the word and copy the link on your social networks! This way you will contribute more than you can imagine.

If I do reach the goal you will have my eternal gratitude! Anyway, if I don't reach the goal, you still get what you ordered. 

Important! You have until the 16th of November 2020 to claim your items from this campaign and/or give the name you want to be shown in the book. 30 days from the launch!

 

Every single contribution it's a BIG help and it will fund these expenses:

  • 78.000 kr = Printing: books (250 copies hardcover and 750 copies softcover with flaps); fine art prints (poster size, A4, A3, A3+), prints A4 format, postcards (galore!), 
  • 25.000 kr = to Sara, the most amazing layout designer
  • 22.000 kr = wrapping and packaging of the items
  • 15.000 kr = campaign fees + transaction fees

 

Exhibitions and Press Releases​ 

  • Dokumentärfotosalong 2020 - Arbetets Museum in Norrköping, 05.10. 2020 - 10.01.2021
  • ​Trieste Photo Days, 17.10 - 08.11.2020
  • PLAN B Finissage for Andy Warhol 1968! - Moderna Museet in Malmö, 31.8 2019 – 5.9 2019
  • Malmö Gallerivecka 2020, Mörkrum Format, 26-27 September 2020

 


Skånska Dagbladet, 2020-08-12 - Article about Arbetets Museum exhibition and photo book.


Double interview on Sydsvenskan with the master photographer Mats Bäcker about our upcoming exhibitions and PLAN B photo book, 2020-09-25

 

Risks

    My project is well under way. During the last year I dedicated every second of my time planning the book, and still dedicating every second of my time making it. The book is virtually there: the graphic designer Sara worked hard to have every single page done, the cover is done, the paper is chosen, the publisher Jeanette is ready for the distribution, the press has talked about the book and advertised it. We are there!

    There are always factors outside of control, as printing problems, shipping delays, and unexpected glitches that may arise. I am confident that none of these potential issues will occur, but we live in a strange year indeed. Corona time might have an impact on shipping times, for instance. If this happens, I will keep my backers constantly updated and let them know immediately what my new plans are. I have lots of Plan Bs.
story_txt:
"Gianluca La Bruna's photographs capture this peculiar contrast between dream and desperation. His pictures make me feel an anarchistic desire to look ahead, get dressed to kill, intoxicated and to let life be lived. The pictures summarize an era that believes in creative solutions and different lifestyles, still on the fringe of society but without the destructive will to remain there on the margins. In short, Malmö.​"

Extract from the foreword.
John Peter Nilsson (former director at Moderna Museet Malmö and now museum strategist at Moderna Museet in Stockholm)

 

Hi everyone,
my name is Gianluca La Bruna, an Italian photographer based in Malmö. I have been lucky enough to witness the rise of a magic place in town. I do believe that its unique story, that shaped the life of so many people, needs to be told. With this photo book everyone will get a glimpse of this wonderful community.
After all, everybody needs a PLAN B.
* * *
My forthcoming photo book is a reflection on a community, on music, DIY-culture and friends co-creating an alternative society, but it is also, on a very personal level, a representation of my personal growth.
Even when I was living in Italy, photography was my true passion, but it was a side job while I worked as a social worker and studied landscape architecture.
When I moved to Sweden a few years ago, a baby on the way and not quite 30 years old, I decided that photography, my passion, must also be my central focus.
I owe much to my experience with social work. I began developing an attention to the individual in relation to society while involved with an ethnographic research project at the University of Florence. For that project, which resulted in this book, I photographed the working class district in my hometown. But it wasn’t until Plan B that I really began exploring these relations using photographic language.
I’ve always felt a connection between music and photography. When I was a student, I had an apprenticeship at a music festival in my hometown. Shooting the festival between exams, I can’t say that I was doing deep social investigation, but I began to learn how to shoot fast and edit even faster. Soon after moving to Malmö, I met Carlo, Moraea and Viktor. They were getting ready to open a membership club in a basement on the so-called 'most dangerous streets in Malmö'. Within a few weeks they had booked bands and were staging concerts. There were like 180 bands within the first year and a half who played on that stage made from pallets. By the end of 2019 the number just blew up to 600. It was crazy, there was no time for anything else, I definitely wasn’t shooting between exams anymore.  This venue created out of nothing started to attract people that, like its creators, were driven out of a love of being together, a new feeling of freedom, of having a voice and an identity. All sorts of subcultures, movements, activists, communities gravitated towards Plan B, drawn, it seems, to the attractiveness of this belonging that was full of freedom to be unique. I was lucky to be at Plan B (Swedish for “basement level”) at the beginning, but even luckier to be someplace where I wanted to stay until the end. Plan B in its basement era was the best family, safe, free and full of love. Night after night, I documented almost every single concert and event. Plan B has been the place where to go when there was no plan A. This is my plan B.  Book specs:
200 pages photobook 276x340 mm: hardcover with engraved title edition + softcover with flaps edition. MUNKEN Pure paper
Artists and bands contributions
Foreword from Johan Peter Nilsson (former director at Moderna Museet Malmö and now museum strategist at Moderna Museet in Stockholm)
Bio/interview by Ralph Bretzer​ (journalist and curator of Nöjesbloggen at Skånska Dagbladet)
List of the band that played at Plan B (2015-2019)
Contact sheets pages of all the 'killed' photos 
 The book will be published by Kira förlag, a small independent publishing house based in Malmö that is focused on giving voice to authors of this part of Sweden. We share the same values and the connection between Jeanette, my publisher, and I has grown also on a personal level: we work side by side every day, cook together, share a laugh or a fun story. I feel blessed that this family feeling did not leave me when I decided to transform my project into an editorial product. I know that Kira förlag aims to make a difference for this region - it surely made a difference for me.Why do I need your support?First, and probably more important, I want to keep the price of the book as low as possible, and that's the reason why I need you as my supporters. The more copies I can print, the less each one of them will cost, so I need to raise enough money to print 1000 books.I also want to keep the perks as low as possible, because the lower the fees, the more people will have the opportunity to participate. This project represents the power of communities and togetherness, and I want as many people as possible to be part of its making.I know these are hard times economically speaking, but please, don't think you can't help in any way if you don't find yourself in the position to spend money. Talk about the project, about the book, spread the word and copy the link on your social networks! This way you will contribute more than you can imagine.If I do reach the goal you will have my eternal gratitude! Anyway, if I don't reach the goal, you still get what you ordered. Important! You have until the 16th of November 2020 to claim your items from this campaign and/or give the name you want to be shown in the book. 30 days from the launch! Every single contribution it's a BIG help and it will fund these expenses:
78.000 kr = Printing: books (250 copies hardcover and 750 copies softcover with flaps); fine art prints (poster size, A4, A3, A3+), prints A4 format, postcards (galore!), 
25.000 kr = to Sara, the most amazing layout designer
22.000 kr = wrapping and packaging of the items
15.000 kr = campaign fees + transaction fees
 
Exhibitions and Press Releases​

​Trieste Photo Days, 17.10 - 08.11.2020

story:
The Project 

 As soon as we landed in India, we knew that our travels had to be documented. Within 24 hours, our senses were overwhelmed and our imaginations running wild due to the observations of different cultures, religions & daily life. 

We set ourselves an open project, with the intentions to not force ourselves to document specific aspects, but to document what we stumbled across. We let the story come to us. This subsequently created a dynamic and slightly chaotic set of images for each country. 

After already travelling three countries, we thought it was time to share our images and anecdotes with everybody. Travelling these countries has taught us that where possible, we should give back. That is why we have chosen to produce the zines while on our travels. Therefore, we will be giving back to the local communities by getting part of the zines printed here.

Brief Overview of Each Zine

India - our first stop on our travels. It definitely did not disappoint. This country is a beautiful chaos of colours, people, magnificent sunsets and plenty of tuk-tuks.
We travelled 5,488 kilometres via motorcycle, bus and train, during our month here. 
This zine will show you a crazy, mesmerising insight to India & it’s people. 


Untitled, Varanasi, 2018, from the Notebook of India


Nepal - our second stop. This country feels like home - to anyone and everyone who enters it, if anyone says otherwise don’t believe them! This country and it’s people warm your heart, something that is almost unexplainable until you’ve travelled there. 
We travelled 433 kilometres by motorbike and bus during our month here. 
This zine will open your eyes to this developing, but culturally rich country.

Lumbini, 2018, double page spread from Notebook of Nepal


Vietnam - our third stop. From the ultra modern, westernised hubs of Hanoi & Saigon to the remote and misty mountains of the northern loop. Vietnam delivered it all.
We travelled 2,832 kilometres by motorbike here. 
This zine will show you all that Vietnam has to offer, an all round endearing country.

Untitled, QL29, 2018, from Notebook of Vietnam

Brief Overview of Us

I have been a Freelance Photographer for seven years. This isn’t my first  campaign on Indiegogo. Four years ago I used this site to fund a project for my FMP in Iceland that gained me a 2:1 in Fashion Photography. I have taken the photographs for this project.

Olivia provides the writing side of our team. She writes on a travel blog and has been undertaking Freelance Travel writing while we have been away.

We are combining our skills by creating this project together and are excited to share it with everyone!

 

Where is the money going?

- Film & Processing costs

- Production Costs

- Design Costs

 

What will happen if we do not reach 100% of the money for this project?

If we do not reach 100% on our goal, the zines will still be printed and everyone who has given will receive the products.

 

Thank you for taking time to look at our project. We really appreciate every bit of support, and depending on the level of interest we may be doing another trio of notebooks from other countries. Thank you once again, we can’t wait for our notebooks to land on your doorstep!

story:
Summary

WPC is a platform for photographers where they can learn, share and get paid using their photography and creativity.

The platform has online photography courses, online competitions, portfolios, blogs, videos, photo reviews, peer-to-peer networking and a lot more. There is no platform on the planet with so many features for photographers on a single platform. 

Currently, we have 4 online photography courses, click to know more

The idea is to create a photography social network for the next generation. We are trying to build a platform, with which we are trying to give back to our users in the form of money, knowledge, and exposure. 

With your support, we would be launching features to help photographers make money from the platform as well,

Featured and supported by

What We Need & What You Get

The amount raised from this campaign would be mainly used for the following purposes including support for the technical side of the website.

  • Marketing of the platform to increase the user base and spread the word about the amazing features and platform that we are trying to build. 
  • Secondly, there are a number of online courses that we wish to do, which are requested by our users. These courses would need some initial investment for production, editing, photographer fee etc. We wish to use the raised amount for these courses.
  • We wish to sponsor good prizes for our competitions for the benefit of our community.
  • Also, we'll use some money for general website maintenance, servers and more...
  • If we are not able to reach our goal, we would distribute the amount raised in the above categories as follows.

If you choose to support our campaign we will be eternally grateful to you. Though there are no gifts that we can give you to say thank you for your contribution, these small token of thanks would be given to all our backers.  

  • Every backer will be mentioned on our website, with special mentions to all big backers. 
  • We are giving away our present online courses, to help you in improving your photography skills and support our mission. If you want to wait and enroll in the upcoming courses please drop us an email after making your contribution.
  • There are some amazing Coffee Table Photo Books to be grabbed, with the best photos from our platform from 2017.
  • For big backers of $500 and $2,000, there are special mentions, Sweat Shirts with Full Access to our complete website (WorldPhotographersClub.com) and upgrade to Pro-Account for access to all top features to the website. 

The Impact

Your contributions will help us in a lot of ways.

  • We would be able to market the platform and its features to get at least 500,000 users in the next 12 months.

  • We would be able to produce 6 new online courses on Fashion Photography, Food Photography, Photoshop and Lightroom, Advanced Photography Concepts, Nature & WIldlife and Mobile Photography.
  • It would help us to maintain and enhance the website to meet global standards. 
  • And finally in the next coming months, we wish to make WPC the preferred choice of every photographer around the world. And with your help and support we should be able to reach their very soon. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute to our campaign. We invite you to checkout our website https://worldphotographersclub.com, create your free account, share your photos, enrol in online courses, take part in competitions and explore the website. The most important thing you can do is spread the word about the platform, your support is always appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Il mondo è un luogo magico e vogliamo mostrarvelo.

Kokparbrothers è un team che riunisce due appassionati di vita, viaggi, avventure e, soprattutto, fotografia e video.

Ci definiamo fratelli che condividono la stessa sensibilità e gli stessi interessi. Ognuno ha un talento diverso, personalità diverse, ma siamo uniti da grande affetto reciproco e passione, siamo nel cuore "brothers". Ognuno ha la propria storia e i propri obiettivi, il proprio impegno verso se stesso e per la squadra.

Insieme abbiamo deciso di partecipare al Mongol Rally2019, un viaggio che ci porterà attraverso 26 paesi, per 18.000 km, a bordo di una FIAT 500.

Vogliamo ritrarre questo cammino, dalla terra e dal cielo: 60 giorni sulle rotte carovaniere della Via della Seta mostrando al mondo le culture e i luoghi.

What We Need & What You Get

Il Mongol Rally è un rally non competitivo che ha principalmente scopo benefico.

Vogliamo quindi che il nostro viaggio e la nostra professionalità fotografica si uniscano per realizzare un libro di immagini e racconti.

La realizzazione del libro ci permetterà di dare un valore visuale al contributo che doneremo alle ONG, di ringraziare con un oggetto tangibile i nostri sostenitori e di avere memoria con la bellezza di un'avventura che è dono per noi e per gli altri.

Risks & Challenges

Il viaggio, che dura due mesi e mezzo, sarà sicuramente ricco di meraviglie, ma ci riserverà qualche rischio. Non è un viaggio semplice: le regole impongono un percorso libero ma anche di viaggiare su un mezzo poco potente, senza l'aiuto di navigatori o di tecnologie moderne. Un viaggio alla vecchia maniera, cartina e bussola alla mano, niente autostrade, nessun privilegio, nessuna assistenza. Ci stiamo preparando da un anno agli imprevisti e faremo in modo che tutti possano seguirci attraverso i canali social ma anche con interviste radio e dirette.

Vogliamo che ci sia dialogo e interazione in tempo reale con tutti coloro che seguiranno la nostra avventura. Sarà appassionante accompagnarci con una presenza virtuale nelle nostre sfide quotidiane e si potrà avere un assaggio dell'atmosfera che vogliamo includere nel libro.

Other Ways You Can Help

Se alcune persone pensano di non poterci aiutare economicamente possono fare molto anche condividendo la nostra campagna o le nostre pagina social. Più siamo a conoscere progetto e meglio è!!!
