story:
Pour mon premier livre photo, j’ai choisi de présenter mon travail sur le Népal, un pays particulièrement cher à mes yeux. Ce n’est cependant pas un livre sur un tremblement de terre, mais davantage un tremblement de terre qui s’incruste dans un livre par inadvertance.

Réplique contient une cinquantaine de photos sur 80 pages sur papier Silk 200M, en format 8x10 avec couverture souple.

Autofinancé et publié à compte d’auteur, votre support est nécessaire afin que ce projet devienne réalité. La sortie et la soirée de lancement/exposition auront lieux le 8  mars 2018 au Art Lounge MTL à Montréal (info ici). À noter qu'uniquement le livre seul peut être envoyé par la poste. Tous les autres combos ou contreparties doivent être récupérées lors du lancement à Montréal.

Présent au Népal avant les secousses, j’ai  pu documenter le pays tel qu’il était quelques jours avant d’être à jamais changé et meurtri. En sécurité lors de la première secousse d’avril 2015, j’ai commencé à photographier le drame, de Katmandou jusqu’aux montagnes de Sindhupalchok, où j’ai failli perdre la vie lors de la réplique du 15 mai. Mon travail en 2015 a essentiellement couvert le pays à son état pré-tremblement de terre ainsi que la catastrophe en elle-même et les dommages causés. Cette partie des photos sera tout de fois secondaire au livre.

 

Je suis retourné au pays en 2017, autant pour poursuivre mon travail photographique avec une perspective nouvelle du temps qui s’écoule, que pour y suivre une classe de maître avec Sohrab Hura de Magnum. J’y étais aussi de façon uniquement personnelle, pour pouvoir compléter mes souvenirs passés et guérir de ce traumatisme.

La trame narrative du livre se penche sur les moments apparemment innocents de la vie quotidienne au Népal en 2017, autant à Katmandou que dans la campagne népalaise. On entrevoit des signes de la tragédie passée mais l’on se concentre sur le présent. Les photos d’hier reviennent périodiquement comme des échos, des répliques, pour rappeler au lecteur que ce qui s’est passé s’efface graduellement.

Le livre sera accompagné d’une oeuvre littéraire de Jean-Pierre Létourneau, écrivain, émondeur, libre penseur, ami de la famille et supporter de toujours. Ses recueils Fables à suivre et Fables surtout sur tout furent publiés aux Éditions de l’impermanence et disponibles lors du lancement.

Caractéristiques techniques d’impression du livre : 50 photos et une fable en 80  pages. Couverture souple et reliure allemande, 8" x 10", impression laser, papier 200M HannoArt Plus Dull Blanc

Pourquoi une campagne de socio-financement?

Comme je produis le livre de façon indépendante, je dois financer également le tout par moi-même. Avec un budget total de 3 500$ (impression, graphisme, promotion, etc), cette campagne est une façon d’absorber initialement la moitié des dépenses et de lancer l’impression.

C’est également un moyen très efficace pour moi d’évaluer la demande et le nombre de copies à imprimer. Pour vous, cela vous donne le sentiment de participer à la création d’un projet artistique ainsi que d’avoir le livre à un prix réduit avec en plus une impression incluse. 

Mais qu'est-ce que la soirée de lancement/exposition?

Le lancement du livre sera non seulement une occasion pour venir récupérer votre livre,le faire signer ou en acheter un directement mais également pour prendre un verre et discuter. La soirée aurat lieu le 8 mars 2018 au Art Lounge MTL à Montréal de 17h à 21h, tous les détails ici.

En plus du livre, une exposition sera présentée regroupant plusieurs photos du livre ainsi qu'une série de portraits, Regards du Népal. Les photos de l'exposition seront également en vente en différents formats et prix.

À noter que les livres de fables de Jean-Pierre Létourneau (auteur du poème présenté dans Réplique) seront également disponibles sur place.

Pourquoi acheter le livre en pré-vente au lieu de simplement attendre au lancement?

Il sera bien évidemment possible de vous procurer le livre directement lors du lancement, sans l'acheter en pré-vente mais je vous encourage fortement à le commander ici.

Pour moi, ça simplifie beaucoup le processus de pouvoir avoir une idée du nombre d'exemplaires pré-vendus pour pouvoir ajuster la quantité à imprimer tout en amortissant une partie des coûts au préalable.

Pour vous, ça vous permet d'avoir le livre avec une impression 5x7 édition limitée gratuite et de vous procurer le livre à prix spécial de pré-vente tout en aidant directement le projet à voir le jour.

 

Que se passe-t-il si le but est atteint et dépassé?

Comme le budget ne représente qu'une partie des dépenses du livre, l'excédent de la campagne servira à financer la différence.

S'il reste encore des surplus, ceux-ci serviront à présenter une exposition plus grande lors de la soirée de lancement. Ils serviront également à l'avance pour mon deuxième livre photo qui sera sur la crise des réfugiés du Moyen-Orient.

Si je ne peux pas aller au lancement récupérer le livre mais ne tiens pas à l’avoir par la poste?

Si par grand malheur vous êtes occupés lors de la soirée de lancement mais demeurez quand même dans la région de Montréal, ne paniquez surtout pas. Vous pouvez vous épargner les frais de livraison en s'organisant avec moi pour un café dans les alentours du plateau/Mile-End et je vous le remettrai en personne. Espresso simple, pas de lait, pas de sucre, merci d'avance ;)

Bio

Frédéric Séguin, 28 ans, photographe basé à Montréal. Diplômé en Affaires internationales à HEC Montréal et ancien co-fondateur de l’organisme Shoot to Help et présentement au DESS en Gestion du développement international et de l’action humanitaire à l’Université Laval.

Après avoir exploré plus de trente-cinq pays et résidé à l’étranger, je me suis consacré à temps plein à la photographie. À l’aube du 26 avril 2015, je fus témoin et victime des tremblements de terre au Népal. Dans cette tension de peur et de consternation, la solidarité d’un peuple et sa résilience face à cette tragédie ont eu un effet catalyseur sur mon travail.

Depuis cette expérience au Népal, je me suis investi à temps plein à la photographie documentaire, tentant de présenter l’humain à travers les événements avec ma touche et ma vision personnelles. J’ai également couvert la crise des réfugiés syriens en Europe et au Moyen-Orient, depuis 2015 jusqu’à aujourd’hui.

Le retour à mes projets existants me sert ainsi à analyser l’effet du temps. La photographie, médium souvent intemporel et restreint à un infime instant d’une vie, peut également laisser entrevoir l’histoire d’humains et de lieux à travers les années qui passent.

POUR EN SAVOIR PLUS

Page Facebook (infos sur le lancement à être annoncés ici)

Soirée de lancement et vernissage du 8 mars

Site Web et portfolio

Choix des grandes photos à imprimer 

me contacter directement:  fred@fredericseguin.com
story_txt:
Pour mon premier livre photo, j’ai choisi de présenter mon travail sur le Népal, un pays particulièrement cher à mes yeux. Ce n’est cependant pas un livre sur un tremblement de terre, mais davantage un tremblement de terre qui s’incruste dans un livre par inadvertance.
Réplique contient une cinquantaine de photos sur 80 pages sur papier Silk 200M, en format 8x10 avec couverture souple.
Autofinancé et publié à compte d’auteur, votre support est nécessaire afin que ce projet devienne réalité. La sortie et la soirée de lancement/exposition auront lieux le 8  mars 2018 au Art Lounge MTL à Montréal (info ici). À noter qu'uniquement le livre seul peut être envoyé par la poste. Tous les autres combos ou contreparties doivent être récupérées lors du lancement à Montréal.


Présent au Népal avant les secousses, j’ai  pu documenter le pays tel qu’il était quelques jours avant d’être à jamais changé et meurtri. En sécurité lors de la première secousse d’avril 2015, j’ai commencé à photographier le drame, de Katmandou jusqu’aux montagnes de Sindhupalchok, où j’ai failli perdre la vie lors de la réplique du 15 mai. Mon travail en 2015 a essentiellement couvert le pays à son état pré-tremblement de terre ainsi que la catastrophe en elle-même et les dommages causés. Cette partie des photos sera tout de fois secondaire au livre.
 
Je suis retourné au pays en 2017, autant pour poursuivre mon travail photographique avec une perspective nouvelle du temps qui s’écoule, que pour y suivre une classe de maître avec Sohrab Hura de Magnum. J’y étais aussi de façon uniquement personnelle, pour pouvoir compléter mes souvenirs passés et guérir de ce traumatisme.
La trame narrative du livre se penche sur les moments apparemment innocents de la vie quotidienne au Népal en 2017, autant à Katmandou que dans la campagne népalaise. On entrevoit des signes de la tragédie passée mais l’on se concentre sur le présent. Les photos d’hier reviennent périodiquement comme des échos, des répliques, pour rappeler au lecteur que ce qui s’est passé s’efface graduellement.

Le livre sera accompagné d’une oeuvre littéraire de Jean-Pierre Létourneau, écrivain, émondeur, libre penseur, ami de la famille et supporter de toujours. Ses recueils Fables à suivre et Fables surtout sur tout furent publiés aux Éditions de l’impermanence et disponibles lors du lancement.
Caractéristiques techniques d’impression du livre : 50 photos et une fable en 80  pages. Couverture souple et reliure allemande, 8" x 10", impression laser, papier 200M HannoArt Plus Dull Blanc


Pourquoi une campagne de socio-financement?
Comme je produis le livre de façon indépendante, je dois financer également le tout par moi-même. Avec un budget total de 3 500$ (impression, graphisme, promotion, etc), cette campagne est une façon d’absorber initialement la moitié des dépenses et de lancer l’impression.

Le lancement du livre sera non seulement une occasion pour venir récupérer votre livre,le faire signer ou en acheter un directement mais également pour prendre un verre et discuter. La soirée aurat lieu le 8 mars 2018 au Art Lounge MTL à Montréal de 17h à 21h, tous les détails ici.
En plus du livre, une exposition sera présentée regroupant plusieurs photos du livre ainsi qu'une série de portraits, Regards du Népal. Les photos de l'exposition seront également en vente en différents formats et prix.
À noter que les livres de fables de Jean-Pierre Létourneau (auteur du poème présenté dans Réplique) seront également disponibles sur place.
Pourquoi acheter le livre en pré-vente au lieu de simplement attendre au lancement?
Il sera bien évidemment possible de vous procurer le livre directement lors du lancement, sans l'acheter en pré-vente mais je vous encourage fortement à le commander ici.
Pour moi, ça simplifie beaucoup le processus de pouvoir avoir une idée du nombre d'exemplaires pré-vendus pour pouvoir ajuster la quantité à imprimer tout en amortissant une partie des coûts au préalable.
Pour vous, ça vous permet d'avoir le livre avec une impression 5x7 édition limitée gratuite et de vous procurer le livre à prix spécial de pré-vente tout en aidant directement le projet à voir le jour.
 
Que se passe-t-il si le but est atteint et dépassé?
Comme le budget ne représente qu'une partie des dépenses du livre, l'excédent de la campagne servira à financer la différence.
S'il reste encore des surplus, ceux-ci serviront à présenter une exposition plus grande lors de la soirée de lancement. Ils serviront également à l'avance pour mon deuxième livre photo qui sera sur la crise des réfugiés du Moyen-Orient.

story:
True North Photo Journal is Canada’s only platform dedicated exclusively to publishing the country’s best photojournalism and documentary photography. Founded by a photojournalist for photojournalists in early 2017, True North Photo Journal gives readers access to stories that might otherwise go unseen: from Indigenous people's special relationship with hockey in Canada, to the story of hundreds Bhutanese refugees resettling in Quebec after spending decades in exile.

True North Photo Journal Vol. I is a limited-edition hardcover anthology featuring the work of 10 Canadian photographers whose work was published on the website in its first year. The diverse subjects and aesthetics of their photo essays are as vast as Canada itself. Simultaneously introspective and inquisitive; compassionate and critical, their works covers a vast range of topics from deeply personal pieces about coping with depression, to long term documentary projects with international reporting from North Korea, Nepal, the United States, Colombia and Somaliland.

Limited to 1,000 copies, True North Photo Journal Vol. 1  backers not only receive TNPJ’s first ever 128-page linen hardcover photo book - as well as striking prints of the photographers' work -  but also support the continued publishing and promotion of Canada’s visual storytellers in their journey to take their camera where great stories live. All profits from the book will go towards funding new work both online and in print.

www.TrueNorthJournal.ca
https://facebook.com/truenorthjournal
https://twitter.com/truenorth_photo
https://instagram.com/truenorthjournal

story:
Hello, 

My name is Pete Lamberto. I'm a photographer based in Copenhagen. My work includes portraits I have done with, mostly, people who are a part of the LGBTQ community for the past five years or so.



WHAT'S UP?

Around a year ago one of my best friends told me that his husband of eight years, had revealed that he did not feel at home in his body, and never had. She was not the boy, that her body had tried to fit on her in. And it had now reached a point, where it was no longer bearable to be dressing up as Marc; Marc had to become Maggie.

Sean was devastated. They both were.  

Days went by, weeks, months, and somewhere within this time frame, something amazing happened – they did not slip apart, they grew closer. I realized that I was now witnessing a love story of such a grand proportion; a story that I had to dig deeper into. 


WHERE DOES THE CROWDFUNDING COME IN? (PART 1)

Well, as this currently unfolding story is happening, the next step for them will be Antwerp, where there is a clinic that has specialized in beauty operations, especially for transgender people. Maggie will be going through a facial surgery to enhance feminine features that will get her closer to becoming, and feeling, as herself. 

I would love to document this part of their journey, as it's one of the major events when transitioning, being able to exist publicly without everybody questioning your physical appearance. 

But plane tickets, hotel stay for at least six or seven days, insurances, etc. is just something that I currently cannot afford to realize completely by myself. 


WHERE DOES THE CROWDFUNDING COME IN? (PART 2)

The second part is an exhibition that I'm going to setup here in Copenhagen; an exhibition that hopefully will be traveling outside of Denmark as well. 

But exhibitions are quite expensive to execute properly; there are print costs, framing, shipping, insurances, promotion, etc. so most of the fundings will be utilized to create the exhibition that I feel this story deserves.


LET'S DO THIS TOGETHER

I sincerely hope that many of you will help me make this happen, and be a part of framing this epic lovestory.



WHAT'S IN IT FOR ME?

There are great perks for you!

Depending on what you feel like contributing with, it's everything from being credited on the project (online and on the material being produced in context of the exhibition), to receiving the forthcoming photoseries in your inbox, thank you videos, and limited edition prints that will be signed, sealed and delivered (and numbered, of course) to you.


So jump on board and be part of supporting this project, and celebrate our differences that makes this world so colorful!

story:
A participatory photography project to empower those trapped in the Calais 'Jungle' to tell their own stories.

‘The Jungle’ is now temporarily home to some 5,000 people. Having travelled from Syria, Afghanistan, Iraq, Sudan, Eritrea and beyond, their experiences are mixed and their motivations varied. The overwhelming majority have fled war, violence and persecution; others hope to join family already living in the United Kingdom; and others still simply hope to find a better life in Europe.

The media debate about the Calais Jungle thrives on a particular vocabulary that has gradually dehumanised the victims of the ongoing refugee crisis. Photography plays a particular role in this. For a variety of reasons, photographers often favour the simple, visceral shot at the expense of images which dig into the incredible complexity of the Jungle as a space. Where people are concerned, they are usually included within the frame as symbols rather than individuals. Many of those that live in the Jungle are acutely aware of this, and treat cameras with suspicion: some fear that being photographed may endanger their families should news of their escape reach home; others feel ashamed of the situation they now find themselves in and do not want it immortalised in any resulting pictures. The camera is seen as an apparatus that only takes, without offering any tangible help in return. In the words of a friend from Darfur, photographers come only to ‘make their own business’.


We want to change that.

Working with a group of 5-7 people across ten days in March 2016, we want to create a body of work that takes professional documentary and news photographers out of the picture entirely, instead putting the camera in the hands of those who live in the Jungle so they may begin to tell their own stories. Above all, this project is about empowerment. It is about giving those who have been systematically stripped of their futures control over how they are now presented to the world. 

What we do with the resulting body of work will need to be agreed with the participants, but I hope this will include a show in a political setting in the United Kingdom and a show in the Jungle itself; that we will produce a short book with accompanying text to be distributed in both the UK and in the Jungle; and that the work will appear widely in the British and international media as a counterpoint to some of the tired clichés currently in use.


About me

I'm a documentary photographer and researcher, and have been working and volunteering in the Jungle across multiple visits since September 2015. I will be taking a three-day course run by PhotoVoice, who specialise in organising participatory photography projects, before running this project.

In association with Help Refugees

story:
Nick and Nisarg have many years of combined experience in the field of content creation both professionally and as a passionate hobby. They've done work for numerous organizations and for independent projects.

This time, their project will be to release a photobook that discovers the psychology behind escapism through a different perspective. 

Our next project - and biggest yet - is a photobook, expected for release during Summer 2017. As it is currently in the preproduction phase, we need capital to print copies and contributors to pre-order it.

Basically, we need money to start printing the books because we are self-publishing it! All the money partitioned for equipment will help further the quality.

We aim to produce fine art stylized, thematic content and this book is no exception. This photobook will talk about personal coping methods and experiences with escapism, as well as a variety of widely practiced coping methods! What makes this book special is our focus to produce it the way we see it - through the perspective of a teenager. It will be produced with both high quality color and authentic to film black and white images.

  • You'll receive an 8"x8" first edition photobook (if included with the perk you chose), made to print just for you!
  • We've done graphic design projects for many diverse organizations, including schools, local businesses, and peers, which resulted in positive feedback. 
  • Although there is a lot of work ahead, we are determined to get the job done and with the best quality we can achieve. 

On top of the photobook, we have booked a range of photoshoot, within the studio and on location, as well as short film jobs ahead, spanning from family portraiture to pre-wedding shots to commercial advertising. Your continued support will help advance the quality of work we are able to produce.

To break it down, this is what we'll need to make the photobook.

  • We need backers to help in the upfront publishing cost to get the books printed and ready to sell.
  • We need better equipment, more suitable for this photo-journalistic style of shooting; despite our love for the nostalgic look of film, it lacks the reliability we need. Better equipment means better photos for this type of photography.
  • We need documentation; legally, we can't operate as we wish to without filing as a proper business.
  • A decent portion of the money we collect goes straight towards taxes.
We both have put our own money into our projects, but it will take more than our current income to further Shapeless Media into what we want it to be.


  • Nicholas Del Sordo, a senior in high school, is an aspiring photographer and graphic designer. Along with aspirations to be a Mechanical Engineer, content creation is a hobby held closely to him. Nick currently works as a karate instructor to children and young adults.
  • Nisarg Gandhi is a junior in high school with an interest in camera technology ever since he was younger. He made his first independent short film in 2014 as a director of photography, a title he has held since, Nisarg has come a long way with film creation and editing. Nisarg works at a record store and library.
  • We are raising funds to prepare for future shoots with newer equipment and to register as a proper business in New Jersey. We've worked hard to get to this point, and still have a long way to go, but this campaign will help ensure our dream's likelihood of becoming a reality.

Up to this point, we've been bottlenecked by our dated equipment and lack of resources.

Despite our combined experience and diverse portfolio, there are hurdles we will need to jump over before we become successful in the pursuit of our dream.

  • The perceived lack of drive and professionalism due to our age.
  • Getting in contact with those critical to fashion photography.

Our ambition and motive to deliver only the best experience and results to our customers will surely help overcome these challenges. 

  • Aside from scheduling meetings, attending workshops, and getting in contact with the people who will help get our work out there, we aspire to develop a distinctive look which will both provoke emotion and, for our marketing images, deliver a desired message effectively through the rules of art.

  • "Shapeless Media took pictures of me with my 6 month old son and it was a fantastic experience! I would highly recommend them to anyone that wants professional pictures taken and looking for a smooth and enjoyable experience. I was nervous going into it because I was not sure if my son would behave and look at the camera. Nick and Nisarg had so much patience with him and made it so easy to get these pictures taken. Overall it was wonderful and now I have amazing pictures of this moment in my son's life. I cannot thank them enough!" - Jenna A.
  • "Excellent quality photos and very pleasant to work with. Even though I received a free photo shoot, they treated me as if I were a paying customer. Would definitely recommend!" - James L.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  1. Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  2. Use the share tools to spread the message to your followers via social media.
  3. Follow us on Twitter and Instagram for updates.

And that's all there is to it!

Thank you for taking the time to read what we have to offer and we hope you'll help us get a step closer to our goal!

Regards,
Nick & Nisarg


#WeDoItAll

Basically, we need money to start printing the books because we are self-publishing it! All the money partitioned for equipment will help further the quality.
We aim to produce fine art stylized, thematic content and this book is no exception. This photobook will talk about personal coping methods and experiences with escapism, as well as a variety of widely practiced coping methods! What makes this book special is our focus to produce it the way we see it - through the perspective of a teenager. It will be produced with both high quality color and authentic to film black and white images.


You'll receive an 8"x8" first edition photobook (if included with the perk you chose), made to print just for you!
We've done graphic design projects for many diverse organizations, including schools, local businesses, and peers, which resulted in positive feedback. 
Although there is a lot of work ahead, we are determined to get the job done and with the best quality we can achieve. 





On top of the photobook, we have booked a range of photoshoot, within the studio and on location, as well as short film jobs ahead, spanning from family portraiture to pre-wedding shots to commercial advertising. Your continued support will help advance the quality of work we are able to produce.



To break it down, this is what we'll need to make the photobook.

We need backers to help in the upfront publishing cost to get the books printed and ready to sell.
We need better equipment, more suitable for this photo-journalistic style of shooting; despite our love for the nostalgic look of film, it lacks the reliability we need. Better equipment means better photos for this type of photography.
We need documentation; legally, we can't operate as we wish to without filing as a proper business.
A decent portion of the money we collect goes straight towards taxes.

We both have put our own money into our projects, but it will take more than our current income to further Shapeless Media into what we want it to be.






Nicholas Del Sordo, a senior in high school, is an aspiring photographer and graphic designer. Along with aspirations to be a Mechanical Engineer, content creation is a hobby held closely to him. Nick currently works as a karate instructor to children and young adults.
Nisarg Gandhi is a junior in high school with an interest in camera technology ever since he was younger. He made his first independent short film in 2014 as a director of photography, a title he has held since, Nisarg has come a long way with film creation and editing. Nisarg works at a record store and library.
We are raising funds to prepare for future shoots with newer equipment and to register as a proper business in New Jersey. We've worked hard to get to this point, and still have a long way to go, but this campaign will help ensure our dream's likelihood of becoming a reality.

Up to this point, we've been bottlenecked by our dated equipment and lack of resources.

Despite our combined experience and diverse portfolio, there are hurdles we will need to jump over before we become successful in the pursuit of our dream.

The perceived lack of drive and professionalism due to our age.
Getting in contact with those critical to fashion photography.


Our ambition and motive to deliver only the best experience and results to our customers will surely help overcome these challenges. 
Aside from scheduling meetings, attending workshops, and getting in contact with the people who will help get our work out there, we aspire to develop a distinctive look which will both provoke emotion and, for our marketing images, deliver a desired message effectively through the rules of art.




"Shapeless Media took pictures of me with my 6 month old son and it was a fantastic experience! I would highly recommend them to anyone that wants professional pictures taken and looking for a smooth and enjoyable experience. I was nervous going into it because I was not sure if my son would behave and look at the camera. Nick and Nisarg had so much patience with him and made it so easy to get these pictures taken. Overall it was wonderful and now I have amazing pictures of this moment in my son's life. I cannot thank them enough!" - Jenna A.
"Excellent quality photos and very pleasant to work with. Even though I received a free photo shoot, they treated me as if I were a paying customer. Would definitely recommend!" - James L.




Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Use the share tools to spread the message to your followers via social media.
Follow us on Twitter and Instagram for updates.


And that's all there is to it!
Thank you for taking the time to read what we have to offer and we hope you'll help us get a step closer to our goal!
Regards,Nick & Nisarg
#WeDoItAll

story:
Short Summary

 

My name is Jessica Rens, and I am a freelance photographer with a passion for travel and telling the tales of those I meet.

This campaign will give me a chance to continue doing just that. I want to bring people’s stories to life, not focusing on the exterior of a person, but on their story. The photographs and stories from this campaign will eventually be put into book format, although they will first appear on my blog.

Funding this via indiegogo means that I’ll be able to travel further than the surrounding counties and talk to and photograph more people, showing different ways of life and varying stories. I want to be able to produce images that reflect people of all backgrounds.

What I Need & What You Get

I need £5,000 to get started.

This will cover: 

  • Travel & accomodation costs(40%)
  • Wear and tear + hire of equipment(25%).
  • Outlay of putting the book together and printing a limited run.(35%)

A free copy of the book once complete, a free photoshoot if I’m in your area, free digital prints, and more are on offer depending on how much you donate. And of course, you’ll get a thank you on my Facebook page.

If I do not reach the full goal, the money used will go as far it as can to completing my project.

The Impact

The project shows people the value of travel and the connections made along the way. And that no matter our differences there are things we have in common.

A photograph of someone can speak a thousand words, mirroring something within the viewer and pulling emotions out.

Friendships are made when creating photographic images that come from the deepest parts of us.

Risks & Challenges

High costs are always a problem - hence this campaign.

Finding someone in every city visited to shoot - which is why I’ll be offering some free shoots as perks, and I’ll put out a list of dates and places on social media so that people can contact me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share the campaign across social media, mention it to friends, email family members. Retweet and share posts I make about the campaign.

Like me on Facebook (www.facebook.com/jessicarensphotography) and share my page with others.

Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! They’ll help point people directly at the campaign.

And if you’re unable to donate but might be able to offer a couch to surf on for a night or two, whilst I’m traveling, that would be fantastic.

Share places you think I should visit on my travels, you may know of a hidden gem of a town or village that I hadn’t thought of.

story:
I am a photographer based out of Copenhagen, Denmark. I travel any chance I get. I am working on a project to cover big or small cities in Europe. I aim to capture the hidden gems on my lens. I feel every city in Europe is unique and has a story to be told and I aim to capture that in my photographs. I will prepare a series of digital photo books, your window to the beautiful Europe. Above, feel free to browse through some of my photographs from my recent visit to Rome.

Next on my map, is the beautiful Bergen in Norway. I will be spending 3 days there. Join me in exploring.

Your contribution will help me cover more cities and get more stories to you. 

 

What I Need

All I need is your love and support. Follow me on Instagram and join me on my journey.

I have been using my savings to travel and take photographs. Your help will be partially covering my travel and editing expenses.

For the next trip to Bergen in August:

Return flight to Bergen: 400 EUR
Transportation in Bergen: 150 EUR
Accommodation: 400 EUR

Post Processing and Editing: 100-200 EUR

 

What You Get

On top of tonnes of love, all my friends will receive a signed postcard (with the best photograph, of course).  

In addition, all my super friends will get access to a digital travel photo book of Bergen which you will be able to print if you wish.

Lastly, all the super duper supports will get an additional exclusive access to download more than 50 high-resolution photographs from me.

Even if you cannot contribute financially. No worries. Help me spread the word among your friends. And yes, all of you can follow my journey on Instagram and Facebook.

Stay tuned and Enjoy!

Peace.

story:
The Short Summary


Dear friends and wonderful people,

   Many of you know me, but for those who do not, my name is Daniel Jason Decker and I am a Photographer.

For the majority of my life, I have been chasing dreams just like many of you. With blessings, I have been fortunate enough to make money with my passion for photography. Much of the time this has been achieved by working for others.

Now, I am bringing my talent and artwork directly to you. Outwardly, this may seem like a small step, but for me it is a life changing leap.

This INDIGOGO funding campaign action is to serve Two wonderful purposes:

  • Introduce myself professionally to all of you via the sale of my artwork and talent.
     
  • Raise money to cover my costs for the MvVO Ad Art show 2020. This year it is being held in the World Trade Center - Oculus Transportation Hub the entire month of September. I am also fortunate enough to be one of their featured artists.

 

The artwork I have been working on these past months is truly some of my best work. I have been utilizing traditional photo techniques like Palladium and Platinum printing as well as modern printing methods. Handmade frames with museum glass have been ordered which will be the perfect finishing touch for this wonderful show.

The Goal is to raise $5000.
Achieving this will make for a wonderful start to my business launch and ease the costly burden of the Art show and those pesky municipal fees.

Your contributions and support will help me make the show a wonderful experience.

Sincerely,
Daniel
www.djdecker.net

story:
My name is Gianmarco Vichi, I am a young photographer from Castel Gandolfo Pope's summer residence, in Italy.

I graduated in bio chemistry and environmental physics concerned by the worsening of climate change.

At same time I developed a growing interest in Photography, so I told myself why not link the two main interests in my life  trying to document our impact on the Earth as a photographer ?

For four years I devoted most of my time trying to grow as a photographer and a the same time improve my knowledge about the threat of climate change

One year ago I have taken the first step of my photographic path going to Iceland during the winter and between sleeping volcanoes ancient glaciers and dancing northern skies I realized how powerful and a the same time fragile Nature is.

I hope my pictures could probably help informing people like you about our common duty to rescue and preserve nature.

That's why "I am North" was born.

I am North project

80° north shooting one of the most remote places on our planet, the white desert, the Svalbard archipelago, searching the king of the arctic, the Polar Bear trying to prove how endangered all this is by our impact on the Earth.

Sustaining "I am North" you won't be only the owner of a photographic work but we will be partners in the fight for the Arctic.


Budget

The total amount of budget for my project is € 7000, that includes snowmobile, accommodation, guides, flights and the cost of realization for the perks.

Perks

There are two kinds of print, Photographic Print and Fine Art print, the first ones are printed on high quality, matte photographic paper, the second ones are printed with meticulous care using fine paper and technically guaranteeing you extreme high quality and long long lasting print.

How it works

You can find my album " I am North" on my Facebook page right after the campaign starts, this album contains all the printable pictures.

Once you have chosen your pictures (they are numbered) go to the " I am North" page on Indiegogo and select your perk.

As last step go to "I am North" album again and post a comment with your name (the same that you have used on Indiegogo) and specify the quality print PQ (Photo Quality) or FA (Fine Art) on the picture you have chosen.

If you have chosen a Photo Box you have to post a comment on every picture you have picked.

Every picture can be printed only 20 times (Print size is not relevant), each copy will numbered and signed.

 Fine Art print have a priority.

Each time a picture is sold I will publish a report.


So...

Step 1

Open " I am North" album on my Facebook page and choose your picture

Step 2

Go to "I am North" indiegogo page select and buy your perk

Step 3

Go to "I am North" album on Facebook again and post a comment with your name and the print quality (PQ or FA) on the picture that you have chosen


In this way I hope that every picture will have a personal meaning for every owner.

Here's some example



Photographic Print will be realized with:

  • Matte paper Hahnemuhle photo pearl 310g/mq;

Fine Art print will be realized with:

  • Matte paper smooth surfaced Hahnemuehle Photo Rag bright White 310g/mq;
  • Cotton fiber paper Hahnemuehle Fine Art museum Etching 350 g/mq;
  • Baryta paper Hahnemuehle Fine Art Baryta 325 g/mq;
  • Smooth and coarse surfaced paper Hahnemuehle Torchon 250 g/mq.

In order to create a perfect balance between picture and paper I’ll select the kind of paper. 

For the box with 5 print you can rely on the same previous rules, but every picture must be different 

Shipping costs are inclusive of package 


Risks

Sustaining "I am North" you are, almost, risk free.
Pictures are part of my previous photographic expedition in Iceland and they have already been done.
The biggest risk if you have chosen picture (number #3 for example) printed on photo quality print and that picture will be sold 20 times on Fine Art paper, you'll have to change your picture. Fine Art print have a priority.
Other risks you could face are some delay during the printing phase, shipment, or some misunderstanding about the campaign.
For every notification visit this page or my Fb, Twitter and G+ pages


Other Ways You Can Help

Hope you like “I am North” and I wish you become a contributors too.

If you like the project, but you don't intend to sustain it, please share it on the web, visit my Fb page, make noise with your friends and.... spread the word!

story:
Who I am

Hi, my name is Marina, a girl full of contradictions : born in Marseille, the city of french hip hop on the year disco music still mattered, l love myself a good pogo brawl at rock concerts, and I’ve been clubbing for more than 20 years. I lived in Paris for 15 years. 


After my first music blog musicbymarina.fr was created in 2011, I started following djs, producers and rock bands throughout Europe with my camera. 

First was a Sony compact cam in 2012, then came shortly after my current Nikon reflex camera, plain, without using any extra features such as flash, lightings, neither image editing softwares. This gave me the freedom to not denature my own vision when pressing the shutter button. 

I had the good fortune of catching the eye of some cool people and since then was commissioned by various magazines and musical labels photo reports and portraits in backstage. 

 

My works :

Magazines :

    Publications in Trax, Tsugi, Modzik, Paris Match, Mixmag, The Guardian, Dazed and Confused, Interview...

Exhibitions :

- Electronic Music Faces exhibition in Marseille at Oogie Lifestore - 14/02/15 - 14/03/15

With DJ Hell as special guest for the opening.

- Electronic Music Faces exhibition at the Paris Kulte store - 04/04/15 - 15/05/15


Others :

- Maceo Plex and DJ Hell T-shirt models for Kulte


About my Project

What can I say about Andrew Weatherall ? I stumbled upon him on a website which was describing him as a : «Legend of British underground and one of the most active motors of electronic music in the last two decades, Andrew Weatherall has enough honours to overflow any attempt to biographical approach. » 
He was one of my very first models for the music blog back in 2012 alongside Matthew Dear. Then, without any financial support, I took every chance I got to take some pictures of him each time he came to France for the past 3 years. 
It was when I was last year invited to his self curated festival in Carcassonne (France) that I started to figure out this project of organizing an exhibition around those 3 years shooting him. First would be my native country, and hopefully later on in the UK. 
This exhibition will be a great opportunity to showcase my work and passion, which I hope will lead to more exposure and commissions.

What I Need & What You Get

I need to raise funding for the printing and framing of roughly 21 pictures as well as shipping and installing them at the gallery in Carcassonne. 
I will also need accomodation during the 7 days exhibition period. 
 20 signed and numbered prints of each of the 21 exhibited pictures will be made available for purchase from the gallery without framing. 
The exhibition is currently scheduled from 24th to 30th september 2015 in Carcassonne, at Bloc G (adress : 112, rue Barbacane - 11000 Carcassonne) for Convenanza festival. 

The sooner I can raise the money, with your support, the sooner I can get the prints and frames made, and prepare the exhibition.

I have set up some perks for your donations, you can see what you'd get for your donation if you look on the right side of this campaign. Every bit counts and I am forever grateful for your help! If I get more than 2100€, the remaining money will go towards funding my next UK photo exhibition tour about Andrew Weatherall.

The different images from the donations are :

- My first print 40x60cm (16x24 inches) from the exhibition, signed, numbered and without framing. The only first copy out of 20 will be available here. http://andrewweatherallbymarina.tumblr.com/tagged/40x60cm

- My print 50x70cm (20x28 inches), signed, numbered and without framing. 13 images are available for you to choose from at the exhibition. The only first copy out of 20 will be available here. http://andrewweatherallbymarina.tumblr.com/tagged/50x70cm

- My print 60x90cm (24x36 inches), signed, numbered and without framing. 7 images are available for you to choose from at the exhibition. The only first copy out of 20 will be available here. http://andrewweatherallbymarina.tumblr.com/tagged/60x90cm


See what media say about my exhibition

http://www.djmag.com/content/new-andrew-weatherall-exhibition-open-france

http://www.theransomnote.co.uk/arts/news/andrew-weatherall-photo-exhibition-set-for-france/

Other ways you can help me

If you can't donate money, you can still help by sharing this campaign on Facebook, twitter, tumblr, your blog, etc. Any sort of social media reaching would be amazing, and if you have any ideas, please feel free to share. The indiegogo share tools will help you spread the word.
I'm searching for some galleries or spaces which are able to host my exhibition.

Some images of the exhibition

- My first print 40x60cm (16x24 inches) from the exhibition, signed, numbered and without framing. The only first copy out of 20 will be available here. http://andrewweatherallbymarina.tumblr.com/tagged/40x60cm 
- My print 50x70cm (20x28 inches), signed, numbered and without framing. 13 images are available for you to choose from at the exhibition. The only first copy out of 20 will be available here.   http://andrewweatherallbymarina.tumblr.com/tagged/50x70cm
- My print 60x90cm (24x36 inches), signed, numbered and without framing. 7 images are available for you to choose from at the exhibition. The only first copy out of 20 will be available here.  http://andrewweatherallbymarina.tumblr.com/tagged/60x90cm
   
See
what media say about my exhibition
http://www.djmag.com/content/new-andrew-weatherall-exhibition-open-france
http://www.theransomnote.co.uk/arts/news/andrew-weatherall-photo-exhibition-set-for-france/

    

Other ways you can help me

If you can't donate money, you can still help by sharing this campaign on Facebook, twitter, tumblr, your blog, etc. Any sort of social media reaching would be amazing, and if you have any ideas, please feel free to share. The indiegogo share tools will help you spread the word.I'm searching for some galleries or spaces which are able to host my exhibition.

Some images of the exhibition

story:
Beginning again again....

My name is Scott  and my new story is just starting.

After having worked in the entertainment industry for over sixteen years, I returned to the tiny Appalachian town where I grew up to care for the elderly aunt who raised me.

My auntie never married, she never had children, and after having a devastating heart attack followed by a massive stroke which left her partially paralyzed - I was all that she had.

I have been caring for her for over six years now, and although her health is much improved, she has regained speech and mobility, she is a glowing but frail 78 years old.

Our struggles have been immense from day one. From my having no clue how to even begin to care for her, to my finally being able to return to work- only to find that, despite my extensive credentials and college degree, life in a coal mining town is just that - life in a coal mining town. Minimum wage jobs, or jobs paying just above that are the only thing available. And now with the state of the economy, even those are few and far between.

I desperately want to carve out something real for myself, here in these mountains, the mountains that I once couldn't wait to flee. It is my dream to finally pick up a camera full time and know that I am doing what I was meant to do. This campaign can make that possible. It can help return me to the arts that I have so desperately missed. This project can also help to bring some stability to the lives of my auntie and myself, and finally give me the opportunity to not have to choose between gas for the car or money for her medicines.


The Funding Goal is to cover my start up, to help me acquire the necessary equipment, the necessary space, the means to survive in the project's infancy, as well as the funds to cover the cost of the rewards and all fees associated with the campaign.

No contribution is too small...even just sharing my story helps immensely. My camera has many, many stories to tell and so do I.

story:
What is Gender, Projected?

Gender, Projected is an ongoing photo project exploring gender expression and identity, started by Am Norgren and Reese Ramponi, who wanted a way to ask questions of themselves and others about gender. By showing photographs and sharing interviews of participants, who identify as everything from male to genderfluid to transgender, we aim to spur discussion around gender and identity, even when that discussion brings up challenging issues. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have taken nearly a thousand photos of each of the more than fifty different models, which we pare down to 5 photos displayed as a spectrum (see an example of this in our Gallery). We will couple these with the model’s interview of the experience.  

Your contributions have brought us to where we are today and have allowed us to donate our first exhibit to the New Haven Pride Center. We're asking for help to support our next project and help Gender, Projected grow. We have an exhibit opening at City Lights Gallery in Bridgeport (http://www.citylightsgallery.org/) on July 9th and are currently working on a computer that moves at glacial speed. Your donation will go directly to a computer dedicated to Gender, Projected's work.  After this cost is covered, funds will go to:

  • Printing and mounting

  • Promotional materials

  • Thank you gifts for collaborators

The Impact

  • You’d be helping us create a platform for discussing identity with folks familiar and unfamiliar with the many gender identities that fall between man and woman.

  • You’d be supporting a month long display at City Lights Gallery.

  • You’d be helping to make accessible a conversation about the complicated and deeply personal concept of gender.

  • You’d be backing a project that has had minimal funding so far. For the past 8 months, we have been photographing and interviewing people who have limited modeling experience using second-hand materials and self-taught makeup and photography skills. We have now reached our capacity to function with a minimal budget, but cannot give up on our idea after it has received interest from many parties.

Challenges

As we mentioned above, we have an exhibit scheduled. If we don’t reach our funding goal, we will not be able to follow through with this event as planned. In addition, we are learning about photography, modeling, and facilitating dialogue and presenting about gender as we go. Learning these new skills to make our ideas reality brings new challenges every day, but we are grateful for the incredible support we have received thus far that has helped us continue this work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit our website at genderprojected.com, spread the word, be a model, and Like Us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Tumblr. 

Most importantly, reach out. While we have already presented at multiple events, we are by no means gender scholars or photography experts. We value your feedback to make the project as human, complex, and critical as it can be.

Whether you haven't thought much about gender or you’ve been looking for a space to explore it, we’d love for you to join our conversation.

story:
Short Summary

This is a creative space long in coming. Black and white photography has been a part of my life since I was a very young man, when my great Aunt Sarah gave me a simple roll camera.

This gallery and lab will serve black and white photographic artists looking for a production space as well as presentation / exhibit space. All artists in the medium, worldwide, will be represented.

The equipment is here. The space is willing. The location is perfect.

What we need is help with infrastructure. It's time to roll up our sleeves and build out the presentation space. Wire the enlargers and plumb the darkroom sinks, and aim for an August opening.

We are offering this campaign to assist in the financial investment necessary to light up the enlargers and mix the chemistry. But we also need your help in being a friend. Share this vision with your network, refer artists to us. Come visit.

Our funding campaign is an attempt to raise a little over $10,000. This builds out the facility, installs all of the equipment and opens our doors for our first show.

Any and all funds collected will be dedicated to this effort.

story:
Hey, ich bin Jennifer a. k. a Happy Berry Photography, ich bin 23 Jahre alt und komme aus der wunderschönen Stadt Leipzig. Ich befinde mich gerade im 2. Lehrjahr in der Ausbildung zur Fotografin. Und hier kommen wir schon zum ersten Punkt, wieso ich diese Kampagne gestartet habe. Als Auszubildene hat man nur ein begrenztes Budget zu Verfügung, was mir daher leider nicht erlaubt mir bzw. meinen Models große Projekte zu finanzieren, welche ich sehr gerne in die Tat umsetzen wollen würde, um qualitativ und progressiv besser zu werden.
Qualität ist mir wirklich sehr wichtig, vor allem auch für meine Follower, die sich meine Bilder anschauen und bewundern wollen. Daher spreche ich hier die Leute an, die gerne mehr und noch bessere Bilder von mir sehen möchten und mich, auch wenn es nur ein kleiner Betrag ist, hier unterstützen wollen.
Viele werden sich sicher denken, dass man ja auch auf seine Wünsche sparen kann, jedoch sind Utensilien im Bereich Fotografie nicht gerade kostengünstig und sind erst ab circa 200€ erwerbar. Dies ist bereits mein Gehalt alleine, sodass ich leider kaum eine Möglichkeit finde mich persönlich in meinem Hobby und anstrebenden Beruf weiterzubilden.

Ihr helft mir daher hier generell ein neues Equipment zusammen zu stellen, unter anderem mit einer neuen Softbox,  Stative, einer neuen und besseren Blitze und einem hübschen Hintergrund. Außerdem möchte ich meinen Models neue Perücken, Klamotten oder Cosplays ermöglichen und daher die 2000€ nur ein "kleiner Teil" einer relativ großen Summe ist.

Und daher kommen wir nun zum Thema was ihr für eure Unterstützung bekommt. Generell möchte ich euch allen etwas geben, indem ich mehr poste, sowie mein gesammeltes Wissen an euch alle weitergebe. Dazu biete ich hier verschiedene Perks für euch an, die Bilder-Pakete enthalten bzw. sehr schöne Fotos von meinen bezauberenden Models Rin Cosplay, Nioria Cosplay, Yvoli Cosplay, Cesca Page etc.. Diese werden für euch verfügbar sein, ab einem bestimmten Betrag.

Um nochmal mein eigentliches Ziel für euch zu verdeutlichen, ich möchte meinen derzeitigen technischen Stand verbessern um jeden von euch, ob Model oder Follower, durch meine Bilder glücklich zu stimmen. Ich möchte meine Werke mit euch allen teilen und daher von Zeit zu Zeit euch auch zeigen können, dass ich mich immer mehr verbessere. Ich bin kein Mensch, der alles für sich behält, lieber zeige ich euch das, was ich mache und wie ich es mache.
 


Ich danke euch alle für eure Unterstützung und hoffe, dass euch meine kommenden Projekte gefallen werden!

story:
Short Summary

 

My name is Alexandra and I am a young female entrepreneur eager to make a difference. I am the founder and CEO of Seven Sexy Sins, a company designing sensual products for women and couples.This campaign is a personal project that came to life with the help of amazing and beautiful ladies as hungry as I am for change. 

I wanted to find a way to raise money to help me start the designing process and production of my products but I also wanted to make a stand for women! For a long time I was bullied into thinking I was too fat and undesirable for society. I know good and hell well now that it couldn't be further from the truth. Confidence comes from 2 things, making yourself happy and supporting one another. So I recruted 9 other beautiful ladies  to help me share this message and to help raise money for Canadian Women inneed. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Donations will cover printing, design, photography and shipping.
  • The amazing images were taken by the most talented Roy Whiddon and will feature 10 strong and fearless ladies. 
  • 12 months of confidence and beauty! 

 

The Impact

  • Sharing this campaign is supporting women both socially and politically. 
  • Help us raise money to empower women, get them out of poverty & out of violence!
  • The Canadian Women's Foundation will put the donations to good use and distribute them between their different programs. Be it: Out of violence, Out of Poverty, Empowering Girls and Inclusive Leadership. Feel free look them up online for more information.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign with the indiegogo's sharing tools, help us reach as many women as possible. Share the love, confidence and remember that the smallest act of kindness can change someone's whole life. You are also welcomed to like our Facebook page!
