story:
Travel Inspired...

is a series of unique limited edition prints with a special purpose; to inspire the uninspired and show the uninitiated that their adventure is out there waiting for them.  I was once one of those people, but I can say with confidence that visiting new lands and cultures has changed my life, made me a better man, and the photographer I am today.  This passion I now seek to share with the world and fund this passion through the sale of my prints.

 

Travel is a gift!

A gift for all, but it's not always that obvious to some. I used to be one of those who believed that travel was a luxury reserved for other people but now, through my photography, I seek to inspire others to take up their own adventure and explore the world. To contribute towards my equipment costs, I have previously sold what you might call 'unmanaged prints'; but now for the first time, I am seeking to offer a collection of signed Limited Edition prints taken from my travel portfolio as I continue in my journey of personal discovery and adventure.

 

Istanbul is where it began...

For the past 4 years, I have been traveling the world falling ever so deeply in love with the excitement of visiting new worlds and the challenge of taking unique and original photographs that perfectly capture my time there. Inspired in 2015 by the wonders of Istanbul where East meets West, and armed with nothing more than a Samsung S6 smartphone, I was drawn into photography by a burning desire to capture more than just holiday snaps, and my passion for photography was ignited.

It was around this time that I had moved away from the music industry where I had been a creative for many years before, and had left a big hole in my life; photography and travel were a complete surprise for me and quickly filled the creative void left by my music.

Galata Tower​ Istanbul 2015

Five or six years ago, I would have considered travel to be something of pure luxury reserved only for other people and totally out of reach for someone like me. It wasn't until I met my partner who is very well-traveled and has exceptional abilities at planning and booking complex trips that my whole view of what a holiday could be. Once a fairly uncultured individual, I now want to inspire others to travel through my photography, showing people like the man I used to be that it is possible to enjoy these spectacular experiences.

From my humble beginnings with nothing more than a smartphone, I have been in a constant state of evolution in both my photography skills and the equipment I shoot with. Teaching myself through trial and error, watching hundreds, if not thousands, of YouTube videos and reading books and magazines on the subject. It has been a glorious yet often frustrating journey going from a mobile, to full manual; JPEG to RAW; a cropped sensor to full-frame. Entry camera bodies with kit lenses, to full-frame bodies with pro lenses; and long may the journey continue!

There have been two particular moments that stand out to me in the last couple of years where I have felt genuinely validated in what I do, and from these moments I take comfort in knowing that I am on the right path. Moments when I have found myself grinning with excitement and pleasure from the sheer fact of exploring a new land and taking on the challenge of capturing inspirational images. 

The first of these moments was in Havana last year. Arriving in any new destination does bring a sense of stress, not only from the physical act of traveling but then the pressure to start capturing interesting and unique images of a place I have never visited before. For a Londoner, Havana is a real shock to the senses and did take some time to adjust, but after the first sunrise, I couldn't help but feel an overwhelming sense of pleasure from being there with my camera. 

The Malecon - Havana 2018

The second was this year in Athens; stood upon the Acropolis shortly after opening with barely a soul in sight it felt like a photographers playground. Throughout my entire time in the Greek capital, I had an almost overwhelming sense of satisfaction as I explored the streets capturing the character and charm of this ancient city. 

Filopappou Hill, Athens - 2019

All the hard work in getting to these moments was worth it, even if it was just for the smile on my face. From an untraveled individual with nothing more than a smartphone, to the man I am today is the real journey, and I encourage all to find a similar journey for themselves. 

 

Taking the next step...

As the quality of my work improved, so did my confidence; it was time to find a platform to publicly display my work and offer prints for sale, and so around 2017 I launched my website with a built in store, and then subsequently an Etsy store as outlets to sell my work. This was when I started to print my work for the first time, opting to use Loxley Colour in Scotland as my chosen print lab, who I use to this day because of their exceptional quality. The experiencing of holding your image professionally printed is truly amazing. Being able to hold the image and feel the quality and see the depth in the print is a glorious conclusion to the photo-taking process.

Entering photography fairly late in life, and with the seemingly unstoppable rise of social media,  I knew that any real chances of being able to support myself from my photographic work were fairly nonexistent, but a more realistic goal would be to try and make my passion self funded. To this end, I have seen small successes through print on demand sales through Etsy, my website and an exhibition of my Asian portfolio in 2018, but compared to my costs to date, this is small change.

Exhibition 2018

This year, I vowed to take the commercial side of my photography more seriously; I am passionate about my work and my message, but I did recognize that my whole e-commerce strategy was amateur, and if I didn't take it seriously, then why should anyone else?  This was a serious question I had to answer, and through my blog posts 'How Not to Sell on Etsy' and 'J6 Etsy Store 2.0', I looked back on my previous selling experiences and explored a new direction. 

This led me to revise my business model; by introducing more structure I could see an opportunity to increase my exposure and saleability which intern should boost profits. My thinking was to flip my original print-on-demand model in favor of carefully selected limited edition prints for sale through my Etsy store, my website, and social media. Each print would be shipped with a signed certificate of authenticity which will add value and legitimacy to my work. I am also seeking to improve my postage and packaging by investing in a label printer and other items to improve the overall experience to prospective buyers.

This extra investment will see my work finished to a high standard and professionally packaged, significantly improving the overall buying experience. I want buyers to receive my print and feel entirely satisfied with their purchase, despite it being packed and shipped from my living room. 

This new business model will see my print costs reduced slightly, consequently increasing the profitability of each sale, but it does carry the risk that I am left financially exposed with a number of prints without homes to go to. To manage this risk, I will be holding a limited stock of each print, whilst at the same time maximizing the online exposure of the listings but without being too pushy, because nobody wants that. 

With so much enthusiasm surrounding the business relaunch, I forged ahead, but I was not anticipating the major setback that followed...

 

An unexpected challenge...

In March, Trouble one of our two much-loved cats was taken ill and spent a night at the vets for what was initially diagnosed to be a bout of sickness. Due to them being indoor cats, and my own naivety/stupidity, I had not taken out pet insurance and so was left to foot the large bill for his treatment. He made a quick recovery and so we thought we were in the clear, but this was not to last.

At the beginning of July, he was readmitted because he had stopped eating and became withdrawn, something totally out of character for him. He was eventually diagnosed by a specialist with Lymphoma and the bills began to rise sharply. Naturally, any thoughts of funding my photography at this crucial time were fading fast.

My Trouble Cub

Sadly, despite all our best efforts, Trouble was taken by his illness. This was a very difficult time and one that I was not expecting, and anything bar the essential was placed on hold. Financially I was struggling, and emotionally I was broken. 

To distract myself from this difficult time, I returned to my business plan and began to think of a new way of funding my project and realizing my goal. What if I could place the products into the hands of early supporters who are as passionate about my work and my journey as I am? These early purchases would help my project get back on track, while I am recovering from the financial fall out of Trouble's treatment. Potential backers (like you) could provide some much-needed support and in return, receive a specially selected piece of my work.

 

The Campaign

For this campaign, I have handpicked 7 unique images that were taken in well-known destinations, but have an air of mystery that forces the viewer to ask 'where was this taken?'. This combination of the familiar combined with an air of intrigue makes these images ideal statement pieces for your home. 

Here is the full range of images and the story behind them. For a full-size, hi-resolution version, click on the image to open a new tab.

Each edition will be printed on Fujicolor Professional DP II Lustre photographic paper, which combines the best of matt and gloss in one glorious product. The matt finish gives the print a unique feel and appearance whilst offering incredible depth in color, whilst maintaining a slight shine to the image without being too reflective like traditional gloss photographs. The prints are of exceptional quality and feel special in the hand. 

This edition will be strictly limited to 66 pieces for this size, and once they are gone, they are gone! Each print is signed and numbered by myself and shipped with a signed certificate of authenticity.

The prints are based around size ISO A3, the exact dimensions are as follows:

Image Size

  • 39.5 x 29.5cm
  • 15.5 x 11.5"

 

With Border

  • 44.5 x 34.5cm
  • 17.5 x 13.5"

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Where am I now?

To date, I have obtained sample test prints of a wide number of shots and,  some full-size test prints to validate the quality of printing at full size. My chosen print lab Loxley Colour provides an excellent test printing service where they print your chosen image as provided, and include a version with their colour correction applied so that these can be compared.

From these test prints, I was able to make my final image selection with confidence knowing that the quality of the printing work for the project would be nothing less than exceptional. 

In preparation for the launch of this project, I have also purchased the address label printer and certificate paper to print the authenticating certificates, which are designed and ready to print.

Setting aside the cost of the trips themselves (something I know will never be recovered) this project has cost £200.00, but there is a long way to go. To realize this project I am seeking £1,400.00, which is broken down as follows:

All the funds raised here contribute towards the cost of this project and do not include any profit. My intention is to make my profit through future sales once the campaign is complete. Reaching the funding goal will ensure I have sufficient funds to purchase all the stock to launch this series and begin turning a profit to fund my passion. To ensure I have sufficient copies of the final prints to reward backers and stock my online stores, I am basing my costs around 20 copies of each image. That's a total of 120 prints.

Pretty ambitious, but I believe in setting high targets!

 

Like what you've heard so far?

Pledges start from as little as £2, even this small amount would help to boost the project and move me closer to my goal. But you want to be rewarded, right? Here are the rewards that are up for grabs, all with free worldwide postage!

All rewards also include tier 1. 

 

£5 - On the team!

Entry-level backers will receive and personal thank you, a special mention in my concluding blog post, and regular updates on the progress of my project.

 

£15 - A small gift for you

Backers will receive one 8 x 6" print of your choice from the series to keep forever.

 

£25 - A bigger gift for you

Backers will receive the full set of 8 x 6" prints from the series. 

 

£55 - Go limited! Early Bird!

Secure your choice of a limited edition signed print of your choice at the discounted rate. Be quick, this is limited to the first 3 days of the campaign only! Your choice of 1no. signed limited edition 45 x 35 cm print with certificate of authenticity.  

 

£65 - Go limited!

Be one of the first to own a limited edition print from this collection. Your choice of 1no. signed limited edition 45 x 35 cm print with certificate of authenticity.   

 

£75 - One to One

This exclusive option is limited to only 3 special backers who will receive their choice of 1no. signed limited edition 45 x 35 cm print with certificate of authenticity, and a  1 hour one to one Skype tutorial on photography basics covering an introduction into exposure, composition and camera functions, or to discuss anything you like! 

 

£80 - Get framed

Who has time to get a frame? Receive 1no. signed limited edition 45 x 35 cm print with certificate of authenticity from the series, framed in your choice of a simple black or white 45 x 52cm ready to hang! 

 

£120 - Double Up!

Torn between two images? Why not get them both and enjoy a saving of £10! Your choice of 2 signed limited edition 45 x 35 cm prints with authenticating certificates.  

 

£300 - All in!

You've come this far, why not go all the way. In addition to tier 1, you'll receive all 6 images in the series (unframed). Better yet, I will reserve edition #1 in each image exclusively for the awesome All In backer. 6no. 45 x 35 cm prints, signed with authenticating certificates.

 

£500 - Shoot With Me In London!

Like what I do? Join me in London (UK) for a day, where I will give you tips and tricks and answer your questions about photography. We will arrange the day to take in interesting photo locations taking in street and travel-based photography in this glorious city. You will also receive your choice of 1no. signed limited edition 45 x 35 cm print with authenticating certificates. 

 

What's Next?

Ahead of me now is the proofing of the full suite of images to get them all ready for printing. The proofing and test printing process are crucial steps in the printing workflow that could make or break the final product. Very slight tweaks in aspect ratio could see essential elements of the image cropped from the overall image and spoil the final presentation.

There is also the biggest bane of a photographers life, color space. The colors you see on your digital viewing screen are not quite the same as the color space available by photographic printers, and so careful management of the color is required to get the final print as close to that seen on a digital screen. This is done through simulating the paper type and making fine-tune adjustments to the colors until there is a match, or as close as possible to the on-screen original.

I have already assessed the colours on the small test prints, but before I go to full print I need to order full-size artist proofs of each image to 100% validate the print quality. This could require multiple test prints until the image is right and poses a big risk to my project if I fail to get this right; I couldn't offer a product for sale if it was anything less than perfect. I am well-read on the subject of color space, have experience in printing and work with a world-class print lab, so I am confident that the final product will be of exceptional quality. 

All being well, I will be ordering the prints near the completion of the campaign, signing them and packing them ready to send to my supporters. I am hoping to have the final product in the hands of backer by early November, give or take a week or two. 

There is a chance that we don't hit the funding goal of course, but that's ok. This campaign is flexible, so regardless of the amount raised your reward will be honored. Failing to meet the funding goal will just mean that I have to scale back on the range of images included in this initial collection. Should any images from this collection not be chosen as rewards they'll be placed on the back burner to reduce my overall project cost in line with the total amount pledged. 

 

The work doesn't stop there...

 

When the campaign has run its course, my prints will go 'InDemand', so if you miss a chance to pledge during the funding process the images will still be offered for sale from this page. 

For me, I still have a lot of work to do! To launch the official sale of these prints  I will need to do a product photoshoot for each of the shots and create my listings ready to share to the world. I intend to sell these prints through my Esty store, social media and of course my personal website. I can see this process taking me up to Christmas this year, which if everything comes together will mean that I will meet the objective I set myself at the beginning of the year, and finally launch these limited edition prints! 

 

Thank You!

Thank you for taking the time to learn about my project. Time is precious, so the time you have given in learning about my story is greatly appreciated. 

If you can't contribute today, that's ok, I am humbled you have still come this far. You can still show your support by sharing this page with your travel buddies; Indiegogo has buttons right here to share on your favorite socials, it couldn't be easier and would go a long way! 

To keep up with my progress follow me on Facebook and Instagram where I will be posting regular updates on the project. 

If you have got any queries about the campaign, or my work, in general, please feel free to drop me a message and I'll get back to you ASAP. 

Happy travels!
story_txt:
Travel Inspired...
is a series of unique limited edition prints with a special purpose; to inspire the uninspired and show the uninitiated that their adventure is out there waiting for them.  I was once one of those people, but I can say with confidence that visiting new lands and cultures has changed my life, made me a better man, and the photographer I am today.  This passion I now seek to share with the world and fund this passion through the sale of my prints.
 
Travel is a gift!
A gift for all, but it's not always that obvious to some. I used to be one of those who believed that travel was a luxury reserved for other people but now, through my photography, I seek to inspire others to take up their own adventure and explore the world. To contribute towards my equipment costs, I have previously sold what you might call 'unmanaged prints'; but now for the first time, I am seeking to offer a collection of signed Limited Edition prints taken from my travel portfolio as I continue in my journey of personal discovery and adventure.
 
Istanbul is where it began...
For the past 4 years, I have been traveling the world falling ever so deeply in love with the excitement of visiting new worlds and the challenge of taking unique and original photographs that perfectly capture my time there. Inspired in 2015 by the wonders of Istanbul where East meets West, and armed with nothing more than a Samsung S6 smartphone, I was drawn into photography by a burning desire to capture more than just holiday snaps, and my passion for photography was ignited.
It was around this time that I had moved away from the music industry where I had been a creative for many years before, and had left a big hole in my life; photography and travel were a complete surprise for me and quickly filled the creative void left by my music.

Galata Tower​ Istanbul 2015
Five or six years ago, I would have considered travel to be something of pure luxury reserved only for other people and totally out of reach for someone like me. It wasn't until I met my partner who is very well-traveled and has exceptional abilities at planning and booking complex trips that my whole view of what a holiday could be. Once a fairly uncultured individual, I now want to inspire others to travel through my photography, showing people like the man I used to be that it is possible to enjoy these spectacular experiences.
From my humble beginnings with nothing more than a smartphone, I have been in a constant state of evolution in both my photography skills and the equipment I shoot with. Teaching myself through trial and error, watching hundreds, if not thousands, of YouTube videos and reading books and magazines on the subject. It has been a glorious yet often frustrating journey going from a mobile, to full manual; JPEG to RAW; a cropped sensor to full-frame. Entry camera bodies with kit lenses, to full-frame bodies with pro lenses; and long may the journey continue!
There have been two particular moments that stand out to me in the last couple of years where I have felt genuinely validated in what I do, and from these moments I take comfort in knowing that I am on the right path. Moments when I have found myself grinning with excitement and pleasure from the sheer fact of exploring a new land and taking on the challenge of capturing inspirational images. 
The first of these moments was in Havana last year. Arriving in any new destination does bring a sense of stress, not only from the physical act of traveling but then the pressure to start capturing interesting and unique images of a place I have never visited before. For a Londoner, Havana is a real shock to the senses and did take some time to adjust, but after the first sunrise, I couldn't help but feel an overwhelming sense of pleasure from being there with my camera. 

The Malecon - Havana 2018
The second was this year in Athens; stood upon the Acropolis shortly after opening with barely a soul in sight it felt like a photographers playground. Throughout my entire time in the Greek capital, I had an almost overwhelming sense of satisfaction as I explored the streets capturing the character and charm of this ancient city. 

Filopappou Hill, Athens - 2019
All the hard work in getting to these moments was worth it, even if it was just for the smile on my face. From an untraveled individual with nothing more than a smartphone, to the man I am today is the real journey, and I encourage all to find a similar journey for themselves. 
 
Taking the next step...
As the quality of my work improved, so did my confidence; it was time to find a platform to publicly display my work and offer prints for sale, and so around 2017 I launched my website with a built in store, and then subsequently an Etsy store as outlets to sell my work. This was when I started to print my work for the first time, opting to use Loxley Colour in Scotland as my chosen print lab, who I use to this day because of their exceptional quality. The experiencing of holding your image professionally printed is truly amazing. Being able to hold the image and feel the quality and see the depth in the print is a glorious conclusion to the photo-taking process.
Entering photography fairly late in life, and with the seemingly unstoppable rise of social media,  I knew that any real chances of being able to support myself from my photographic work were fairly nonexistent, but a more realistic goal would be to try and make my passion self funded. To this end, I have seen small successes through print on demand sales through Etsy, my website and an exhibition of my Asian portfolio in 2018, but compared to my costs to date, this is small change.

Exhibition 2018
This year, I vowed to take the commercial side of my photography more seriously; I am passionate about my work and my message, but I did recognize that my whole e-commerce strategy was amateur, and if I didn't take it seriously, then why should anyone else?  This was a serious question I had to answer, and through my blog posts 'How Not to Sell on Etsy' and 'J6 Etsy Store 2.0', I looked back on my previous selling experiences and explored a new direction. 
This led me to revise my business model; by introducing more structure I could see an opportunity to increase my exposure and saleability which intern should boost profits. My thinking was to flip my original print-on-demand model in favor of carefully selected limited edition prints for sale through my Etsy store, my website, and social media. Each print would be shipped with a signed certificate of authenticity which will add value and legitimacy to my work. I am also seeking to improve my postage and packaging by investing in a label printer and other items to improve the overall experience to prospective buyers.
This extra investment will see my work finished to a high standard and professionally packaged, significantly improving the overall buying experience. I want buyers to receive my print and feel entirely satisfied with their purchase, despite it being packed and shipped from my living room. 
This new business model will see my print costs reduced slightly, consequently increasing the profitability of each sale, but it does carry the risk that I am left financially exposed with a number of prints without homes to go to. To manage this risk, I will be holding a limited stock of each print, whilst at the same time maximizing the online exposure of the listings but without being too pushy, because nobody wants that. 
With so much enthusiasm surrounding the business relaunch, I forged ahead, but I was not anticipating the major setback that followed...
 
An unexpected challenge...
In March, Trouble one of our two much-loved cats was taken ill and spent a night at the vets for what was initially diagnosed to be a bout of sickness. Due to them being indoor cats, and my own naivety/stupidity, I had not taken out pet insurance and so was left to foot the large bill for his treatment. He made a quick recovery and so we thought we were in the clear, but this was not to last.
At the beginning of July, he was readmitted because he had stopped eating and became withdrawn, something totally out of character for him. He was eventually diagnosed by a specialist with Lymphoma and the bills began to rise sharply. Naturally, any thoughts of funding my photography at this crucial time were fading fast.

My Trouble Cub
Sadly, despite all our best efforts, Trouble was taken by his illness. This was a very difficult time and one that I was not expecting, and anything bar the essential was placed on hold. Financially I was struggling, and emotionally I was broken. 
To distract myself from this difficult time, I returned to my business plan and began to think of a new way of funding my project and realizing my goal. What if I could place the products into the hands of early supporters who are as passionate about my work and my journey as I am? These early purchases would help my project get back on track, while I am recovering from the financial fall out of Trouble's treatment. Potential backers (like you) could provide some much-needed support and in return, receive a specially selected piece of my work.
 
The Campaign
For this campaign, I have handpicked 7 unique images that were taken in well-known destinations, but have an air of mystery that forces the viewer to ask 'where was this taken?'. This combination of the familiar combined with an air of intrigue makes these images ideal statement pieces for your home. 
Here is the full range of images and the story behind them. For a full-size, hi-resolution version, click on the image to open a new tab.







Each edition will be printed on Fujicolor Professional DP II Lustre photographic paper, which combines the best of matt and gloss in one glorious product. The matt finish gives the print a unique feel and appearance whilst offering incredible depth in color, whilst maintaining a slight shine to the image without being too reflective like traditional gloss photographs. The prints are of exceptional quality and feel special in the hand. 
This edition will be strictly limited to 66 pieces for this size, and once they are gone, they are gone! Each print is signed and numbered by myself and shipped with a signed certificate of authenticity.

The prints are based around size ISO A3, the exact dimensions are as follows:
Image Size

39.5 x 29.5cm
15.5 x 11.5"

 
With Border

44.5 x 34.5cm
17.5 x 13.5"

story:
CelebrityVibe Corp. - a celebrity news photography company that focuses and brings to the public all the happenings in Hollywood ranging from celebrities parties,events, and award shows.

 

For a company founded less than two decades ago, CelebrityVibe has risen to what others on the industry might considered as its peak with the incorporation of a first-class delivery platform and a professional photography team - www.celebrityvibe.com

Being a top ranking photo agency and wire service in the entertainment niche CelebrityVibe Corp bears the prestigious responsibility of bringing coverage and captures of the mega events such as award nights, movies and television premieres, festivals, concerts and much more to the international platform, which it has been doing diligently over the years. These images from all of the top events attended by the CelebrityVibe Corp are not intended for personal use, as a matter of fact, they are being distributed to websites, newspapers, television programs, advertisements, and wireless applications around the globe.

CelebrityVibe features an immeasurable library that is filled to the brim with diverse content from Vanity Fair Oscar Party to Bill Clinton 65th Birthday, amfAR Charity Events to the Cannes Film Festivals alongside many others.

 

OUR TEAM AND OUR STORY

Selma Fonseca is a Brazilian born photo journalist and the author of countless Billboard Magazine articles and interviews with Yoko Ono, Kelsea Ballerini, One Republic, DJ Zedd, Big Sean, Wiz Khalifa, Ty Dolla $ign, Florida Georgia Line, DJ Steve Aoki and J. Sutta, to name a few. Whether at the Grammys or Oscar parties, award ceremonies, charity events, or aboard the biggest yachts, Selma is always with the most elite jet setters. Brazilian-Greek-American, born in São Paulo, Brazil, Selma has photographed and broken news stories for NY Daily News, People, Hello!, Daily Mail, TMZ, Access Hollywood, E! News, and Entertainment Tonight. She has met countless of Fame’s biggest and greatest, from Michael Jackson, Ben Affleck, Nicole Kidman, Tom Cruise, Paris Hilton, Michael Douglas, President Bill Clinton, Mick Jagger, Lionel Richie, Leonardo DiCaprio, Halle Berry to Pele, and many more. You can visit her website www.SelmaFonseca.com

 

Jeffery Dread, is a Haitian born event photographer and PoP Artist .  Jeffery worked as a taxi driver and to further supplement his cash inflow, he also doubles as a party promoter for some of the best night clubs in New York City and South Beach Miami. In the course of promoting shows for clubs, his side hustle career path brought him in contact with several A-list celebrities, the movers and shakers of the political scene as well as other dignitaries.

Not only do their paths cross, but, a spark was created and that spark was the foundation where the friendship of Jeffrey and the many celebrities he has encountered was built on.

Being an achiever, someone with big dreams, Jeffery wanted to do more with his life and, in the year 1999, all he wanted to do was document his unique lifestyle which was why he co-founded CelebrityVibe Corp.a celebrity photography company that focuses on and brings to the public all the happenings in town ranging from celebrity parties, to events, and award shows. This was no small feat and as at the time Jeffery decided to work on his idea with one other person, it was much of a big deal, a factor which brought about all the major magazines, newspapers, television networks as well as blogs all over the world to the table, they all wanted to have exclusive access to the photos Jeffery and his team had taken on those exclusive parties. Jeffery's efforts to document the life of some of the most popular people on the country brought global recognition to his country of origin - Haiti.

As an artist and philanthropist, Jeffery was commissioned by The Kennedy Family and The White House 

Jeffery Dread's artworks are unlike the ordinary ones that can be seen in regular places like the coffee shop across the street and the Pizza Hut, but his artworks adorn and sit graciously in the homes of celebrities like Jamie Foxx, Paris Hilton and Lionel Richie.

 

 

What does This funding mean for us?

A few of the many reasons why we are keen and hell bent on making donations towards people with cancer is the fact that my partner lost her sister to the terminal illness and her mom is currently undergoing treatment for the same terminal illness that killed the sister, this is the more reason why we have a big heart towards donating to cancer patients.

We are gearing this crowd funding campaign towards the publication of a photobook - Hollywood Exclusives Before Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Selfies"

 

 

This 25 page retrospective photobook is the creation of an effort to celebrate the company - www.celebrityvibe.com - 20th anniversary while also providing a highlight of all the major celebrity parties in Hollywood.

The logic behind this crowd funding is simple,ANYONE CAN GET FEATURED !

 

With hundreds of celebrities gracing our titles, and thousands of pictures from every major Celebrity event you can think of, you can imagine this photobook is no small milestone for us.

It doesn't matter if you are paying to have a picture of yourself in the book or you are paying to have your significant other or other people you deeply care about in it, what matters is the motive behind paying $99 to have them there. If you cannot find a reason to pay this money to have a picture of yourself or a loved one there, we'll give you some to think about; this book is a great valentine's day or birthday gift and, it is also a great way to give your loved ones a pleasant surprise for the bragging rights of having your picture or theirs in a book that features A-List American celebrities.

 

What do you get?

When you contribute towards this photobook you are not only paying to have a desired picture(s) in the photobook but you are also helping to celebrate a well-known digital photo agency as well as contributing to a greater cause such as helping women living with cancer in Haiti.

And of course you get to enjoy an array of exclusive perks featured on our Indiegogo campaign.

Also contributors enjoy unique perks:-

 

10% of all funds raised goes to helping Haiti through the Innovating Health International (IHI)

 

Innovating health international (IHI) is a non-profit based organization that is dedicated to the treatment of chronic diseases especially in women living in developing countries.

 

“Our plan to work with local partners is as a result of our intention to increase the access to treatment and education services for terminal diseases such as cancer, high blood pressure, diabetes and injuries.

“Our current projects towards achieving this goal include a Women's Cancer Centre, a large cancer awareness program, a pathology laboratory and aiding the conception of a National Comprehensive Cancer program.

“IHI has since its inception in June 2013 treated over 2000 women with breast cancer and the agency is currently implementing a program that will help detect and treat early cervical cancer, located at the 10 regional hospitals of Haiti. Through this program, we screened over 10000 women in 2018 and hope to screen more than 10,000 in 2019. With local partners, we have combined global health expertise with cutting edge design methods and practices to create a women’s cancer communication tool-kit for health workers.

“IHI has also designed an engagement curriculum to train health agents in Port-au-Prince which can then be replicated around the country. The tools can be viewed online at kanseayiti.com.  IHI and the Ministry of Health have opened the only public pathology lab outside of Port au Prince. IHI has completed the largest study in any low-income country to date on chronic disease, including epidemiology data on all the most prominent non-communicable diseases and their risk factors.  IHI is currently investigating the use of community-health workers to help patients better manage their diabetes.

“IHI is always in need of basic medical supplies like gloves, gauze, IV tubing, tape, etc and basic medications for pain, nausea, heartburn, and allergies. We also need specialized cancer equipment like core needle biopsies, LEEP generators, and colposcopies. We can always use volunteer surgeons who can help perform mastectomies, radical hysterectomies, and breast reconstruction. We are also asking volunteers to help train our local staff so the need will grow smaller over time.”

 

I believe that, with your compassion, willingness to help and sacrifice, together we can overcome anything we set our hearts on.

 

We've Come So Far

The crowdfunding is an important one because it helps to celebrate the concept of creation, not just any creation, but one that survived through thick and thin over the years. Most importantly, this photobook is to celebrate partnership with whom I started from scratch with, Selma Fonseca - www.selmafonseca.com and a great way to give back to give back to the less privileged women  in the Haiti societies who are suffering from terminal cancer, 10% of this crowdfunding turnout will be towards that cause.

 

 

By funding our photobook you will help give anyone who cares a golden opportunity to be part of Hollywood's history and show great human concern for a cause that has been helping to take care of women with cancer in Haiti!

 

Thank you for your support. If you are unable to donate please take a minute to Like and Share this on all of your social media platforms in order to help create awareness for the noble cause of treating women with cancer and celebrating an agency that stood the test of time - www.celebrityvibe.com.

Every little bit counts! We can't do this without your support!
story_txt: CelebrityVibe Corp. - a celebrity news photography company that focuses and brings to the public all the happenings in Hollywood ranging from celebrities parties,events, and award shows. For a company founded less than two decades ago, CelebrityVibe has risen to what others on the industry might considered as its peak with the incorporation of a first-class delivery platform and a professional photography team - www.celebrityvibe.comBeing a top ranking photo agency and wire service in the entertainment niche CelebrityVibe Corp bears the prestigious responsibility of bringing coverage and captures of the mega events such as award nights, movies and television premieres, festivals, concerts and much more to the international platform, which it has been doing diligently over the years. These images from all of the top events attended by the CelebrityVibe Corp are not intended for personal use, as a matter of fact, they are being distributed to websites, newspapers, television programs, advertisements, and wireless applications around the globe. CelebrityVibe features an immeasurable library that is filled to the brim with diverse content from Vanity Fair Oscar Party to Bill Clinton 65th Birthday, amfAR Charity Events to the Cannes Film Festivals alongside many others. OUR TEAM AND OUR STORYSelma Fonseca is a Brazilian born photo journalist and the author of countless Billboard Magazine articles and interviews with Yoko Ono, Kelsea Ballerini, One Republic, DJ Zedd, Big Sean, Wiz Khalifa, Ty Dolla $ign, Florida Georgia Line, DJ Steve Aoki and J. Sutta, to name a few. Whether at the Grammys or Oscar parties, award ceremonies, charity events, or aboard the biggest yachts, Selma is always with the most elite jet setters. Brazilian-Greek-American, born in São Paulo, Brazil, Selma has photographed and broken news stories for NY Daily News, People, Hello!, Daily Mail, TMZ, Access Hollywood, E! News, and Entertainment Tonight. She has met countless of Fame’s biggest and greatest, from Michael Jackson, Ben Affleck, Nicole Kidman, Tom Cruise, Paris Hilton, Michael Douglas, President Bill Clinton, Mick Jagger, Lionel Richie, Leonardo DiCaprio, Halle Berry to Pele, and many more. You can visit her website www.SelmaFonseca.com Jeffery Dread, is a Haitian born event photographer and PoP Artist .  Jeffery worked as a taxi driver and to further supplement his cash inflow, he also doubles as a party promoter for some of the best night clubs in New York City and South Beach Miami. In the course of promoting shows for clubs, his side hustle career path brought him in contact with several A-list celebrities, the movers and shakers of the political scene as well as other dignitaries. Not only do their paths cross, but, a spark was created and that spark was the foundation where the friendship of Jeffrey and the many celebrities he has encountered was built on. Being an achiever, someone with big dreams, Jeffery wanted to do more with his life and, in the year 1999, all he wanted to do was document his unique lifestyle which was why he co-founded CelebrityVibe Corp.a celebrity photography company that focuses on and brings to the public all the happenings in town ranging from celebrity parties, to events, and award shows. This was no small feat and as at the time Jeffery decided to work on his idea with one other person, it was much of a big deal, a factor which brought about all the major magazines, newspapers, television networks as well as blogs all over the world to the table, they all wanted to have exclusive access to the photos Jeffery and his team had taken on those exclusive parties. Jeffery's efforts to document the life of some of the most popular people on the country brought global recognition to his country of origin - Haiti. As an artist and philanthropist, Jeffery was commissioned by The Kennedy Family and The White House Jeffery Dread's artworks are unlike the ordinary ones that can be seen in regular places like the coffee shop across the street and the Pizza Hut, but his artworks adorn and sit graciously in the homes of celebrities like Jamie Foxx, Paris Hilton and Lionel Richie.  What does This funding mean for us?A few of the many reasons why we are keen and hell bent on making donations towards people with cancer is the fact that my partner lost her sister to the terminal illness and her mom is currently undergoing treatment for the same terminal illness that killed the sister, this is the more reason why we have a big heart towards donating to cancer patients.We are gearing this crowd funding campaign towards the publication of a photobook - Hollywood Exclusives Before Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Selfies"  This 25 page retrospective photobook is the creation of an effort to celebrate the company - www.celebrityvibe.com - 20th anniversary while also providing a highlight of all the major celebrity parties in Hollywood.The logic behind this crowd funding is simple,ANYONE CAN GET FEATURED ! With hundreds of celebrities gracing our titles, and thousands of pictures from every major Celebrity event you can think of, you can imagine this photobook is no small milestone for us.It doesn't matter if you are paying to have a picture of yourself in the book or you are paying to have your significant other or other people you deeply care about in it, what matters is the motive behind paying $99 to have them there. If you cannot find a reason to pay this money to have a picture of yourself or a loved one there, we'll give you some to think about; this book is a great valentine's day or birthday gift and, it is also a great way to give your loved ones a pleasant surprise for the bragging rights of having your picture or theirs in a book that features A-List American celebrities. What do you get?When you contribute towards this photobook you are not only paying to have a desired picture(s) in the photobook but you are also helping to celebrate a well-known digital photo agency as well as contributing to a greater cause such as helping women living with cancer in Haiti. And of course you get to enjoy an array of exclusive perks featured on our Indiegogo campaign.Also contributors enjoy unique perks:- 10% of all funds raised goes to helping Haiti through the Innovating Health International (IHI) Innovating health international (IHI) is a non-profit based organization that is dedicated to the treatment of chronic diseases especially in women living in developing countries. “Our plan to work with local partners is as a result of our intention to increase the access to treatment and education services for terminal diseases such as cancer, high blood pressure, diabetes and injuries.“Our current projects towards achieving this goal include a Women's Cancer Centre, a large cancer awareness program, a pathology laboratory and aiding the conception of a National Comprehensive Cancer program.“IHI has since its inception in June 2013 treated over 2000 women with breast cancer and the agency is currently implementing a program that will help detect and treat early cervical cancer, located at the 10 regional hospitals of Haiti. Through this program, we screened over 10000 women in 2018 and hope to screen more than 10,000 in 2019. With local partners, we have combined global health expertise with cutting edge design methods and practices to create a women’s cancer communication tool-kit for health workers. “IHI has also designed an engagement curriculum to train health agents in Port-au-Prince which can then be replicated around the country. The tools can be viewed online at kanseayiti.com.  IHI and the Ministry of Health have opened the only public pathology lab outside of Port au Prince. IHI has completed the largest study in any low-income country to date on chronic disease, including epidemiology data on all the most prominent non-communicable diseases and their risk factors.  IHI is currently investigating the use of community-health workers to help patients better manage their diabetes.“IHI is always in need of basic medical supplies like gloves, gauze, IV tubing, tape, etc and basic medications for pain, nausea, heartburn, and allergies. We also need specialized cancer equipment like core needle biopsies, LEEP generators, and colposcopies. We can always use volunteer surgeons who can help perform mastectomies, radical hysterectomies, and breast reconstruction. We are also asking volunteers to help train our local staff so the need will grow smaller over time.” I believe that, with your compassion, willingness to help and sacrifice, together we can overcome anything we set our hearts on. We've Come So FarThe crowdfunding is an important one because it helps to celebrate the concept of creation, not just any creation, but one that survived through thick and thin over the years. Most importantly, this photobook is to celebrate partnership with whom I started from scratch with, Selma Fonseca - www.selmafonseca.com and a great way to give back to give back to the less privileged women  in the Haiti societies who are suffering from terminal cancer, 10% of this crowdfunding turnout will be towards that cause.  By funding our photobook you will help give anyone who cares a golden opportunity to be part of Hollywood's history and show great human concern for a cause that has been helping to take care of women with cancer in Haiti! Thank you for your support. If you are unable to donate please take a minute to Like and Share this on all of your social media platforms in order to help create awareness for the noble cause of treating women with cancer and celebrating an agency that stood the test of time - www.celebrityvibe.com. Every little bit counts! We can't do this without your support!

story:
My name is Anna Drvnik and I have been taking pictures all my life. Mostly in my immediate surroundings. I have never had the urge to travel to seek inspiration and objects. They are all around me. People. I live for other people, for communicating and interacting. For pictures and storytelling.  And my eyes are never asleep.

This campaign is important to me because I want and need to finish this project and I truly believe that the workshop I have been invited to will guide me towards fulfillment.

With your help I can make my dreams come true. I will use the funding to cover the workshop fee and traveling costs to Paris and Smedsby in Värmland where the workshop sessions take place.

 

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise 4500€. I need 3500€ to cover the fee for the one-year workshop with photographers JH Engström and Margot Wallard. Between April 2018 and March 2019 I will complete my project Pogledaj me jednom nezno, a photo project about my Serbian family. About those who left and those who stayed.

I need an additional  1000€ for material costs, processing fees, perks and additional costs.

 

In exchange for your contribution I offer you:

- 10€ a pdf with a print of your choice from the project Pogledaj me jednom nezno

- 25€ a pdf with two prints of you choice from the project Pogledaj me jednom nezno

- 50€ a print on fine art paper from the project Pogledaj me jednom nezno

- 100€  2 prints  on fine art paper from the project Pogledaj me jednom nezno

- 500€ 3 prints on fine art paper from ANY of my photo projects on my homepage

- 1000€ 5 prints on fine art paper from ANY of my photo projects on my homepage

- 4000€ 5 prints on fine art paper from the project Pogledaj me jednom nezno `AND a Photoshoot of Your Choice

 

Feel free to pick the one that fits your eye and wallet.

 

What happens afterwards?

If I don´t reach my entire goal, the funds will go to finishing this project as well as I can with the resources I have.

If I reach more than my current goal, I will complete my project Pogledaj me jednom nezno and the additional funds will be used to support my work as a freelance photographer.

 

How you also can help

If you can´t contribute right now, you can still be part of the project by sharing this campaign among your friends. I would appreciate it very much.

 

Thank you,

Anna Drvnik

www.drvnik.com

story:
My project is to raise funds for a book that will include photographs, poetry and narrative text about our nation’s military burial sites, both here in the United States and abroad. With funds generated from the sale of the book, it is my intent to donate all profits to assist wounded veterans. Contributors will help in the creation of a book that will increase awareness of military sacrifices of the past, and will also offer measurable aid to today’s wounded veterans.

My goal is to raise $15,000 in order to finance two, possibly three trips abroad. I have already photographed numerous sites within the United States and hope to be able to include as many more as I can across Europe, North Africa, and the Far East. On top of my list are American cemeteries at Flanders Field, Normandy, Meuse Argonne, Tunis, and Manila.

For those who donate in support of this effort, I offer my sincere thanks and rewards, as listed to the right of this page.

Special thanks to Howard Silver for contributing to the production of the accompanying Sacred Remains video presentation. 

With your help and support, I will create a book that will generate awareness of military sacrifices of the past that will also offer measurable aid to today’s wounded veterans.

story:
Hello, my name is Barbara Barbieri and I’m not a professional photographer, but photography is my passion. For the past three years I have been photographing landscapes in the country where I live, and now my goal is to share that beauty in a photo book.

"Landscapes in Italy" will be a professionally designed and edited photo book created from my images of two italian regions: Tuscany and Emilia Romagna.

With your support, the book can be published and I will have the confidence to continue my project moving forward to others italian regions.

The budget

The budget has to cover the productions of the book, Indiegogo fee and bank charges, and partially postage costs: production and printing 60%, editing and promotion 20%, packaging and a part of postage costs 10%, Indiegogo Fees and bank charges 10%.

What do you get?

A gloss laminate soft cover book, 8.3 x 8.3 inches, printed on hight quality gloss coated paper, about 60-80 pages (depending on the selected photos), one photo per page.

Risks & Challenges

With the addition of new photos of this spring and this summer, the book will be edited at the end of august, ready to be printed on September and shipped by October.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution is important, and I am thankful for any help in getting the book published.

If you can't contribute monetarily, you can support the project by sharing it with your friends on social media, and even using the Indiegogo share tools right on this page! Thank you!

 

ITA

La bellezza è ovunque: possiamo trovare un piccolo paradiso nel luogo più improbabile, perché la bellezza nella natura ci circonda, nel mondo.
Il tuo contributo aiuterà a pubblicare un libro fotografico per condividere la bellezza naturale dell'Italia, a partire da Toscana ed Emilia Romagna.

Mi chiamo Barbara Barbieri, non sono un fotografo professionista ma la fotografia è la mia passione. Per tre anni ho fotografato paesaggi nei luoghi in cui vivo, ed ora il mio obiettivo è quello di condividere quella bellezza in un libro fotografico.
"Landscapes in Italy - Paesaggi in Italia" sarà un libro fotografico progettato e curato professionalmente, con le migliori foto che ho scattato in Toscana ed Emilia Romagna.
Con il tuo sostegno il libro potrà essere pubblicato, ed il progetto potrà continuare coinvolgendo le bellezze delle altre regioni italiane.

Il budget copre la produzione del libro, i compensi di Indiegogo, le tasse bancarie, ed in parte le spese per gli invii postali. In particolare: produzione e stampa per il 60%, editing e promozione per il 20%, packaging e parte delle spese postali per il 10%, compensi Indiegogo e tasse per un altro 10%.

Il libro sarà stampato in un pratico formato 21 x21, con copertina patinata lucida e morbida, e sarà fra le 60 e le 80 pagine, a seconda delle foto definitive selezionate (una foto per ogni pagina).

Con l'aggiunta di nuove foto di questa primavera e questa estate, il libro verrà redatto alla fine di agosto, pronto per essere stampato a settembre e spedito entro ottobre.

Ogni contributo è importante, se non puoi contribuire puoi sostenere il progetto condividendolo con i tuoi amici sui social media, anche utilizzando gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo, proprio in questa pagina! Grazie!

story:
LOOK INTO THE BOOK HERE 

 

Scrollen Sie bitte ganz nach unten für den deutschen Text, danke!

 

The Project

I am a photographer based in Cologne/Germany and have worked in the past 25 years as editorial and corporate photographer regulary for big magazines as GEO, Time-Magazine, Stern, Chrismon, Die Zeit, Der Spiegel and others. During my professional career, I´ve won some great and prestigious prices, like a World Press Photo Award in 2007.

I have seen a lot of interesting places and people but one place never let go of my mind: Auroville, a small town, almost hidden in the south Indian jungle. A place in this world of turmoil, dedicated to peace and progressive harmony with over 3.000 citizens from more than 50 nations living together. No town mayor, no police. Almost like an anarchy. Why do people leave their homelands, burn bridges to start a new life in a new society? How is it to be born and grow up in Auroville. Is youth there like it is in the West? And: what has been achieved in the 50 years since it´s foundation 1968? Can we learn from the Aurovilians? And, if so, what?

So I came to the conclusion, that a simple magazine story on the City Of Dawn doesn´ t do it justice. The complexity of lives there just cannot fit into a couple of doublepages. 

So I knew, I had to make a book. A book that works on different layers: emotion, understanding, questioning. to tell a riddle but not completely solve it.

I have portrayed around 25 Aurovilians and listened to their stories, their ideas about society and the goods and bads in their intentional community. Is there something we can learn from them? The portraits and the transcribed interviews will be in the book. Like Marissa and Andy, whom´s video you can see here.

The photos will also be accompanied by texts and reportages by the authors Joerg Heuer, Peter Brinkemper, Maddy Crowell and others. Some straight, some funny or intellectual.

To create a physical book is so much more complex and expensive than taking pictures. You need people that want to get paid: translators, graphic designers, editors and publishers. Unless they are really crazy for you, they do it... for money. A graphic-designer and layouter will charge around 3.000 Euros, the translator for some texts another 1.000-1.500 Euros. Printing costs will be 6.000 Euros. And last not least, Indiegogo also takes it´s share of  5% from all the money that comes in.

This book is important as it can make Auroville known to a much broader audience as it has now. Most books on Auroville have been made for a too small group of readers. 

"Good Morning Auroville" will have 200+ pages, with around 125 photographs plus texts, a size of about 20x30cm and will be a joy to look at. The selection of photos, texts and layout are 80% ready. Some excerpts of the dummy you can see here (the final book will look a bit different):

"GOOD MORNING AUROVILLE" PROTOTYPE   (you might have to click away some advertising from issuu)

By helping me to finance the designing and printing costs of this book you will create a reading tool to get deeper into the structures and layers of a society difficult to understand for an outsider. As this book is made to reach many international readers for the best price possible so far it will only be available in english language.

 

What you give and what you´ll get

If you give money, you´ll get something in return. A simple book or a special collector´s edition with all the bells and whistles. Some of the perks seem to be very expensive, but all of them will finance the high costs of producing the book. And most of them will not be on sale afterwards, like the special editions and their content (beside the book itself).

At the end you´ll get something more beside holding some paper in your hands. You´ll get the feeling, that it was also you that made this possible. Not just by your name possibly printed in the book. But because of KNOWING!

 

The Chances

In their own words Auroville is the place the earth needs. I wouldn´t say that about my upcoming book. But the world needs to know about this place. And about the chances to live a different life successfully. This book is a medium to reach out by not trying to teach. It´s a book about dedicated people and the place they have created by themselves through 50 years of struggle and hard work.

Some years back I have successfully crowdfunded another book together with 8 other photographers. It´s interesting how much energy, how much input and discussion arises out of such a campaign. How a crowd can be involved and interact and participate. This alone is an adventure!

 

The Risks

What are the risks in supporting my bookproject? I have worked hard the last two years on this project, travelled to Auroville three times and stayed there for three months. I burn for making "Good Morning Auroville" this year, as it is the most beautiful and complete project I´ve ever photographed. And the process of making the book is in a stage of no return!  My project has gained already a great audience  and reputation. It has won the 1st price at Kolga Photofestival in "Concept Photography" category 2017 and was shortlisted on two major photobook-dummy-awards. Now, with the real book, this road will come to a good end. 

 

Other ways to help getting "Good Morning Auroville" published

If you don´t have any funds for backing this project, but still like it: there is still something you can do! Speak with others about it, share this Indiegogo campaign to people I cannot reach out to. Visit my blog at the-last-utopia.com and check the news there. There will be a lot of information coming up, little videos and outtakes and more. Share, and you also share about Auroville. You can use the tools of Indiegogo for this easily.

Thanks a lot and thank you for support, sharing your thoughts and input with me! Specially to you people from Auroville, whom I came across. There is no place on earth, where conversations are so heartwarming and honest!

 

What happens next

This campaign will be finished mid April. The following two months I will work with a graphic designer on the final layout, text typo, book materials, cover etc. Then the printing process will start, first some tests to check the colors, the quality of all stuff and then the final bookprints early August. From then on everything will be shipped, which takes carrier time. You will be informed about every stage of this bookmaking process through Indiegogo, my newsletter and the-last-utopia.com blog. Feel free anytime to ask questions through david@the-last-utopia.com

Thank you so much for the time you ve spend reading all this.

 

What does "Good Morning Auroville" mean?

You might have asked yourself, what does this book-title mean? A greeting? A wakeup call?

In fact it is a quote from Johnny, one of Auroville´s oldest and best known citizens, famous for a lot of things. In the early years of the City Of Dawn, when there were no schools, some children asked him to teach them. He began by doing theater exercises, called "Good Morning Auroville". The kids from then on came very morning. And so their school started.

It´s all about learning....

Here you can see a virtual reality 360 degrees video of Johnny rehearing a theatre play last year. If you move the PC mouse (with the left button down) in the picture, you can scroll the perspective.

...............................................................................................................................................................

>>>>   DEUTSCHE VERSION  <<<<

Ich bin seit 25 Jahren Fotograf für Magazine, wie GEO, Stern, Der Spiegel, Die Zeit, Chrismon u. a. In dieser Zeit habe ich viele interessante Menschen und Geschichten gesehen und auch ein paar schöne Preise gewonnen, wie 2007 einen World Press Photo Award.

Ein Ort dieser Welt liess mich jedoch niemals wirklich los: Auroville, ein Dorf, fast versteckt im südindischen Dschungel Tamil Nadus. Ein Platz in dieser unruhigen Welt, dem Frieden und der progressiven Harmonie gewidmet, in dem 3.000 Menschen aus über 50 Nationen zusammen leben. In losen Strukturen. Ohne Bürgermeister, und Polizei. Fast wie in einer Anarchie. Was bringt Menschen dazu, ihre Heimat zu verlassen, Brücken abzubrechen, um in einer neuen Gesellschaft ein völlig anderes Leben zu führen? Wie ist es, in Auroville geboren zu sein und dort aufzuwachsen? Ist die Jugend eine andere als die im Westen? Und, was wurde nach den 50 Jahren seit der Gründung 1968 erreicht? Können wir von den Aurovilianern lernen? Falls, ja, was? Ich kam zu dem Schluss, dass eine Magazin-Story mit enigen Doppelseiten nicht ausreicht, um die Komplexität dieser Gesellschaft und ihrer Bewohner zu erzählen.

Eine aktuelle Veröffentlichung von mir und Jörg Heuer aus dem CHRISMON Magazin sehen Sie hier.

Ich wusste also, ich muss ein Fotobuch machen. Ein Buch, welches auf verschiedenen Ebenen funktioniert: Emotion, Fragen, Verständnis. Das ein Rätsel erzählt, ohne die Lösung zu präsentieren.

Während meiner Reisen nach Auroville habe ich u.a. etwa 25 Aurovilianer porträtiert und ihre Geschichten aufgezeichnet. Ihre Ideen über die Gesellschaft und die Pros und Contras einer intentionellen Gesellschaft. Was können wir von ihnen lernen? Die Portraits und die transkribierten Interviews sind im Buch. So wie von Marissa - geboren in Auroville - die hier in einem Video zu sehen und zu hören ist.

Die Fotos werden ausserdem durch Texte von Jörg Heuer, Maddy Crowell und Peter Brinkemper begleitet.

Ein richtiges Buch zu produzieren ist wesentlich komplexer, als eine Fotostory zu machen. Es gibt einige Leute, die bezahlt werden müssen: Übersetzer, Graphiuk-Designer, Buchdrucker, Verleger. Wenn sie nicht gerade absolut verrückt sind, machen sie es gerne... für Geld. Ein Designer berechnet etwa 3.000 Euro, der Übersetzer um die 1.000-1.500 Euro, die Druckerei um die 6.000 Euro. Und, auch Indiegogo nimmt 5% von den Einnahmen, die hier entstehen.

Dieses Buch ist wichtig, denn es macht Auroville einem viel grösseren Kreis bekannt, als die bisherigen Publikationen. "Good Morning Auroville" wird 200-220 Seiten Umfang haben, ein Format von ca 20x30 cm und wunderschön. Die Auswahl der Fotos, das Layout und Texte sind bereits zu 80% fertig. Das Buch wird anders aussehen, als der Dummy/Prototyp, den ich letztes Jahr produziert habe. Hier sehen Sie einige Auszüge aus dem Entwurf. (eventuell müssen Sie erst die Werbung auf issuu wegklicken).

Durch Ihre Hilfe, die Buch zu produzieren, entsteht ein Lese-Werkzeug, das Einblicke schafft in eine Gesellschaft, deren komplexe Strukturen und Ebenen für einen Outsider schwer verständlich sind. Aus Kostengründen, und um eine möglichst grosse Leserschaft zu erreichen, ist das Buch in englischer Sprache.  Einige Texte sind aber, wie oben beschrieben, für deutsche Kunden in einem Begleitheft zusätzlich in deutsch abgedruckt.

Was Sie geben, was Sie bekommen

Sie spenden nicht, Sie bekommen etwas für Ihr Geld. Entweder das Buch (signiert und mit Stempel), oder eine Sammler Edition mit Prints und diesem oder jenem. Manche dieser Perks scheinen sehr teuer, aber sie alle finanzieren die Gesamtproduktion von "Good Morning Auroville" Und diese Extras sind später im Handel nicht zu kaufen.

Am Ende haben Sie etwas in Ihren Händen, das mehr ist, als nur Papier. Sie halten das Gefühl, dass Sie das alles mölich gemacht haben. Nicht nur, weil eventuell Ihr Name im Buch gedruckt ist. Sondern, weil Sie WISSEN!

Die Chancen

In den eigenen Worten ist Auroville der Ort, den die Welt braucht. Über mein Buch würde ich nicht unbedingt das gleiche sagen. Aber die Welt sollte von Auroville erfahren. Über die Chancen, erfolgreich ein alternatives Leben zu führen. Dieses Buch ist ein Medium, das Menschen erreicht, ohne sie zu belehren. Ein Buch, das den Menschen gewidmet ist, die seit 50 Jahren hart an ihrer Vison von Gemeinschaft arbeiten.

Vor einigen Jahren habe ich mit 8 Fotografen ein anderes Projekt erfolgreich über Crowdfunding finanziert. Es ist spannend, wie viel Energie, wieviel Input und Diskussion aus einem solchen Projekt entstehen. Wie die Crowd mitmacht, teilnimmt und interagiert. Das alleine ist schon ein Abenteuer!

Die Risiken

Welches sind die Risiken, mein Projekt zu unterstützen? Ich habe die letzten 2 Jahre hart daran gearbeitet, bin dreimal für insgesamt ca. 3 Monate nach Auroville gereist. Ich brenne, "Good Morning Auroville" als Buch dieses Jahr fertig zu stellen. Es ist das grösste und schönste Projekt, das ich bisher fotografiert habe. Und es gibt keine Rückkehr, Der Prototyp war 2017 auf zwei grossen Fotobuchfestivals in der Shortlist der besten Dummies (Kassel und Wien), die Arbeit wurde 2017 beim Kolga Tbilisi Photofestival als bestes "Conceptual Photography" Projekt ausgezeichnet. Weitere Ausstellungen folgten 2017 und auch dieses Jahr. Mit dem fertigen Buch ist ein guter Teilabschnitt deses Weges beendet.

Wie kann man "Good Morning Auroville" ohne Geld unterstützen?

Wenn Sie kein Geld haben, mein Proojekt zu unterstützen, es Ihnen aber dennoch gefällt, können Sie auch etwas für mich tun: Teilen Sie diese Information, diese Aktion auf Indiegogo, meinen Auroville-Photobuch-Blog oder tragen Sie sich in meinen Newsletter ein und leiten ihn weiter. Ich alleine kann nicht Alle ereichen, die ein Interesse an diesem Buch haben.

Vielen Dank! Für Ihre Hilfe, Unterstützung, Ihren Rat und Teilnahme. Auch an die Aurovilianer, die ich traf und mich mit ihrer Kommunikationsfreude und Offenheit immer wieder überrascht haben.

Was passiert dann?

Diese Crowdfunding Kampagne endet Mitte April. Die kommenden 2 Monate arbeite ich dann mit Graphikdesigner und anderen zusammen, um das Buch fertig zu stellen. Testprints beim Drucker und Anfang August sollten spätestens die Exemplare fertig zur Auslieferung sein. Sie werden über die Entwicklung des Crowdfundings und alle anderen Stadien informiert, auf dieser Seite oder über meinen Newsletter und Blog. Schreiben Sie mir gerne auch eine Mail unter david@the-last-utopia.com.

Danke für die Zeit und Ihr Interesse!

Warum der Titel "Good Morning Auroville"?

Vielleicht haben Sie sich schon gefragt, was dieser Titel bedeutet? Ein Gruss an die Stadt der Morgenröte? Ein Weckruf? Es stammt von einem Zitat Johnny´s, einer von Aurovilles ersten und bekanntesten Bewohnern. Bekannt für viele Dinge und mit einem feinen australischen Humor gesegnet. In den frühen Jahren Aurovilles, als es noch keine Schulen gab, kamen einige Kinder zu ihm, die unterrichtet werden wollten. Er begann mit Theaterstücken, die er "Good Morning Auroville" nannte. Von da an kamen die Kinder jeden Morgen. Und so begann die Schule.

Es geht ums Lernen....

Hier sehen Sie ein 360 Grad Virtual Reality Video von Johnny, der letztes Jahr ein neues Theaterstück mit Kindern übte. Wenn Sie die PC Maus mit gedrückter linker Taste durch das Bild ziehen, können Sie die Perspektive frei wählen.
story_txt:
LOOK INTO THE BOOK HERE 
 
Scrollen Sie bitte ganz nach unten für den deutschen Text, danke!
 
The Project

I am a photographer based in Cologne/Germany and have worked in the past 25 years as editorial and corporate photographer regulary for big magazines as GEO, Time-Magazine, Stern, Chrismon, Die Zeit, Der Spiegel and others. During my professional career, I´ve won some great and prestigious prices, like a World Press Photo Award in 2007.
I have seen a lot of interesting places and people but one place never let go of my mind: Auroville, a small town, almost hidden in the south Indian jungle. A place in this world of turmoil, dedicated to peace and progressive harmony with over 3.000 citizens from more than 50 nations living together. No town mayor, no police. Almost like an anarchy. Why do people leave their homelands, burn bridges to start a new life in a new society? How is it to be born and grow up in Auroville. Is youth there like it is in the West? And: what has been achieved in the 50 years since it´s foundation 1968? Can we learn from the Aurovilians? And, if so, what?
So I came to the conclusion, that a simple magazine story on the City Of Dawn doesn´ t do it justice. The complexity of lives there just cannot fit into a couple of doublepages. 
So I knew, I had to make a book. A book that works on different layers: emotion, understanding, questioning. to tell a riddle but not completely solve it.
I have portrayed around 25 Aurovilians and listened to their stories, their ideas about society and the goods and bads in their intentional community. Is there something we can learn from them? The portraits and the transcribed interviews will be in the book. Like Marissa and Andy, whom´s video you can see here.
The photos will also be accompanied by texts and reportages by the authors Joerg Heuer, Peter Brinkemper, Maddy Crowell and others. Some straight, some funny or intellectual.
To create a physical book is so much more complex and expensive than taking pictures. You need people that want to get paid: translators, graphic designers, editors and publishers. Unless they are really crazy for you, they do it... for money. A graphic-designer and layouter will charge around 3.000 Euros, the translator for some texts another 1.000-1.500 Euros. Printing costs will be 6.000 Euros. And last not least, Indiegogo also takes it´s share of  5% from all the money that comes in.
This book is important as it can make Auroville known to a much broader audience as it has now. Most books on Auroville have been made for a too small group of readers. 
"Good Morning Auroville" will have 200+ pages, with around 125 photographs plus texts, a size of about 20x30cm and will be a joy to look at. The selection of photos, texts and layout are 80% ready. Some excerpts of the dummy you can see here (the final book will look a bit different):
"GOOD MORNING AUROVILLE" PROTOTYPE   (you might have to click away some advertising from issuu)
By helping me to finance the designing and printing costs of this book you will create a reading tool to get deeper into the structures and layers of a society difficult to understand for an outsider. As this book is made to reach many international readers for the best price possible so far it will only be available in english language. What you give and what you´ll get

If you give money, you´ll get something in return. A simple book or a special collector´s edition with all the bells and whistles. Some of the perks seem to be very expensive, but all of them will finance the high costs of producing the book. And most of them will not be on sale afterwards, like the special editions and their content (beside the book itself).
At the end you´ll get something more beside holding some paper in your hands. You´ll get the feeling, that it was also you that made this possible. Not just by your name possibly printed in the book. But because of KNOWING!
 
The Chances

In their own words Auroville is the place the earth needs. I wouldn´t say that about my upcoming book. But the world needs to know about this place. And about the chances to live a different life successfully. This book is a medium to reach out by not trying to teach. It´s a book about dedicated people and the place they have created by themselves through 50 years of struggle and hard work.
Some years back I have successfully crowdfunded another book together with 8 other photographers. It´s interesting how much energy, how much input and discussion arises out of such a campaign. How a crowd can be involved and interact and participate. This alone is an adventure!
 
The Risks
What are the risks in supporting my bookproject? I have worked hard the last two years on this project, travelled to Auroville three times and stayed there for three months. I burn for making "Good Morning Auroville" this year, as it is the most beautiful and complete project I´ve ever photographed. And the process of making the book is in a stage of no return!  My project has gained already a great audience  and reputation. It has won the 1st price at Kolga Photofestival in "Concept Photography" category 2017 and was shortlisted on two major photobook-dummy-awards. Now, with the real book, this road will come to a good end.  
Other ways to help getting "Good Morning Auroville" published

If you don´t have any funds for backing this project, but still like it: there is still something you can do! Speak with others about it, share this Indiegogo campaign to people I cannot reach out to. Visit my blog at the-last-utopia.com and check the news there. There will be a lot of information coming up, little videos and outtakes and more. Share, and you also share about Auroville. You can use the tools of Indiegogo for this easily.
Thanks a lot and thank you for support, sharing your thoughts and input with me! Specially to you people from Auroville, whom I came across. There is no place on earth, where conversations are so heartwarming and honest!
 
What happens next

This campaign will be finished mid April. The following two months I will work with a graphic designer on the final layout, text typo, book materials, cover etc. Then the printing process will start, first some tests to check the colors, the quality of all stuff and then the final bookprints early August. From then on everything will be shipped, which takes carrier time. You will be informed about every stage of this bookmaking process through Indiegogo, my newsletter and the-last-utopia.com blog. Feel free anytime to ask questions through david@the-last-utopia.com
Thank you so much for the time you ve spend reading all this.
 
What does "Good Morning Auroville" mean?

You might have asked yourself, what does this book-title mean? A greeting? A wakeup call?
In fact it is a quote from Johnny, one of Auroville´s oldest and best known citizens, famous for a lot of things. In the early years of the City Of Dawn, when there were no schools, some children asked him to teach them. He began by doing theater exercises, called "Good Morning Auroville". The kids from then on came very morning. And so their school started.
It´s all about learning....
Here you can see a virtual reality 360 degrees video of Johnny rehearing a theatre play last year. If you move the PC mouse (with the left button down) in the picture, you can scroll the perspective.
...............................................................................................................................................................
>>>>   DEUTSCHE VERSION  <<<<
