story:
My name is Barbara Diener and I am an artist, mainly working in lens-based media. I hold a BFA from the California College of the Arts and an MFA from Columbia College Chicago, both in Photography. My work has been widely exhibited and book-making has been in integral part of my artistic practice. I am currently the Collection Manager in the Department of Photography at the Art Institute of Chicago and teach photography at Oakton Community College and the School of the Art Institute of Chicago.

Last fall I met with Michael Itkoff, co-founder of Daylight Books and he saw the potential of turning my body of work Phantom Power into a book. As you may know finding a publisher to produce a beautiful and well-crafted photography book is only half the battle. The artist is expected to contribute a significant amount of their own money and that is why I am asking for your help. For more information about Phantom Power, please read my project statement below or visit my website:

http://www.barbaradienerphotography.com/phantom-power/

For the past year I have been working with Daylight Books to publish Phantom Power. We are currently in the midst of designing, editing and sequencing and the book will be released in June 2018.

This campaign is an excellent way to pre-order the book, as a signed copy is one of the perks for your contribution. Furthermore you can receive limited edition fine prints of my photographs.

Your contribution is crucial and offsetting to this fundraising campaign and it will go directly to Daylight Books towards the cost of production.

If you are not able to make a financial contribution but still want to support this campaign, spread the word and please use Indiegogo's share tools to publish it on your various social media sites.

Phantom Power

In my previous work I photographed in small, rural towns that triggered childhood memories. During that process I met and became fascinated with a woman named Kathy. She owns the diner in town and lives on her husband’s family farm, which is haunted by his ancestors. Her belief in the spectral sparked my own interest in the unexplained and ties back to my ongoing curiosity about religion, spirituality and the human desire to believe that something else happens after we die and that a part of us, the spirit or soul, continues on.

The camera is a crucial tool for most paranormal investigators, so it was a natural step for me to become an amateur ghost hunter myself. Photography has been linked to the spirit world since the 1860s with the popularity of spirit photography and post-mortem portraits. Since its invention photography has lent a sense of immortality to its subjects. In recent years the paranormal received amplified media attention through numerous 'reality' television programs that sensationalized any experiences for the camera. On the contrary my approach is self-reflective and curious. To make the resulting images I adopt both traditional and contemporary approaches of capturing the invisible, as well as my own interpretation of the magical and mystical.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sophia Callisto and I am here to introduce you to my project, Music Empowering Women: A Photographic Anthology!! Thank you for taking the time out of your day to learn what this project is all about!

First and foremost, a little bit about myself! I am a wife and mother of three (all girls) and my family and I currently reside in New Mexico. I am a photographer and makeup artist who also works in theatre and performing arts and additionally has background in corrections and social work. Like many others, I am also a fan of music of all kinds, and of Phish, which is, as you may be able to guess, a large part of what has led me to creating this project and, ultimately, this campaign.

On my way home from Phish at Dicks Sporting Goods Park last September with my husband, I began developing this idea and just a few short months later, it is beginning to come to life with almost ONE HUNDRED women already involved! So, what exactly is Music Empowering Women: A Photographic Anthology? Well, let me tell you!!

In its final form, Music Empowering Women: A Photographic Anthology will be a coffee table style book that celebrates the beauty of community and seeks to empower women through music, specifically through the Phish FAN community which is what has brought us all together. In my own love of music, I have found an incredible and close-knit community of amazing people that share this common interest. This book will feature over 100 women portraying related themes and sharing what this music and this community means to them. It is meant to be sexy, but classy with no nudity, and will feature female fans from all around the country, as well as artists and vendors of various types who will be featured alongside the models. All of the creative concepts are my own and I will be traveling to multiple locations throughout the U.S. to meet with the women involved and do each photo shoot. I will personally be doing all the photography as well as styling, hair and makeup for each shoot. As of this time, over 40 shoots have been completely outlined and I am in the process of outlining the remaining themes and getting them paired with each model in preparation to complete them. At its conception, I only ever imagined up to around 50 women being involved, but since then the number has grown significantly due to an outpouring of support and interest in the project. And because of the momentum we have propelling us at this point, now is exactly right time to be launching our crowdfunding campaign!
 

What We Need & What You Get

I know. I’ve set my goal high. I want to raise $10,000. To me, $10,000 is a LOT of money, which is why I’ve gone back and forth endlessly on whether or not I should try to fund it one piece at a time or just kind of go for it and…go big or go home, as they say, so I’m shooting for the stars here! This goal would enable us to complete this project in its entirety, so if it could be reached we would be able to complete it from start to finish, including publication! After talking to some others involved in the project and really breaking down that number and considering what it would take in terms of crowdfunding to reach that goal, we decided this was the right move.

So, here’s the breakdown.

How many people would it take to reach this huge goal and completely fund this project?

Breaking it down into the low average of donation increments, it would take…

400 people donating $25

200 people donating $50

or 100 people donating $100!

And here’s what this funding is going to help us do:

Funding in the first phase of the project will be used for three primary costs: props and costuming, travel and equipment.   

  • Props and Costuming: Many props and costumes will be provided but there are also some very specific things that are needed for each shoot; props and costumes will be streamlined as much as possible so that items can be used multiple times in any instances possible to save on cost. No shoot will cost more than $100 in its entirety and most are significantly lower.
     
  • Travel: Primary travel cost will be airfare and/or ground travel to multiple shoot locations throughout the United States, with some local transportation costs in each location and the possibility of hotel expense should the need arise, though we are focusing on limiting accommodations needed in every way possible. 
     
  • Equipment: While I have all the necessary basic equipment to be able to complete the project, there are a couple of items that I would like to be able to utilize to significantly improve the quality of the final product. These items include:
    • A laptop or tablet that will allow me to function easily on the go both at shoots and between. I already have all the editing software I will be using, but need a portable device to be able to complete these tasks as needed.
    • A wireless camera remote.
    • Portable light reflector.
    • Basic studio lighting set up with backdrop stand, plain backdrop and soft box lights.
    • Hair and makeup necessities; this is specifically in reference to eyeliner and mascara that will be used for each model because these items cannot be shared or reused with more than one person for safety purposes as well as the possibility of needing a range of foundation colors and a couple of simple but good quality hair styling tools.

Note: Equipment is being considered the third tier of importance in terms of what this funding will be used towards. While I will ultimately use funding if there are necessary items that I cannot otherwise obtain, I am working towards obtaining them outside of this funding. That said, I am absolutely open to donations of any equipment items on the list of needs, as well as airline miles for travel if this is something someone has available to utilize as a non-monetary donation. If someone has one of these items that they would be willing to donate, please feel free to contact me about that specifically!

The second phase of the project will be publication, marketing and some distribution. I already have a source aligned for this phase of the project. It will include running a test copy of the final publication, initial print run with copies for all those who will immediately receive one (models, partner project donors and several key community members), online distribution through multiple channels including Amazon and Barnes & Noble, shipping costs and all necessary social media marketing for successful distribution of the publication.

So, what do you get out of donating to this project?

Besides supporting this amazing group of women and the satisfaction of knowing you are helping create something incredible and being able to see it come to fruition, there are some awesome perks for you to look forward to as a contributor! This includes everything from personalized thank you's, recognition in the book and funder updates throughout the project to signed copies of the book and special gifts from our sets! Every dollar helps towards ensuring that we have the appropriate resources we need to make this project a reality!
 

Risks & Challenges

While this project is all about positivity and I don’t really believe there are any risks associated, there may be a couple of challenges and I do want to briefly address what those challenges are and how those challenges will be addressed along the way.

  • Amount of Work to be Completed: This project involves a lot of work and because it is a huge undertaking, there are many steps to get it from start to finish. The process involves planning and outlining, obtaining all necessary items to complete each shoot, traveling and working with each model to complete their shoot, processing and editing images and preparing them for publication, designing and editing publication and publication and marketing. As the person who conceptualized this project and who will be completing it entirely, this amount of work could potentially become overwhelming. To overcome this, I am trying to be overly organized and take the project one step at a time to ensure that I am not trying to tackle too many tasks as one time. In addition, if funding were to allow, I could potentially utilize an assistant to help with the execution of shoots and possibly with other aspects of the project.
     
  • Coordinating Travel: Coordinating travel with over 100 women to complete over 100 individual photo shoots can be a daunting task. If funding for travel is not an issue, this is overcome simply by communicating with those involved to coordinate when these shoots can be completed. At this time, to coordinate all aspects of this project, we are working through a private Facebook group, email and phone if and when necessary, so we have very thorough routes of communication and will continue to utilize these throughout the entirety of this project.

Ultimately, having funding available is the number one thing that will help to overcome the challenges in this process because it means the resource is available for completing each task.
 

The Impact

The difference that your contribution to this project will make is absolutely enormous, but it is not the difference of this project happening or not happening. I believe in this project and will complete it no matter how long it takes or what challenges I face along the way. However, your contribution plays an enormous role in the success of this project because COMMUNITY is its entire foundation. So, through your contribution, what impact are you really helping us make in this community?

You are helping support the empowerment of women from all backgrounds; women who are mothers and who are teachers and who are entrepreneurs and who are artists. Women who are unique. Women who are strong. Women who are role models. You are helping us shatter glass ceilings. And while we are shattering glass ceilings, you are helping us shatter stereotypes not only about women but about who all the people in this community really are!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that you may want to support the project but cannot contribute financially. You are among the most important of our supporters because what you can do is the largest component to successfully funding the project: SPREAD THE WORD! Use the share tools and make some noise about our campaign!

Thank you for taking the time out of your day to learn what this project is all about!First and foremost, a little bit about myself! I am a wife and mother of three (all girls) and my family and I currently reside in New Mexico. I am a photographer and makeup artist who also works in theatre and performing arts and additionally has background in corrections and social work. story:
Bitte scrollen Sie bis ans Ende des Englischen Textes für die Deutsche Übersetzung!

HEMP; A PLANT TO SAVE THE HUMAN RACE FROM ITSELF?

I believe that there is a strong correlation between the well-being of our planet and our own existence. As a photographer I am observing the devastating environmental development and started documenting the hemp plant, which has empowered concerned people worldwide, to take action.

Hemp’s capacity to clean polluted soil, remove high quantities of carbon dioxide from the atmosphere and grow without the use of pesticides, makes it the ideal plant for an already stressed environment facing population growth. Understanding that it provides us with biodegradable, nontoxic raw-material for food, medication, building material and textiles, is a fundamental step towards a more sustainable future.

My greater goal with publishing this book is to further educate a wider audience about Cannabis Sativa, which is hemp's botanical name. It is ignorance and propaganda that has made hemp the world's most forbidden plant. I truly hope my book will break some of the myths surrounding this controversial plant.


WHY HEMP? 

The lack of knowledge about this plant is caused by more than 70 years of prohibition. During this time, hemp was reduced to a drug. “Marijuana“, focusing only on the negative side of its psychoactive ingredient THC (tetrahydrocannabinol), all the positive attributes were forgotten. What most people do not know is that hemp and cannabis are the same thing. What differentiates industrial hemp from recreational cannabis is the THC content.

Here are some hard-facts to consider when we take a look at industrial hemp:
















HOW WILL THIS BOOK MAKE A DIFFERENCE?

Words can speak to our conscious minds and when they sound too good, we don’t want to believe them. Hemp is one of those plants that has virtually endless applications, which sometimes makes it difficult to grasp is multi-functionality. That is why I have travelled 17 countries, so far, to find visual proof to spread the word about hemp.

To make this project possible I terminated my lease 2,5 years ago and made the car my new home. Since, I‘ve driven through large parts of Europe and beyond, documenting the work of the hemp pioneers growing the crop for food, textile and building materials, meanwhile discovering the positive side-effects on the environment. Also I am portraying the young, yet thriving industries which are starting to build up around the plant. Its versatile use can easily get very confusing to onlookers, who get discouraged by the complexity of the products that follow the simple act of cultivating hemp.

The book is seeking answers to the many questions we have about hemp and cannabis, which are left unanswered by the widely spread media, which still tends to confuse facts and give one-sided reports on the plant.

My quest is to make a holistic and honest statement about hemp, that will include all parts from its history, prohibition and industrial use, to medicinal and leisure. This is a visually compelling and an emotionally strong photographed documentation. My personal field reports will be backed by expert voices from the industry, who have formulated scientific texts, broken down to readable content.


Hemp harvest from Hempfortex in North China.


WHAT WILL THE BOOK LOOK LIKE?

“Hemp: Seed for a new world“ is the current working title of the book. The anticipated date of publication is set for early 2020.

The format will contain;

- Approximately 270 pages, printed on environmentally friendly paper and sandwiched between a hemp paper cover and ornamental pages.

- Besides the ecologically friendly version with only partial use of hemp paper, there will also be a collectors limited edition. This will be a handprinted book on hemp paper from cover to back of the book.

Even though this will be an incredibly expensive book, it will be proof that there is no industry that is excluded from becoming truly green. We just need to create more demand for hemp paper, in this case, to get more affordable prices again.

In order to make this book, partially and entirely out of hemp, I am happy to announce the collaboration with Europe's only manufacturer for commercially-printable hemp paper, Gmund.

My ambition is to find the most sustainable and environmentally friendly way to produce this book.

 



As bookmaking is already a very expensive undertaking, this book will put me on the edge of the possible. I still have a long list of countries, which offer exclusive insights on how to use hemp industrially and for medicinal purposes. As I am still self-financing the project, I don’t want to run the risk of having to cut corners at the end of the production.

That is why I'm asking for your monetary help, so I could visit the places below for the book:



By preordering your copy of the book now by using the "perk" section, you can secure some special offers, only available during the crowdfunding-campaign, and help me buffer some of the high costs of self-publication in advance. 

THE PERKS

I hope that you are now enthusiastic enough about hemp to support my project. On the upper right side of this crowdfunding-campaign you can check out the different perks and bundles to support the project.

The limited edition photography print will be printed on a Fine Art archival paper, size 28x21 cm, and will be signed and personally checked before shipping out to you!

If you can’t purchase a perk, but are savvy on social-media you can always contribute by sharing the link to the crowdfunding campaign with all your friends and supporters. Also if you happened to live in any of the countries I wish to visit and can offer a couch, I will be very grateful.

Let's make hemp grow worldwide again!


IT FEELS GOOD TO SAY THANK YOU!

On a project of this length and scope as my hemp project, one is solo on the trips and behind the camera, but never alone!

It is for the open doors and this friendly welcomes amongst the “hemp-community“ worldwide, that I was able to explore in remote regions of 17 countries so far. The help that I have been offered ranged from safe places to park my car, all the way to offering me insight into the world of hemp, cannabis and marijuana. It took equally trust from the industries making final products from industrial hemp, as for an individual showing me their illegally grown indoor plantation of marijuana. Though all aspects are adding up to the whole story I am telling.

Therefore a huge and humble THANK YOU to all of you, who became part of my story, and ultimately also a part of my life!

Having a sponsor like F-stop backing me with an international support-network and great equipment wherever I am, is a blessing. Thank you to f-stop and the pro-ambassador team!




 

Amongst the many people guiding me through the final stage of getting the crowdfunding-campaign up and running, I want to reach out to the Swedish production team, Guerilla Tactics Entertainment for help on the concept and Chris Westerström for making a slick film from all the individual material I brought back from all the trips.



 


WHO AM I: MAREN KRINGS?

After all the pitching it is only fair of me to introduce myself.

I am a German-born photographer, with tendencies to be a global nomad. I studied photography at the Savannah College of Art and Design in Georgia, US. Meanwhile I was spending a significant amount of time in Panama for my thesis work, which triggered my profound interest in social documentary photography.

                                    

I have been working as a freelance photographer since 2004, with base-camps in Germany, Austria and lately Sweden. Since 2012 I have published three books, with focus on the Austrian Alps and mountain lifestyle and contributed work for several more institutions internationally.

I work on commission in the field of sustainability, outdoor and industrial photography and get my work published in international magazines such as Servus, Outdoor Magazin, NORR, Suston, Bergwelten and Runners World.

If you want to follow my work, or this project, please click any of the links below:

  Website     |     Facebook     |     Instagram     |     Twitter     |     LinkedIn

 

DEUTSCH • GERMAN • ALLEMANDE • ALEMAN

 

HANF: SAMEN FÜR EINE NEUE WELT

(Dies ist der Arbeitstitel für das bis Anfang 2020 entstehende Buch zum Thema).

Eine investigative Fotodokumentation über die ökologischen, sozialen und politischen Auswirkungen der Hanf-Pflanze von der Fotografin Maren Krings.

Hanf hat die Menschheit seit ihrer Entstehung begleitet. Es gehörte zur Normalität des menschlichen Daseins das wir uns von Hanf ernährten, uns darin kleideten und ihn zum Bauen unserer Häuser nutzten. Genauso wie er uns als Medizin und psychoaktive Substanz diente.

 

HANF; Eine Pflanze, welche die Menschheit vor sich selber schützt?

Ich bin davon überzeugt das es eine starke Beziehung zwischen dem Wohlergehen unseres Planeten und unserer eigenen Existenz gibt.

Als Fotografin beobachte ich die verheerende ökologische Entwicklung und habe mich daher der Dokumentation der Hanf-Pflanze gewidmet. Diese hat weltweit Menschen befähigt dem Raubbau an unserem Planeten entgegen zu wirken. Hanf kann verschmutze Böden reinigen, hohe Mengen Co2 aus der Atmosphäre binden und wächst ohne die Anwendung von Herbiziden oder Pestiziden. Das alles macht ihn zu einer optimalen Pflanze, die den Druck auf unseren Planeten, durch eine wachsende Bevölkerung verringern kann.

Das Wissen wieder zu verbreiten, das Hanf ein ungiftiger, biologisch abbaubarer Rohstoff ist, den wir für Nahrung, Medizin, Baumaterial und Textil verwenden können, ist die Basis für eine nachhaltigere Zukunft. Dazu ist ein Blick auf die Geschichte von Cannabis Sativa (botanischer Name) nötig und die Aufklärung darüber, wie Hanf zu der verbotensten Pflanze der Welt werden konnte.

Viele der Mythen über die Hanf-Pflanze sind in den knapp 70 Jahren Prohibition entstanden, in denen Hanf nahezu komplett auf die Droge Marihuana reduziert wurde. Der Fokus galt alleine der psychoaktiven Substanz THC (Tetrahydrocannabinol). Alle anderen Bestandteile und Nutzungsmöglichkeiten der Pflanze wurden schlichtweg verschwiegen und vergessen.

Somit ist kaum Wissen über den Unterschied zwischen Nutzhanf und Cannabis/Marihuana vorhanden. Wohl sind die Pflanzen Cousins, aber der große Unterschied liegt im THC Gehalt, welcher in der Nutzhanf-Pflanze kaum vorhanden ist.

Seit 2,5 Jahren bereise ich die Welt und habe inspirierende Projekte von Hanfpionieren dokumentiert. Die Portraits zeichnen ein aktuelles Bild über die vielfachen Nutzungsmöglichkeiten der Pflanze und die vielen Bereiche in denen Hanf zur Verbesserung der Umwelt industriell eingesetzt werden kann.

 

 

Ein paar Fakten zu Maren Krings

Maren Krings ist freischaffende Fotografin und Künstlerin, mit Standorten in Deutschland, Österreich und Schweden. Ihr Fokus liegt auf der Dokumentation von Projekten im Bereich Umwelt und Nachhaltigkeit.

Nebst drei Bildbänden über den Tiroler Alpenraum und Lifestyle arbeitet Maren viel im Auftrag fürinternationale Magazine wie Servus in Stadt und Land, Outdoor Magazin, NORR, Suston, Bergwelten und Runners World.

Im Bereich Dokumentar-, Werbung- und Industrie-Fotografie zählen einige der folgenden Firmen zu ihren Kunden:

Doppelmayr – Garaventa, CAPAROL / CAPATECT,

Tirol Werbung, Hempfortex, Messe München – ISPO,

Tyrolia Verlag, Löwenzahn Verlag, Motorpresse

Stuttgart, Deutsche Zentrale für Tourismus und viele mehr.

Kontakt:

Maren Krings

+43 664 1208 779

info@marenkrings.com

www.marenkrings.com

This will be a handprinted book on hemp paper from cover to back of the book.Even though this will be an incredibly expensive book, it will be proof that there is no industry that is excluded from becoming truly green. We just need to create more demand for hemp paper, in this case, to get more affordable prices again.In order to make this book, partially and entirely out of hemp, I am happy to announce the collaboration with Europe's only manufacturer for commercially-printable hemp paper, Gmund.My ambition is to find the most sustainable and environmentally friendly way to produce this book. As bookmaking is already a very expensive undertaking, this book will put me on the edge of the possible. I still have a long list of countries, which offer exclusive insights on how to use hemp industrially and for medicinal purposes. As I am still self-financing the project, I don’t want to run the risk of having to cut corners at the end of the production.That is why I'm asking for your monetary help, so I could visit the places below for the book:By preordering your copy of the book now by using the "perk" section, you can secure some special offers, only available during the crowdfunding-campaign, and help me buffer some of the high costs of self-publication in advance. THE PERKSI hope that you are now enthusiastic enough about hemp to support my project. On the upper right side of this crowdfunding-campaign you can check out the different perks and bundles to support the project.The limited edition photography print will be printed on a Fine Art archival paper, size 28x21 cm, and will be signed and personally checked before shipping out to you!If you can’t purchase a perk, but are savvy on social-media you can always contribute by sharing the link to the crowdfunding campaign with all your friends and supporters. Also if you happened to live in any of the countries I wish to visit and can offer a couch, I will be very grateful.Let's make hemp grow worldwide again!IT FEELS GOOD TO SAY THANK YOU!On a project of this length and scope as my hemp project, one is solo on the trips and behind the camera, but never alone!It is for the open doors and this friendly welcomes amongst the “hemp-community“ worldwide, that I was able to explore in remote regions of 17 countries so far. The help that I have been offered ranged from safe places to park my car, all the way to offering me insight into the world of hemp, cannabis and marijuana. It took equally trust from the industries making final products from industrial hemp, as for an individual showing me their illegally grown indoor plantation of marijuana. Though all aspects are adding up to the whole story I am telling.Therefore a huge and humble THANK YOU to all of you, who became part of my story, and ultimately also a part of my life!Having a sponsor like F-stop backing me with an international support-network and great equipment wherever I am, is a blessing. Thank you to f-stop and the pro-ambassador team! Amongst the many people guiding me through the final stage of getting the crowdfunding-campaign up and running, I want to reach out to the Swedish production team, Guerilla Tactics Entertainment for help on the concept and Chris Westerström for making a slick film from all the individual material I brought back from all the trips. WHO AM I: MAREN KRINGS?After all the pitching it is only fair of me to introduce myself.I am a German-born photographer, with tendencies to be a global nomad. I studied photography at the Savannah College of Art and Design in Georgia, US. Meanwhile I was spending a significant amount of time in Panama for my thesis work, which triggered my profound interest in social documentary photography.                                     I have been working as a freelance photographer since 2004, with base-camps in Germany, Austria and lately Sweden. Since 2012 I have published three books, with focus on the Austrian Alps and mountain lifestyle and contributed work for several more institutions internationally.I work on commission in the field of sustainability, outdoor and industrial photography and get my work published in international magazines such as Servus, Outdoor Magazin, NORR, Suston, Bergwelten and Runners World.If you want to follow my work, or this project, please click any of the links below:  Website     |     Facebook     |     Instagram     |     Twitter     |     LinkedIn DEUTSCH • GERMAN • ALLEMANDE • ALEMAN HANF: SAMEN FÜR EINE NEUE WELT(Dies ist der Arbeitstitel für das bis Anfang 2020 entstehende Buch zum Thema).Eine investigative Fotodokumentation über die ökologischen, sozialen und politischen Auswirkungen der Hanf-Pflanze von der Fotografin Maren Krings.Hanf hat die Menschheit seit ihrer Entstehung begleitet. Es gehörte zur Normalität des menschlichen Daseins das wir uns von Hanf ernährten, uns darin kleideten und ihn zum Bauen unserer Häuser nutzten. Genauso wie er uns als Medizin und psychoaktive Substanz diente. HANF; Eine Pflanze, welche die Menschheit vor sich selber schützt?Ich bin davon überzeugt das es eine starke Beziehung zwischen dem Wohlergehen unseres Planeten und unserer eigenen Existenz gibt.Als Fotografin beobachte ich die verheerende ökologische Entwicklung und habe mich daher der Dokumentation der Hanf-Pflanze gewidmet. Diese hat weltweit Menschen befähigt dem Raubbau an unserem Planeten entgegen zu wirken. Hanf kann verschmutze Böden reinigen, hohe Mengen Co2 aus der Atmosphäre binden und wächst ohne die Anwendung von Herbiziden oder Pestiziden. Das alles macht ihn zu einer optimalen Pflanze, die den Druck auf unseren Planeten, durch eine wachsende Bevölkerung verringern kann.Das Wissen wieder zu verbreiten, das Hanf ein ungiftiger, biologisch abbaubarer Rohstoff ist, den wir für Nahrung, Medizin, Baumaterial und Textil verwenden können, ist die Basis für eine nachhaltigere Zukunft. Dazu ist ein Blick auf die Geschichte von Cannabis Sativa (botanischer Name) nötig und die Aufklärung darüber, wie Hanf zu der verbotensten Pflanze der Welt werden konnte.Viele der Mythen über die Hanf-Pflanze sind in den knapp 70 Jahren Prohibition entstanden, in denen Hanf nahezu komplett auf die Droge Marihuana reduziert wurde. Der Fokus galt alleine der psychoaktiven Substanz THC (Tetrahydrocannabinol). Alle anderen Bestandteile und Nutzungsmöglichkeiten der Pflanze wurden schlichtweg verschwiegen und vergessen.Somit ist kaum Wissen über den Unterschied zwischen Nutzhanf und Cannabis/Marihuana vorhanden. Wohl sind die Pflanzen Cousins, aber der große Unterschied liegt im THC Gehalt, welcher in der Nutzhanf-Pflanze kaum vorhanden ist.Seit 2,5 Jahren bereise ich die Welt und habe inspirierende Projekte von Hanfpionieren dokumentiert. Die Portraits zeichnen ein aktuelles Bild über die vielfachen Nutzungsmöglichkeiten der Pflanze und die vielen Bereiche in denen Hanf zur Verbesserung der Umwelt industriell eingesetzt werden kann.  Ein paar Fakten zu Maren KringsMaren Krings ist freischaffende Fotografin und Künstlerin, mit Standorten in Deutschland, Österreich und Schweden. Ihr Fokus liegt auf der Dokumentation von Projekten im Bereich Umwelt und Nachhaltigkeit.Nebst drei Bildbänden über den Tiroler Alpenraum und Lifestyle arbeitet Maren viel im Auftrag fürinternationale Magazine wie Servus in Stadt und Land, Outdoor Magazin, NORR, Suston, Bergwelten und Runners World.Im Bereich Dokumentar-, Werbung- und Industrie-Fotografie zählen einige der folgenden Firmen zu ihren Kunden:Doppelmayr – Garaventa, CAPAROL / CAPATECT,Tirol Werbung, Hempfortex, Messe München – ISPO,Tyrolia Verlag, Löwenzahn Verlag, MotorpresseStuttgart, Deutsche Zentrale für Tourismus und viele mehr.Kontakt:Maren Krings+43 664 1208 779info@marenkrings.comwww.marenkrings.com

story:
The story behind the book

Fifty years ago the province of Almería, in the far southeastern corner of Spain, came to refer to itself as “The Movie Capitol of the World.” International stars – Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Peter O’Toole, Clint Eastwood, and many others—passed through the barren landscape. During the 1960s and 1970s film directors sought to manipulate the otherwise uninhabitable landscape in order to create a world more imaginary than real. Films shot here include Cleopatra, Lawrence of Arabia, Patton, and Sergio Leone’s spaghetti westerns starring Clint Eastwood. But the aura of Hollywood glamour was mostly fiction, part of a massive public relations campaign from the dictatorship of Francisco Franco to change the world’s image of Spain. Today, some of the old film sets remain, partially preserved in the desert, as ghostly relics of a forgotten era, providing seemingly tangible evidence of human settlements that never really existed. 

As a photographer, I became fascinated by these old film sets and locations as a different kind of “ghost town.” Unlike real ghost towns, the Western movie sets were never inhabited and never served as living communities. They are a fiction, constructed solely for the movies, and while some have been abandoned, others have taken on new lives as tourist destinations themselves.

The book

Once Upon a Time in Almería: The Legacy of Hollywood in Spain
Photographs by Mark Parascandola
Essay by Alex Cox
10 x 12 | approx 150 pages with 70 color images
Coming Fall 2017 from Daylight Books

Fifty years ago the province Almería, a remote corner of Spain, was on the verge of becoming the next Hollywood.

'Once Upon a Time in Almería' depicts the legacy of the self-proclaimed “The Movie Capital of the World.” International stars—Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton, Peter O’Toole, Clint Eastwood, and many others—passed through the barren landscape. The photographs take the stance that the aura of Hollywood glamour was mostly fiction.

Mark Parascandola is a fine art photographer based in Washington DC and Almeria, Spain. A PhD epidemiologist by training, he uses photography to explore the interactions between human populations and the environment over time. He was awarded an Individual Artist Fellowship from the DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities 2014, Finalist for the Sondheim Prize 2011, and Finalist for Critical Mass 2015. Mark’s first photo book Carabanchel was released in 2014. Website: www.parascandola.com

Alex Cox is a British film director, screenwriter, and nonfiction author.

Your Support

The reality of photobook publishing these days is that photographers are expected to raise some portion of the funds for book production. This is the standard model, even with major photobook publishers, because of the high cost that goes into design and production of a high quality photobook. Daylight is a successful publisher with an outstanding design team. The funds I am raising through the Indiegogo campaign will go towards covering my portion of the production costs. 

Your generous contribution to this campaign will directly involve you in the production of my photobook and will help me publish the first edition of "Once Upon a Time in Almería" set for release in the fall of 2017. My deepest gratitude for your interest in this project. I hope that you will support the campaign by becoming a backer and choosing one of the rewards as well as sharing it with others!

Who am I?

I am a fine art photographer based in Washington DC who uses photography to explore patterns of change among human populations, focusing on architecture as evidence of often-invisible social, environmental, and economic processes.

What has drawn me back to Almería over the years is the fact that I have a personal connection to Almería since my mother’s family left many years ago to immigrate to United States in the 1920s. When I was younger, we explored the old western sets on family trips, taking photographs, enacting a mock hanging in the gallows or sitting on a stuntman’s horse. Friends and family members tell stories of working in the movies, helping to build sets, sew costumes or even appearing as extras. I grew up listening to my grandmothers’ stories of life in rural Spain, she told me stories of growing up in her village in the deserts of Almería, which seemed distant and otherworldly to me.

Sadly, the Almería she knew is mostly gone. The old film locations are relics from another time when Almería was a very different place. I was motivated to pursue this project, at least in part, to connect with this place and with my family’s origins. But these ruins also serve as a reminder of the impermanence of our ties to the landscape, and as evidence of the economic and social changes that drive human migration, including that of my own family. And today these false landmarks have themselves become tourist attractions, adding another layer to this multi-layered myth.

story:
Il Viaggio


A marzo 2016 sono partito  con alcuni compagni ed amici per un viaggio fotografico in Abruzzo, durante il quale ho potuto riscoprire un paesaggio dimenticato, eredità della precedente cultura contadina. Poco alla volta, ascoltando e leggendo le tracce sul panorama della nostra terra, è venuto fuori un percorso alla riscoperta di questi echi lontani della civiltà precedente all'industrializzazione: quella dei nostri avi prima della guerra e dei grandi terremoti che hanno distrutto il nostro territorio. Le foto raccontano una civiltà ancora a contatto con la natura, che viveva di economie di sussistenza, una civiltà il quale sapere era legato alla vita e al quotidiano. Dopo aver compreso  ed interiorizzato queste tracce, ho deciso di farne un progetto fotografico e di metterlo in mostra. 

 La mostra 


"Lo spirito e l'abbandono" è una mostra fotografica: racconta l'Abruzzo abbandonato, quello della vecchia civiltà contadina che viveva a cavallo con il ventesimo secolo. Lo fa raccontando due sentimenti: il sentimento dell'abbandono - sensazione della fine delle cose - e il sentimento dello spirito - la ricerca dell'eterno - . Un percorso che va dalla terra al cielo, alla riscoperta di un eco, della memoria dell'antico contatto con una natura selvaggia e incontaminata, con un cristianesimo che assomiglia al paganesimo dei riti misterici, attraverso una serie di fotografie in giro per i paesi e le terre abbandonate d'Abruzzo.

Dodici fotografie si succederanno in una sorta di Via Mariana, di pellegrinaggio sacro alla riscoperta della memoria dell'antico popolo abruzzese: ad esse saranno affiancate scatti più piccoli, dettagli, didascalie e piccoli sentieri che sviano dal percorso maggiore. Alla fine della mostra, un'installazione rievocherà l'oblio di certe fisionomie, certi volti e tratti della nostra vecchia famiglia. 

 Dove, quando, come!


La mostra si svolgerà il 24, 25 e 26 Giugno al Museo delle Genti d'Abruzzo, in Via delle Caserme, a Pescara, nell'antica location delle Prigioni Borboniche. 

L'invito alla mostra può essere ottenuto partecipando a questa raccolta fondi.

 La raccolta


Per sostenere le spese di stampa, allestimento, affitto dei locali e materiale grafico ho bisogno dell'aiuto di chi vorrà visitare e partecipare all'evento. Ma la raccolta fondi non sarà gratuita: ad ogni investimento corrisponderà un'adeguata ricompensa. 

Potrete ricevere l'invito alla mostra, avere in visione privata il mio film o la raccolta di poesie e racconti del Varco, avere il catalogo e le foto della mostra da riportare a casa.

Ringrazio i miei compagni di viaggio, in particolare Marco Crispano per il suo appoggio fondamentale, ma anche Stefano Perletta, Marco Cirillo, Lorena Florio, Stefano Fusari, Pasquale Scarano, Jacopo Masini, Andrea Ricci e Paolo Mattioli. Con loro ho condiviso questo lungo percorso e quest'esperienza fondamentale.  

Ringrazio anche voi anticipatamente e spero di poter contare su di voi per poter costruire un evento bello e artisticamente valido.  La mostra verrà prodotta da Il Varco, che vi invito a seguire su facebook.

Ringrazio anche voi anticipatamente e spero di poter contare su di voi per poter costruire un evento bello e artisticamente valido.  La mostra verrà prodotta da Il Varco, che vi invito a seguire su facebook.

story:
About Us 

Blurred Borders  is an artist-led initiative and exhibition founded by three photographers working in the documentary, fashion and fine art field. We want to shed light on the printed image as a physical object and explore new ways of displaying photography. 


What Moves Us 

Caught in a net of digital information, borders of traditional photography have become blurred. Tactile romanticism and the splendour of the printed image are often forgotten. Using both old and new techniques, we would like to explore new ways of perceiving a photograph while turning the photographic medium inside out. 

The Exhibition 

We believe that the relationship between space and its photographic representation is an important factor. We want to break the rules of one-point perspective and illustrate the beauty of being able to touch and see the image as a physical object. Therefore we want to experiment with different ways of displaying conceptual, printed and material work in a physical space. Through organizing exhibitions, publications and talks we are investigating how we can provide meaning to image- making in contemporary society while embracing the physicality of the photographic art form.

Why We Need Your Help

The printed image is an essential part of this exhibition, and we need your help in bringing our images to life. We would really appreciate your support in helping us cover the costs of the exhibition space and printing so that everyone who attends has a memorable experience.


The Perks 

Take a look at the right sight of the page of our unique rewards that we offer for each person that donates. 


Who We Are  


   

Kovi Konowiecki 

After pursuing a career in football, Kovi brings a unique perspective to the photography world. His work lies between documentary and fine art photography, often focusing on portraiture and telling stories that reveal his identity. Kovi’s photographs are also largely driven by his experiences of growing up in Los Angeles.



Roos van de Kieft 

Roos is a photographer from the Netherlands. Fascinated by the experience of our physical selves and the way human bodies create space, Roos creates dynamic, evocative photographs. Her moving forms bring a new dimension to (fashion) imagery, encouraging viewers to experience each shot from different angles. 


Otto Masters

Otto's captivating imagery blends fashion, portraiture, fine art, and documentary photography. He is currently working in collaboration with fine artist 'The Line Girl' to explore the notions of the human form and the relationship this holds with the physical environment.


Other Ways To Help Us  

Financial support is not always possible and we understand that-- but there are other ways you can help us reach our goal. By simply sharing this page, you will be helping us out a great deal. Tell your friends, families, coworkers, and companies that the cause for our exhibition is worth sharing. 

Feel free to check out the Facebook event for news and updates here: 
https://www.facebook.com/events/172186381802530...

For further information, questions or sponsorships you can contact us at blurredbordersphoto@gmail.com

(poster design by Lennarts & de Bruijn www.lennartsendebruijn.com)


Opening Night Thusday 9 June 2016, 6-9 pm

Friday 10 June - Sunday 12 June 2016, 12-6 pm

www.71alondon.com


A HUGE THANKS FROM ALL OF US FOR YOUR TIME AND SUPORT. SEE YOU AT THE EXHIBITION!
